(Wish friends RSVPd better so I could have reserved the bigger room) But glad they all came because it sure felt like we were HOT sardines in that room!! The day I found out we had 16-18, it was too late... LOL then I guess their AC broke, but that didn't really make us stop the crazy Performances and the Soju, Beers, and shots just kept coming. I liked their shot menu, because you can actually pick which type of Hennesy you wanted. Not like other places that just charges you $10 for cheap drinks.   But the owner and the waiters were really nice to us, probably because we were Really nice to them. That at the end, they felt bad that our AC failed (oh they gave us a Fan that totally helped and one of my friends used as a prop in her performance) and that a lot of our orders got backed up, that they comped us a lot of food/drinks. The bill was surprisingly lower than I thought.   Regardless of all the bad things, this place was REALLY fun and totally worth it. Oh the Yogurt Soju is a must!! I will be back to this place and trying other soju's too!!

SXfvHWScLghzoTSBqb_e6w.review_text: overrrrrrpriced. i went with a group of about 18 or so, and they get props for accomodating us since it's a small space. they explained they were shortstaffed that night so it took awhile for us to get our drinks and for my friend to order some food, but i get how it goes. i didn't eat any so i don't remember the actual price, but the champpong was like 13$ or something? wtf?   25$ for a "large" soju.. which is really just like half milkis or whatever flavor you get and half soju, maybe even less. trust me, that shit doesn't cost much to make haha. granted, it is very yummy [we tried the yogurt, mango, and strawberry soju] butttttttttt soju's only 20-30 something percent alcohol so you're not getting alot of bang for your buck.   maybe i just drink too much, but i didn't get too buzzed or anything and i just realized we didn't get the corn appetizer that everyone talks about =[ it's a fun experience if you're with a large group, but overall i don't think i'd make a point to go back.

lCmvpQfFpdxhbWVM59eUCg.review_text: LOVE the Soy Garlic fried Chicken here! SO good.  There was a spicy seafood noodle that we got which was HUGE and very good too.  The cheese corn was ridiculously yummy and was one of the free korean apps.  I thought the prices were pretty reasonable since the portions were Huge.  The ambience is definitely more bar than restaurant, but i'd come here for the food and not really the karaoke the karaoke room was kinda old and cheesy and...dirty?  Anyway. would come back here for the food for sure

zSLVUcFSpMYFWT7FxT1J6g.review_text: Crazy.  Korean.  Boisterous.  The above three words may all be synonyms, but it's true: Playground is the place to go when you're happy, when you're sad, or when you just want to get plain out of control!  I've had a good deal of the menu here, but my go-to is still the jap chae when sober, and the fried chicken when I've had one too many yogurt sojus!    Speaking of yogurt soju, this stuff is like liquid candy that takes you to a very very happy place!  Good times all around!  A little bit chaotic/out-of-control at busy late night hours, but who's counting!?  Know Before You Go: 1. karaoke also available upstairs - THESE GO RIDIC FAST!  Sometimes you have to reserve a few days in advance, or, if you're interested in same day, you might end up getting a 12 AM reservation....and ain't nothin' wrong with that!  2. a bit pricey: average $15 for an entree.  share with a friend\

oRk_Rl8rBjvtPnidHpcgeg.review_text: Um...  Stephie has a lot of problems with this place.  The food was good.  She got the cold buckwheat noodles.  She really flippin loves cold noodles (even though it was a cold night).  Um... but she paid $12 for noodles.  Um... sure there was other stuff but Stephie isn't sure how they came up with $12 for the dish.  I know white people are probably completely unaware about how much asian noodles cost.  Pssst.... they're pretty flippin cheap!  Go see for yourself at an asian market.  Was it the cucumber???  The lettuce???  The poorly dressed staff???  The PAPER napkin???  Are they trying to make more money to dress up the place because it feels under decorated.  Flowers, more art, that shit needs something.  Candles on the table???  I dunno.  Um.... Stephie wants a REAL napkin at dinner, btw.  THANKS.  And can she not have to cringe at the guy in the super duper faded t-shirt that is too small for him???  None of this would've mattered if she didn't just pay $12 for noodles.  Mikey's food wasn't as ridiculously overpriced, but his octopus was not that good.  It was the bad chewy, not the good chewy.  Stephies noodles were good, but they were just noodles.  They were just too much.... OK, you get it, right?  Sorry.  The rest of the plates with more on them were much much more.  The YAKULT and alcohol thing was amazing to Stephie, but she wonders why they didn't know what YAKULT was.  They knew it only as yogurt.    Basically the place does not equal the price.  That's the only complaint.  Word of advice if you're gunna hit this place up anyway.... watch them make your drink.  They will try to skimp on the alcohol.  Just look them dead in the eye and politely ask for more.  Because you are an alcoholic after-all, which makes you no fool when it comes to that shit.  Right San Francisco???!!!  Right.

xObzTAC6gsFH6XKhc9yRYQ.review_text: Do you like embarrassing yourself? If you do that means you too like Karaoke. Someone once told me "Karaoke" is Japanese for "tone-def"   "Playground" must be English, for "Haven" I get it, I get it, this place is THE spot for after work, socializing,  and happy-hour antics.  Playground tries to create a relaxed and "playful" environment,  with three exclusive karaoke rooms and traditional Korean kim-chi kissing foods!  I'm a sucker for "Soju", if you haven't had it, you are missing  the grand taste of "Angels tears" (yeah, it taste like that)  I love the "Yogurt Soju, The Lichee, and yeah even the Soju bombs". It's a decent place to pregame for lawless nights in the city. Korean foods and curries, are amazing, the help and wait staff is friendly.   Here's what I got:  "KALB" which is the, Korean short ribs marinated in a house soy sauce. and "KANPOONG SAEWOO" which is deep fried prawns battered in a sweet & spicy garlic sauce... it was spicier than I envisioned.   Just because I'm "nosy" like that, I peeked over and even saw some dishes with octopus and steamed buns, and other stuff, which would make you want to explore the menu more. The staff was friendly enough to explain the dishes... and I was courageous and daring enough to eat them!  I think my favorite part of this place, Is WATCHING THE KOREAN MUSIC VIDEOS ON THE SCREEN while it is being projected on a wall above!  C'mon you know your addicted to Korean Dramas too! ;)

aFO_yCma7PImpdPkA8ZC-A.review_text: This Playground is one for the grown-ups and it's definitely a cool place, with friendly staff, to hang out with your friends and engage in hours of inebriated fun while taking shots of the fruit infused soju, getting your paws greasy from their tasty appetizers, and belting your lungs out while trying to sing your favorite karaoke tunes that are accompanied by hilarious videos that never coincide with the song.

jMzzj2VmUS0E0dQzujnIWw.review_text: UPDATE: 4/17/08.  Oh man, I think I've eaten here at least 7 times in the past month.  Curse the addiction, this place is that good.  I'm giving it 1 more star for being just so damn tasty, and because I've never seen that 1 bitchy waitress again.  Also, the slacker guy is getting better so I'll give 1 more star back.  ORIGINAL REVIEW:  You're gonna say I'm crazy, you're gonna say I'm smoking crack, hell, you might even wanna lynch me, but I'm gonna say it: Playground is the best Korean restaurant in San Francisco.  *ducks*  I mean, c'mon, it's embarrassing when a glorified bar puts out tastier kal-bi than 95% of "legit" Korean BBQ restaurants in the City.  Combine that with the impossibly tasty Yang-nyum chicken (and the similar Kan Poong shrimp), a kick-arse Jjajang-myun, that creepily delicious little corn-and-mayo-and-cheese panchan, and an overall volume level where I'm (surprisingly) not the loudest @$$hole in the room, among other things, and I say you got a winner!  I would've given this place 5 stars, except for 2 minor things... well, 2 minor people, actually.  First, there's this one waiter is leaps and bounds sh1ttier than all of the other super-cool waiters and waitresses.  This guy always half-asses everything, never takes orders correctly, doesn't bring you stuff that you ask for, and always pretends not to hear or see you when you're trying to flag someone down.  I'll knock off only a 1/2 star for his antics, since it's easy to just work with any of the other uber-nice waiters and waitresses instead of this guy.    The other 1/2 star off goes to this one "waitress" that I've seen only once (luckily).  She was kinda condescending in that smiley bitchy way, and instead of worrying about the understaffed tables, she just stayed behind the bar.  Don't we have a bartender to do that, miss?  That was longest Korean dinner evAr heh.  But only -1/2 because I never saw her again.  Thank God.  5 stars for the food, atmosphere, and service; -1 for 2 lousy servers.  Playground's a real winner.  I'm just sad that they're not open for lunch anymore.  P.S. Screw Toyose.  Playground's where it's at.

QRjgTEWhwq5J3BcQkLmESQ.review_text: The soft tofu soup was delicious, the side dishes not so good, but ok. Kimchi wasn't so fresh or spicy. Friendly service and bar/karaoke atmosphere.

bNaGQsN1Fd-erkFDoGJJ0A.review_text: Karaoke was fun!  Wished the rooms were a little bigger and well-ventilated!  It was so hot...granted there were lots of people in the  room, but still...a fan would've been a plus!   Anyways, I was on a liquid diet that night so cannot comment on the food! ;-P  Two thumbs up on the soju shots and the song menu and, of course, the Yelpers who showed up!

XkLK2iBsgqF6mWwDfRgqqQ.review_text: Someone told me to ask for the karaoke room with the soft core porn.  Uh, no.  Even though he tried to ask and the ahjuma had no idea what he was talking about, they continued to serve us and were even nice about it.  Where was Omar when we needed him?    We started the evening with food in the restaurant.  We had the kimchi stir fry with tofu, stir fried squid, fried chicken, kalbi, dolsot bibimbab, seafood pajun, cheesey corn (um, gross) and carafes and carafes of flavored soju.  I'm not that into the sweet stuff but I succumbed to peer pressure.  I didn't expect much from a bar/karaoke place but, except for the kalbi, all the food was surprisingly good.    Onto the karaoke rooms.  There are only 3 or 4.  The English music selection is pretty limited but good enough.  Apparently, I sound like Amy Winehouse because my voice is so very deep (thanks, Jason).  After many more carafes of flavored soju, one of which was spilled on me, another wrestling bout (boys are weird), and some singing, freestyling and dancing, I walked out of there sticky and smelling like a boozy... well, you know.  Good times.

xqe8QcpRryKuK2wn5TZJYg.review_text: This place is overpriced.  Even in the afternoon where only total losers looking to kill some time with a little 80s (as my friend and I were) are going to kareoke.  No daytime special rate?  Damn.  AND I still have to buy a drink?  It's 3pm!!    The selection here is pretty lame for a big kareoke bar.  At least as far as the English song list goes - can't speak for the Japanese, Korean, and Chinese titles.  They have mostly cheesy pop music.  Even if you find a classic that you like, it's probably going to be the crappier pop remake version.  The food here is okay.  Standard Korean.  Staff is okay.  Standard Korean.

bWxxfPP08zWJuM5wKG0LvQ.review_text: I am a Karaoke Queen. Specializing in power ballads from the late 80s. I can rock out to Mr. Big, Journey, Heart, Pat Benatar you name it, I rock it. If I put in We Belong by Pat, watch out, I am gonna rock it.  And that's just what I did at Playground. Standard Japantown Karaoke joint with private room although this one seems to able to legitimately serve alcohol. The only think that can make karaoke even better is alcohol. I think I still prefer Do Re Mi to this place but it's a good alternative to when the other places are busy.

aqWXHhcR_CdmKmxggFOlEA.review_text: Didn't have any food but we had a private karaoke room for 20. A direct line downstairs to have drinks (and, I would assume, food brought up) which was key to making the night. Good selection of karaoke songs, fast service in getting drinks up to the room.  How much more could you want beyond belting out Sweet Caroline with friends over lemon soju?

3rx1L_4CRu0XwUjF41iSbQ.review_text: Cheesy corn!  Okay...there's more to this place than just their delish cheesy corn...  Playground is a popular joint in Japantown in SF, frequented by young kiddos, yuppies, and young professionals.  Pretty much Playground is where young adults come out to drink, have fun, and play.    Came here for dinner last night and just happened to be in time for happy hour.  Happy hour includes half off soju cocktails and some bar food like fries and chicken wings. Because my friend and I came here for dinner, we didn't order off the happy hour food items.    My friend and I shared an order of haemul pajeon and ddukboki off the regular menu, and ordered yogurt soju off the HH menu.  All of the food was very tasty and hit the spot, especially when accompanied by some sweet delicious yogurt soju cocktail!  Normally, soju cocktails are 13$ for a small carafe and 26$ for a large carafe, so coming for HH is a good deal since it's half off.  Dinner food items were kind of pricey, but then again most Korean restaurants in the Bay Area charge an arm and a leg for even the simplest of dishes!

U3sCAJc4_E3MGC1jGi19gQ.review_text: Maybe we came too early or came on an off night but I really expected better. The place was small and when we sat down there were only two other tables with people. On a Friday night around 6pm you'd expect to find more patrons. Then the food came and I see why it wasn't that busy... the food was really lack luster. I thought most Korean restaurants feature the same dishes and flavors. Playground listed the same dishes I'm accustomed to seeing but the way they were prepared was just not up to par. I may not be a Korean cuisine master but I really expected much better. Been there, tried it, not a fan at all!   Check out Cocobang for some awesome fried chicken! Han Il Kwan for grilled meats. Toyose or The Spot or Tonight for soju. Anywhere else for anything else but Playground!

cL9TQVIP2RuPD1WKecGfOw.review_text: When I came here to eat, my friend was like ,"dude just get the chicken its HELLA good." I was pretty skeptical cause the nyam yang chicken is basically fried chicken, but Korean-styled. It is drenched in a spicy and sort of sweet tangy sauce. The sauce is what makes it taste so good. Each order comes with about 10 pieces of chicken and I devoured the whole plate pretty fast with the sauce all over my mouth and finger. Now I know. Trust me just only order the chicken!  On another note who would ever have thought that something as simple as cheese corn would be so crazy delicious.

9fe41Vmw245Eho1PghHHKw.review_text: Here for karaoke. Was a fun hour or so here in a private room. Their binders are pretty easy to use at this spot. I'd definitely go back again.

tlxpbxBH8tNdM5bUmt4iww.review_text: For my 21st birthday I had really wanted to go to a karaoke place. I actually found this place using Yelp, but I wasn't convinced and went to check out the place for myself before booking the venue. My bf and I checked out a few of the karaoke places in the vicinity starting at Playground and we looked at about 3 or 4 other places (including Do Re Mi and the one that is kinda underground). Playground turned out to be the cheapest option. It was booked for that Friday and the only slot they had open for Thursday night was from 8-10pm. I figured this would be good because we could have dinner, sing and then head elsewhere to continue the birthday festivities. I would definitely suggest making a reservation to make sure you get a room for the night you want to go.  There was 13 of us in their biggest room. We fit pretty comfortable so I wouldn't suggest putting more than 15 people into the room. The waiter would periodically come up and take our order and we could also use a phone to call down. We all had a great time. The food was really good. I can't remember anymore exactly what we had. I do know we went with a bunch of finger foods for everyone and there were enough vegetarian options for my vegetarian roommate.   The drinks were perfect for my birthday. I was dreading being one of those just turned 21 yr olds with their head over the toilet by midnight. We had about 8 carafes of soju. We tried the yogurt of course but also had lychee and... mango, I believe. This was almost 6 months ago so I'm having a hard time remembering. The yogurt was the favorite of the night.   The karaoke was fun. Their selection was good enough to keep us occupied for the 2 hours we were there. We definitely found a few favorites and were belting out some horrible singing by the second hour. Only problem with the room is that it starting getting really hot. We tried to open the door a few times, but were told to close it. I guess no one else wanted to hear our singing. I like the little disco light you can turn on as well haha.   Price-wise I'm not really sure how it went. The stipulation was that every person would have to order $20 worth of food. It's not something they strictly enforced, although I'm sure we were much over our limit. I think each person paid about $30-$35 and that's considering that the birthday girl (me) did not pay.   I would come back here. For the food or for the karaoke, but mostly for the soju :]

PBXp5dIlYFMHaBXPCtEMZw.review_text: This place is okay. I've pretty much been to every korean bar in SF, and this is probably my second least favorite. I came here on a weekday, and it was almost they're closing time. It is extremely loud with a bunch of drunks and hella dark. You can't even see what you're eating. Not to mention the night I went, it was freezing inside! I only wanted to come here because they give out complimentary cheese corn with your dish. But it wasn't good. Luckily it was free becuase I would have not paid for that. It was so milky and not appetizing at all and the cheese was weird. For the rest of the food, I guess it's pretty good when you're buzzin. First time I had it, I got the food togo and brought it next door to Milo's to munch on. Never had the soju so I can't say anything about that. Maybe I'll give this place a second try.

Mlhjg_PTkyZ7FReat_COiw.review_text: As much as I dig Do-Re-Mi for their big rooms, nothing beats having decent-priced alcohol service you didn't need to sneak in. So many damn songs too, and food. $30 an hour is such a damn good deal. If only they had more rooms and it wasn't so crowded.

wQfGipBCh_7x4rCfDQu67g.review_text: DO go to have a good time with friends DO NOT go for overpriced food and drinks  DO get a private karaoke room for more intimate fun DO NOT expect it to be roomy, comfortable, and cheap  DO try all the flavored sojus DO NOT be surprised when you get the bill for it and wonder where all the soju went  DO go for the large selection of karaoke songs DO NOT go for sticky menus, tables, floors, and karaoke song catalogs (gross!)  DO go for the cute asian girls all over Japantown DO NOT be surprised when none of them give you the time of day

CKl_QPKQAQjWXpz7YbmYkQ.review_text: Really good food! I LOVED the mozzarella cheese and corn dish, and the dumplings! Also very cool they have KPOP videos playing the entire time you dine. I really felt like I was in Korea!

hE34xpG35WugHznWf79HfQ.review_text: Playground, not only do you have an awesome name (who doesn't love a little swingin' - if ya know what I mean *wink wink*) but you have the awesome honor of being my 700th review!!   I really should give you 10 stars, because my friends and I owe you much more that a stellar review, but Yelp has this 5 star limit which really gets in the way of my morning after apologies.   I am pretty sure I am not allowed back to this playground, but I am glad I got to play, so thanks for making my friends birthday so memorable and at the same time erased from many of our memories.   Upon entering this playgrounds foyer you will find a whole lot of Christmas lights, a phone, some plants that look real when you are drunk but look very plastic in your kitchen when you are hungover. Do not try to rip the lights off the wall and steal them. The strand is long and wraps around the entrance into the establishment, where you will be seen. The phone, however, can be dismantled. Actually I take the comment about the phone back, as I believe it is no longer there.   Once you pass the foyer you will find a hostess who will take your name for a private karaoke room upstairs, before shooing you to the left to wait in the dining/bar area where you will partake in their yogurt/soju fuck you up the ass secret weapon drinks that taste harmless but are about as harmless as a cute little hungry tiger. You will possibly break a few shot glasses, and possibly add a few more to your home collection.   Eventually you will be let upstairs to one of the rooms of varying sizes and shapes and be herded in like cattle on slaughter day. You will have a book of songs that you will not sound good singing even if you think you do, complete with a video monitor of videos that make no sense whatsoever in relation to the song. You will prop the door open, without getting in trouble because these people are VERY accommodating, and scream and drink more aforementioned cocktails until some of you are drunk crying, some are dry humping, some are white man dancing to Madonna and others are looking for even more shit to steal. Then, after you are told to leave you will do just that.....possibly while forgetting to pay the bar tab, but that is any ones guess.   Once you are safely outside with friends you do not remember seeing you might almost get in a fist fight with a tourist who thinks there are cactus in Japantown and thinks you are one of them and wants to take your photo, but you will not remember it. You will only remember how awesome it was to scream Total Eclipse of the Heart with the birthday boy and wake up the next morning with a voice just as hoarse as Bonnie Tylers.   5 stars to Playground for letting us in and letting us stay, even if it was just that one time!!

8lSyKolCkfe_Ttz_8GdvJQ.review_text: I'm rating this more for the karaoke than the actual eatery.  This is a good place if you're out with friends late at night and need to snack on some Korean chow.  They have all your usual Korean bip bops, kim chops and meats and such so you'll never go hungry there, that's for sure.  They also have a few private karaoke rooms upstairs if you want to get your sing on.  The rooms are quite decently sized, I can't say the same for their selection of songs...in English.  Yeah, it's great if you're good at singing Korean songs and once in a while Chinese and Japanese songs, but for me, an American born Chinese, I tend to stray from that territory and want to sing some English tunes, you know.  I'm not sure if they know this or not, but we don't live in the 1990s anymore.  People like Celine Dion, or Ace of Base ain't exactly chart toppers these days.  The selection of English songs are mediocre at best, although I'm sure they have up-to-date Korean tunes and probably up-to-date Chinese and Japanese tunes also since my eyes seem to overlook Mika Nakashima songs that I remembered coming out in 2006, or was it 2007, whatever, one or the other.  I think what San Francisco needs is less Korean/Chinese owned karaoke joints and more Japanese owned karaoke joints because the Japanese get serious when it comes to karaoke-ing.  If you've ever been to Japan (I have) then you would know what I'm talking about.  Even in a country where English is not the dominant language, the song selection at a Japanese karaoke place far exceeds any Asian-established karaoke box in San Francisco.  I won't complain too much about it, at least they have private rooms.  I'm not a big fan of singing my ass off to a complete stranger in those open mic type places.  But that's another story...

LSQsSMYUdxPs8VXFeYThyQ.review_text: Very fun spot. Their food is delicious. Drinks are also delicious. I think they'd be my #1 Karaoke spot if:  1. I could sing 2. they had newer songs.

Yao2uyKHomW9MdLHI1BKAQ.review_text: Shadiest business practices EVER.  They tried to over-charge us, and only after we showed them the math did they lower the per-person price to ten dollars less.  However, their policies of charging twenty dollars per person minimum on top of the room charge is not explained beforehand, and is just nickel-and-diming as such.  They will not ever have my business again.

h5LbqxM-ZbKe0-fDlAh5nw.review_text: I use to never really hang out in Japantown but discovered Playground about a year ago and just love it!  Every time our friends get together it's a blast.   They have great food, my favorite is the potato croquette! And also a full bar option. When your bored your entertained by all the amusing KPOP music videos projected on the wall! Definitely check out Playground next time you and your friends need a fun place to get together!

2UcWRvyQDYlVh_4pOfYd5g.review_text: Needless to say, my friends and I are regulars here and love it. It's very much your typical Korean Bar/foodie spot. It gets loud and FOBBY at times but overall its always a great time. Janet and her crew are very friendly and helpful and always provide the most amazing service with a smile.  Get the Boo Dae JJigae for your table of 3-4 (spicy) and order some soju and beer, take your jacket off and make a night of it. Get tipsy, make some new friends around the bar and if time permits, go upstairs and hit up the Karaoke rooms!  Not a date spot at all, but definitely a chill night with you and your close friends.

grFjhD2zEzfjo7Gbp8JvoQ.review_text: Had to try Korean food once in a while, something besides kalbi, the Korean BBQ ribs.. This place seemed to be very popular with young people. There was a bar with a huge TV playing football, and the other TVs were playing Korean music videos. Ordered way too much food. The kalbi was decent, the dumplings and the onion pancake tasted good. We especially liked the prawns battered, deep fried, served with a spicy sauce. And the soft tofu spicy soup!!  Had two kinds of soju, lichee and yogurt. Were too full to even order desserts..!!!

VSRtEK_c84oJygZ0OX0Oqg.review_text: Cool place to karaoke. Have to make reservations kinda far in advance though, because they only have 3 or 4 rooms. They have good soju drinks that the ladies like.

8_APo4b5Y2lDlP681zvROA.review_text: The service was exceptional.  Although the food prices are listed as "$$" it really only should be "$" because most dishes have HUGE portions and are meant to be shared.  The main entrees were delicious and they come with free servings of rice (I'm not sure if our server was just being nice to us or not) so it was actually a great deal considering how much food you get.  The atmosphere is like none other and I seriously felt like I walked into an actual bar/restaurant in Korea.    I would not go here by myself but I will definitely come here with friends again!  I recommend the soju, fried spicy beef, seafood pancakes, dumplings, and the korean beer (OB).

_S5tB9stFX3YKLBPVoEjqA.review_text: this was the after-party spot after the new people elite event. i never do karaoke, but i was drunk enough to sing "i want you back" by the great n'sync. the room was kinda cramped, but it was fun and good company. i didn't have any drinks because i was already overly-hammered, but the drink menu looked pretty extensive. the food was pretty good. i sampled the seafood pancake and the chicken wings. the seafood pancake was like a seafood pizza. it was different, but good. the chicken wings were very spicy and quite tasty. the staff was nice and the place is in a good location. definately a good spot if you want to get a group together for karaoke.

p6nBKyT9Y_pFJ1WxVEowwA.review_text: The 5 stars at not necessarily for the place, but for the amazing time we had. I celebrated my birthday here last night and it ranks way up there as one of my favourite birthday's ever. The food was good, the drinks were flowing and the songs were rolling. The room we were in was upstairs. It was pretty small and had no proper ventilation. We had to keep the door open to cool it down. Anyway, they say there is a $10 per person charge. If you order a lot of stuff, they don't really count the number of people in the room. Also, the rate is $30 per hour for the room. They have a large selection of songs, but not a ton of English songs. They need to update their lists. So for those of you looking for Apologize by No Republic, they don't have it.

1eFJXbzad-ye0heUyI-1Qw.review_text: Saw the episode of Check Please! and decided to give it a try.   My review is purely for the food and nothing else.  I hate Karoke bars and it would take a crap load of booze to get me into one of those rooms.    I'm Korean and walked into this place sober.  Might have been a mistake.  The food is just okay.  We came here for a quick dinner.  I order the Soon Doo Bu, (tofu stew). My stew was just okay. Not sure how fresh the clams were.  I'm always a little suspect of places which use chopped up clams for this dish.  My friend ordered the BBQ Chicken and liked it.   The apps were average at best.  The service was good and friendly.    If you are white, black, yellow, hispanic, etc....or drunk, you'll probably really like the food.  It's just okay if you're Korean.  This is a place to go after a long night of drinking and a much better option to Denny's which is right below.

yriPpdE_FCXL8qa0wNs3nw.review_text: i love playground!   this place introduce me to my favorite all time singer 'taeyang' hahhaha... so i can't talk badly about this place.   Food is great, get the dukk bokki the softest mochi rice cakes ever! Fried prawns are off the chain, please make sure you order with a big group, because they do give you HELLA. I am also in love with the cheese corn, we normally have to order our own.   but great spot, late night food, with soju, music. i can't complain.

PmoxyWSfOxOK5_n44PGR9A.review_text: While I've never been to Korea, I would think this is how a college bar/restaurant would be like there. Large glowing neon restaurant sign and disco lights shining down on patrons. The Korean version of American Idol/Star Search playing on numerous screens. Boisterous crowd knocking back 40 oz Korean brew. That was the vibe, which may not be all that bad, but we had come for the food,... and, uh, not-so-good. In general, the food, particularly seafood, wasn't fresh. The noodle soup came in a broth that, while spicy (good, in my book), tasted like it came out of a "instant" packet. The side dishes were probably the highlight and they were ok. It appears to be a family-run operation and all of our servers were courteous and considerate. Props there and that's what's getting them the second star. As far as "Playground" renditions go, forget the Japantown version and instead go back-in-the-day with pint-sized rappers ABC: youtube.com/watch?v=0JBT…

g9xN0072d4OWM2AOUsV55Q.review_text: I came here on under the most random circumstances. I had gone to zushi puzzle with a friend, amazing amazing place btw... and afterwards we were looking for a place to grab dessert. I was thinking of a crepe place in the kabuki center in the heart of japantown, they just happened to be closed so we went over to playground to get some soju and play a little drinking game. We got the regular flavored yogurt soju, delishhh... it goes down SO easy for those of you who cant drink, and they keep it really cold with an extra ice bath, so it never gets to a nasty warm. The waitstaff was extremely friendly and even offered us board games and a deck of cards... mind you... this is 11pm on a wednesday night. Both my friend and I had to work late that day, and our reservations at zushi puzzle ran a little late, omakasae style usually does. We were very pleased to find a restaurant that was open late on a weeknight. Not only that they serve FROYO! hehehe ... it was funny but the waiter brought me a big bowl of plan froyo with fruity pebbles on top! It was actually really good! This place is fun for the rainy nights when nothing else is open. :)

2UuNTFCDZPa3DImEA111fw.review_text: Fun place with a playful vibe, full bar, and kakaroke upstairs.  What's not to like?  Well, since they changed the menu, the food is just okay and somewhat overpriced.  Maybe if I were a regular and Korean it might help, as I've always been similarly up underwhelmed by Won Mi on Fillmore.  You can get MUCH better Korean food elsewhere, maybe even on the same block (Korea House).  Comparing this place to Brothers BBQ on Geary isn't even a contest.  I figure they must count on getting people drinking and singing karaoke and then getting the munchies.

BMlmme_YhbcT6LFYeU3wIQ.review_text: My reviews are mainly focus'd on Japanese food and venues (as you can see from my name and past reviews) BUT...there's always exceptions to everything...giving credit where credit is due!  First off, I have to say I am very surprised with the complaint of bad service. Playground is not your Alexander steakhouse if that's what these guys are expecting the service to be. My experience for the many times I've been here has been great. I booked a private karaoke room at Playground to celebrate my birthday and since then, it's been a relationship that I can not seem to break & the funny thing is, what wow'd my and made my night so memorable was the staff, the people there, and the SERVICE! The little green bottles of soju and the tall tubes of yogurt soju started the night well! We ordered alot of food but what was most memorable was the fried chicken, seafood pancake, and this corn cheese mixture.  There were no complaints, devoured it we did.   After our time was up we were advised that another party had reservations...we were bummed as we weren't ready to leave BUT the person helping us asked if we would like to have a table set up down stairs to continue our night...OF COURSE!  Well the rest of the night was a little crazy with a mix of everything in between.  One thing I have to say is Playground is something special. For all that has not been here, come experience the fun for yourself and don't let these snobby people deter you from a great place as you can see...my service was...........wait for it...wait for it........AWESOME!  See you soon Playground. Yogurt soju and fried chicken night is a once a week must!

ibvH1Y7Rh_tstiWgH0OFTA.review_text: Good food, great service, and awesome place for good company.  The feel here is very comfortable and chill. Don't expect anything fancy.  The foods are pretty good but I do prefer some other places for some particular dishes... although the portions here are quite generous!  Prices are average for all the sojus, beer, & foods, but the spirits bottles are quite pricy (ie: $170 Grey Goose).   Bathrooms are clean. People who work here are all super friendly. I think I'll be a regular!

K0zrsXqu55JPwT4dnvNUDg.review_text: Whenever there's food and alcohol both consumed at large amounts, its probably one of the best feelings ever.  And that, is what Playground offers.  Beer with flavored Soju to accompany the greasy heavenly dishes that are served.    So where my last review for Cherry Blossom Festival stopped...this one begins as the Sapporo drinks were coming to an end, this place opened at 5pm....perfect.  Gotta continue that buzz going and what better than a large jug of yogurt soju!  Had that and OB beer....love the plastic bottle  -Seafood pancake - something about seafood all on one flat pancake thing that you just can't deny with its crispiness and flavor. -Fried Chicken - Perhaps one of their better known dishes as it's perfectly flavored chicken and its not just wings or chicken breasts.  It's the drumstick cut in half! -Cheese and corn - enough said! -Hot sauce rice cakes - the sweet hot sauce is amazing, and definitely goes well with the rice noodle cakes.  With more than enough food, we all stumbled our way in the closing of this cherry blossom festival journey.

UXAPXFo89WUeG0xm1dlF6Q.review_text: 3 1/2 stars   Interesting. Better than I expected. Playground was a shit show a few years back but it seem that things turned around. Our group of 10 was late but they let me get seated first at the large table. Well, it wasn't a busy night but some places just won't seat you til everyone gets there. Anyway, the pan chans aka appetizers included corn cheese which was surprisingly awesome.  The waiters were attentive and quick.  From what I can recall we ordered Chamisul Soju, seafood pancake, kalbi, tofu soup, bimbimpap, jap chae, all equally tasty. No complaints from anyone.  Will come back again!

q_B4D8aQQE9JkN3yxDqz-A.review_text: hey, you can't go wrong with karaoke.  Playground has a pretty extensive list of songs, and if you happen to know Korean, Chinese or Tagalog, you've got a extra sets of songs to choose from!  And yes folks, it's all about the private rooms and getting the right mix of people in the room.  Inevitably, too many songs will be requested, and you won't be able to finish your selections before the end of the night.

N7POp_Zp-M5P7jGnw2q_Ew.review_text: Are you looking for a place with the completely irrelevant music videos, sticky falling apart music booklets, drinks that taste like toilet water, a plentiful 50 English song collection, songs that only date up to 2004, and a place that costs $50 a person to boot? Well this come to this place!  If you are looking for respectful fair service with a descent song selection, real music videos and a place that is appreciative of your business, take your dollah bills to Pandora or Yamasho, or better yet E-plus in South San Francisco!  This place had a minimum order of $25 per head, plus the room charge of $30 an hour for a dirty room with a poor selection of music, and sticky pages/sticky floors that left me using an entire travel sized Purell after I left.  Food was terrible also. The popcorn chicken tasted like dry old chicken breast. The batter was somewhat crispy, but the dipping sauce was a very sweet mustard. i was hoping for some ranch, or bbq, or buffalo, or pepper, or chili sauce. ya feel? The topokki was also too sweet.  WORD TO THE WISE, if you're celebrating a birthday and your friends want to poke their heads in to say Happy Birthday to you, make sure you go all the way outside the venue to have them greet you. If they come into the venue with your party, they will be charged the $25. Essentially it's like a cover. We only had a core group of 9 ppl. We had 12 ppl come and go, and we were charged for the 12 people at $25 a head plus tax and gratuity. They also do an automatic gratuity of 18%. never coming back again.  Came here last weekend for a friend's birthday and another group of friends were going to make resos this weekend b/c of it's location and we all decided to go to pandora instead. SAVE YOUR MONEY! $500 lesson learned.

9FGu7rcwVHfKimJlkXcbyA.review_text: This is the type of place Ktown cowboys would go in SF.  It's a typical Korean bar - a typical decent one, not the trashy hole in the walls.   The food is better than decent and when you're drunk, it tastes like heaven melted with cheese in your mouth.  basically, it tastes good.  I always like to get the fried chicken and corn cheese and the ddukboki and of course soju and beer.    Really loud atmosphere, kind of clubby like but sit down, bright neon lights, TV, loud and drunk people everywhere, karaoke upstairs, thats pretty much what you need to know.   It would definitely be my first choice in Korean bars in San Francisco.

Yl4yij-fdVAPVlKuII3ozw.review_text: Man, i can never resist yummy food. i end up getting 3 dishes when its only my friend and i.   ~Bul Gol Gi ~Spicy Shrimp Sweet&Sour HELLLA GOOD ~Playground Jja Jjang Myun  one of my favorite side dishes is the corn topped with cheese.  pretty good.   next time if i do comehere i want to drink and karaoke.

KLVPS_xQcHhfvBkXofZncQ.review_text: I echo the other raving 5 star reviews for Playground.  My wife (who is half Korean, half Chinese) refuses to eat at any other Asian restaurant when in SF.  Her demand is justified, though.  The food is delicious, the atmosphere is fun, and the service is uncomparable. They treat you like family - all the time, every time.  They have a full bar, regular and flavored soju, and a variety of beers. All you need to do is bring good company - and if you didn't like your experience at Playground, maybe that was the problem!    Our regular order generally includes some combination of the following: the spicy shrimp dish (which isn't too spicy), kimchee chigae, la bokki, and yang nyum chicken. I especially like the fire chicken (I can tolerate very spicy food so this may not be for everyone, but it's got "fire" in the name, so you've been fairly warned). My wife goes crazy over the cheesy-corn dish which is complimentary (part of the "pan chan," which is the set of side dishes that comes with all the entrees).   I disagree with those fretting about the price of the food.  Korean food isn't like your typical hole-in-the-wall Chinese restaurant, this is in SF, the entrees very well porportioned, AND you get the side dishes. I've never left hungry or upset about the bill.  We've taken a lot of friends to Playground, whether they are SF natives or just traveling through - everyone has loved it as much as we do. You won't be disappointed!  Can't stress it enough: Playground is bomb .com.

6_VkzelWeSHzjTVDlGl-Ug.review_text: *Coulda sworn I reviewed this place before?? Been here plenty of times now, and I've liked it each time :)  FOOD/DRINK: Excellent ! Cheese corn - omg the cheese corn small dish is yummm... And gotta love all the small dishes that come with the food. Don't really remember the main courses that were ordered, except we did get the Bebimbop- but everything at this restaurant I actually liked. Which I didn't expect, bc I only saw this place as a bar.  SERVICE: Came here to eat once, and the service was actually good! Wasn't expecting it to be up to par as a regular sit down restaurant, since this place is kinda more like a Korean lounge. But everything was timely and well-attended to. :) / Janet, the owner is super nice and friendly. Even from the very first time I met her, she has always been very nice and sincere. Great type of personality to have as an owner, it makes me certainly not mind becoming a regular. ;P  ATMOSPHERE: I've been here several times. The first time was for a Kollaboration open mic event, so it wasn't the typical setting. However, it was still fun and enjoyable, as afterwards they played Kpop music videos all around haha. The atmosphere is fun, has dim lighting, generally a tint of blue...

s7iQ8eVYEC1KwUGypK8hSA.review_text: the jap-chae wasn't very good but basic and a little bland. the ramen with rice cake thingies was okay but i was expecting spicier and less soupy. the place is very neon blue on the inside. very expensive for this kind of korean food but you do get large portions. service was good but that's probably because we were two of the few people there.   they also have karaoke but i've heard that this is also expensive so, beware.

3nie2a6SfbWWv_GW0mlIdg.review_text: i think my group spent around $600 here last night on karaoke, food, and drinks.   some revelations: -they have a somewhat outdated music selection (where was britney's Circus album?!) bummer. -the seafood pancake is HELLZA good. omg, i want some right now. -yogurt soju is still the best -fried chicken. yum! -you can sneak in your own liquor (but i didnt tell ya that!)

886PK4cguRAHtD-mUnSZTg.review_text: I love coming here. My boyfriend and I use to come here a lot with our friends and I am always happy to come here. I love the black noodle here. I have been to a few other restaruants (chinese and korean) that serves black noodles, but i like the black noodles here the best.  My boyfriend had his birthday party here once, and we got the biggest karaoke room that they had upstairs, and they brought us our food and alcohol. the price for the karaoke room was really reasonable too... i forgot how much it was, but it wasnt ridiculously expensive.  all the food(at least all the ones i tried) here are really yummy, and i really like the lighting and everything, its really pretty. They also have this really yummy yogurt flavor icecream. I guess it is like froyo, but it is yogu flavor! yum yum yum.

WFAZQyWYj9bBxggA9l603Q.review_text: They have nice private rooms upstairs.  They have phones in the rooms so you can order food and drinks.  Then they bring your order up to you.  It's like they do everything for you - except sing.  That's up to you.  Dig your own grave, sucka!

vSTi9G85c5c8RNPFIEMETQ.review_text: I love Playground.  Coming here reminds me of my college years in Berkeley when I would often go to Korean drinking restaurants.  The cheesy corn appetizer is not bad, but the occasional "service" of on the house steamed mandoo (potstickers) always brightens my day.  I like the Playground champong (spicy seafood noodle soup), as well as the tangsuyuk (sweet and sour pork) and the al chigae (spicy fish roe soup).  They also serve a tart soft serve frozen yogurt topped with Fruity Pebbles cereal as a complimentary dessert.    The atmosphere is fun: dim lighting with Korean pop music videos projected onto the wall.  Service can be a little absent-minded and the prices are a little higher than your average Korean drinking restaurant.  But this is San Francisco and Japantown.  It is what it is.  Plus the portions are very generously sized.  Playground is a great place for a big group of friends who enjoy food and drink.  I have actually never done karaoke here.  It's all about the food and atmosphere for me.

uZdFsE_aHbFBChgN6Xa8tw.review_text: This is my fav Korean bar in SF.  We only come here, usually after dinner/drinks at Cafe Mum's.  Then we have more drinks, food and karaoke here.    The lady who owns this place is super nice (she's in one of the pictures).  She runs this joint with her daughter too.  They always try to accomodate our group of 10+ at any time.  Usually, you need a reservation for karaoke on the weekends.  The food is pretty good here, but the soon dae dish is not good.  The fried stuff is all good, but then again most fried stuff is good!   Soju tastes all the same to me, so it's not much different here.  The food is better than most Korean bars.  Once I came here for an event where they rented out the whole floor and had a karaoke contest where they don't usually karaoke.  It was a good sized event and the venue was really fitting.

tLj-1t4y56oijKrDn-cVOw.review_text: I had no idea that I could really rawk a Blondie song until the moment I entered that private room with a few of my coworkers and their friends. I interjected into someone's turn and took the mic for a awe inspiring rendition of "Call Me".  I always had my go-to favorites... as friends know. I'm pretty good at busting out a good Whitney Houston... but this night was special....something "clicked" and everything came together.  The next day at work...coworkers were doing "Katy Impressions" in the halls and I don't remember how many times I heard " That was SO awesome!"  I channeled my inner rocker and totally took the spot light. Pretty sure that's as close as I'll come to my 15 minutes of fame.  totally going again. Have to!

cMR1zBpms9HnBVt8w7hM_Q.review_text: Restaurant Review:  Who doesn't want to eat Korean food at 2am?? I know I do!  For a late night place the food was pretty good! This place is packed with drunk korean kids singing drinking games and pounding beers. The menu is so expansive that there's no possible way to not find something that you'll love.   Go late at night and have fun with the accidental entertainment around you and enjoy some bibimbap ;)

9IvE4ytfFIet_0ycahsMag.review_text: I have to agree with "Drew P" I had the same thing happen when I was there Saturday night I walked into the restaurant at 6:00pm. The koream waitor gave me the menu and I did not like the menu because the print are very small and they combine english and korean word together. I order Kimchi boom book stir fry. they are so good I ate up almost the whole bowl of kimchi boom boom. I agree with the corn and cheese they are delicious. There are 3 Karaoke rooms They seem to be in good condition the floor is dirty on the way to the Karaoke room the bathroom are Okay not the cleaness. There are two korean girls that are nice. They are always busy so they do not have a lot of time to talk with other people. I hung out at the playground until 9:00pm I was the only guy sitting at the bar gthe whole time. the crowd are not the best There was a disco light at the bar to make it look like it is a dance club but it not a dance club it jsut there for the music video. I might repeat only because the food are good.

fSvOdnryI9FPJ2ylcsE2ig.review_text: See ya at playground.....  I came here last night for an AABA event. They rented out the whole first floor and it was free food and free drinks. For the food, they had rice, salad, chicken bulgogi, beef bulgogi, chap jae, fried chicken and fried potstickers. Since I haven't had Korean in so long, everything was freaking good. I even had a second helping. Then comes the drinking. They had 1.6 liter bottles of hite and ob and all of these flavored soju's. I tried the lychee, grape, pineapple and strawberry. The Lychee by far was the bestest. The grape and strawberry sorta tasted like cough syrup after awhile. I didn't try the yogurt, which I read was pretty good. Didn't try kiwi since i'm allergic to the real ones.   Then the singing. It was an AABA idol contest, so it was actually hilarious to watch law students and lawyers sing. It is even more hilarious to watch them while taking shots of soju and drinking beer.

-TtbBXTW_mCKdZ-mhqubTw.review_text: You'll feel like you are in a cheap bar in Korea.  A no frills bar in Japantown. My friends knew the owners so we checked it out. It's like hanging out near the University in Seoul with lots of young people, music videos, Korean food, and lots of alcohol.

sTW0gS1reTlPhrZYCDKH7A.review_text: In the past I've come here for soju, but tonight we dined in as well. The food was delicious! I love the cheese corn ^_^ the black bean noodles were my second favorite. The waiters were attentive and their soju is stronger than others I've been to. The only bad thing is that it's super loud in there that my friends and I had to yell to hear one another. BUT it's a bar so i guess there's no quietness to that. Other than that, I will be back :)

3srbILfCJ70LXv7Q2G1GxA.review_text: Yo let's go to the playground! I bet they got slides, tranny rides, monkey bars and etc.. Wouldn't it be fun if we get all drunk and then do them tricks?!  Ha!! No kid. Playground is a Korean restaurant with a bar on the bottom floor and 3 private Karaoke rooms on the top floor. Seriously, what more can you ask? An empty stomach!! Just 3 hours before all this, I was eating like a madman with other 3 hungry folks in Chinatown and had a couple of Buds after that. I wish I was Jughead, the SF folks got the cream cheese corn, popcorn chicken with special sauce, fishcakes appetizers, and a hot pot with full of ingredients and ramen!! All I could do was just sit there staring at the dishes drooling with a max capacity tummy while downing Hite beer and Soju.  You know it, after that we all head upstairs for the Norebang!! Yes, more Hite and Soju. Arrgh!! Man, my head is still buzzing from the Soju, make it stop please!!  Oh, who sang Wannabe!? Stop that kid too!  ps: Thanks SFers. Ya'll partied hard and early..and end on a high note!!

XIeAvJpbYKEgiDfHmY5a7Q.review_text: So my lady wanted to do something for her birthday, so we saw this on KQED (PBS) on that dining show where they rate places. Can't remember the name, o well not important. Made reservation a week before for the kareoke room for 2 hours. They take a credit card number to hold the reservation, and if you don't show up they will charge u for the room. We got there a bit late. But we found parking and the place, I suggest make the reservation early. Food was quick, drinks were strong (not cheap), but it was fun little outing. Overall it was a fun place, came out a little under 200 for 5 people, with food, drinks and the room for 2 hours. Give it a try when in the city, but make reservation, it will help.

Lb37hatAjI3fgHEh2lMNEw.review_text: 3.5 star review, rounded up. This is for their private room experience only.  This was a while ago, and I neglected to review it, so excuse me if the details are fuzzy. But I just wanted to turn y'all on to all the costs involved.  If you eat dinner in the karaoke room, which is the only way to experience this place, IMHO, you have to spend $10/person/hour for each hour you stay in the room. The room itself is $30/hour. So that adds up to about $30/person/2 hours for food, drink, and room reservation.  And the food was pretty good. I recall having tongdak (fried chicken), nengmyun, haemul pajeon, and some cocktail soju and beer. I do remember that the nengmyun was not that great because it was very hard to chew until much later, when the soup was able to soak into it and soften it up. I damn near choked. Also, the phone was broken (and I've been dying to use a phone to order stuff at karaoke lounges since I went to Japan.)  The room was big enough for 6 of us.  So if you're willing to spend $30 on 2 hours of food/drink/entertainment -- which when put that way, seems *very* reasonable -- Playground is the place for you. You just need to carefully order so you don't spend too much, but just enough. And then you're golden.  BTW, for the karaoke nerds looking, they use Ziller machines.

-aUOAVRvdLnryQLI4tY8LQ.review_text: This place is fantastic! The plates are HUGE, the food is nice and spicy, and the service is quick and attentive. It's actually the first place where two people asked us if our food was good (we barely touched one of our plates, since we were getting full) and if we really liked the meal or if something was wrong with it. I was stunned, since at many places before this one no one bothered with that type of question, especially when the food was below par.  While we waited for our food to arrive, the waiter brought some snacks which were yummy. Bean sprouts, pickled radishes, corn with cheese, and couple other things to munch on. Nice touch. Then our food came and it was just delish. The seafood soup with noodles had nice soft-shell crab in it and big chunks of octopus. The portion was so big that we barely got to my hubby's seafood noodles.   This place is definitely worth checking out!

BCad_oZAU3r0ll38I0h3pw.review_text: I spent a good part of the night worshipping the Porcelain Gods during and after a night of singing at the Playground.    To karaoke at the Playground for a small private rooms costs you $30 per hour at 2 hours minimum.  On top of that, there is a $20 minimum charge of food or drinks per person.  There were 8 of us total.  The room is teeny tiny with seats that have seen better days.  They were taped up to prevent them from breaking anymore.  They have decent songs and some fairly new ones too if you know how to look for them.  They had Adele, Bruno Mars to name a few.  We rocked out to a lot of Brit Brit and N'Sync.  Old school baby!    To spend $20 per person is apparently a very easy task if you are eating or drinking or drinking or drinking.  Yes, they have yogurt soju at $25 a large pitcher.  We ordered 3 of those babies and according to my friends, I must have had 15 shots.  No, i'm not an alcoholic but this cocktail tastes so good, you are done for the night before you even know it.    Yes, I was the girl holding up the line in the bathroom puking my brains out.  Hey, there's nothing like liquid courage to get you to sing like no one is listening.  And liquid courage I got.  I can't really remember the last hour of Karaoke but I do know that I probably hogged the mic after that.  I also remember demanding someone put on Jason M'raz's "Lucky".  Great song I tell ya.   I went home after having a great time singing my heart out.  Managed to even shower, brush, floss and blow dry my hair before knocking out in bed.  Too bad I woke up in a few to spend more time praising the Porcelain Gods.    I seriously thought I had alcohol poisoning.  So word to the wise, do not let the soju cocktail sneak up on you like I did...it's good but not worth the heaving!

rMvnAOMA515mfghQhkejPw.review_text: Get in touch with your inner fob. Makes a strong case for koreans as possibly the gaudiest asians but it's hard to trump the taiwanese and Spices.  Empty green bottles everywhere. Flying jump kicks in the air.

RoSO1yEbzVh4p3N5_uWf5A.review_text: Didn't sing here, but had food. it was pretty decent nothing to drive home about. the shouju was realyl good though thats really all i have to say about this place haha

BdrH98O-NnvHQcjbPZ18aA.review_text: Love the cheesecorn and soju here! =)

az59FaAHwEvoR0SKTTcRmA.review_text: great service, friendly owner, cheap karaoke rooms & good food.   i miss korean drinking places.  i get sick of bars and lounges.  i just want to sit down with fellow koreans and shoot back soju with anju.  when i'm happily buzzed and craving some karaoke, just go upstairs and sing!!  love it!!

Rrj11KKFTDPpjhFlxU7Z6A.review_text: the only reason i am knocking a star off this place is because of the service.  it was a little haphazard.  we got there at 6:00 and they said there was a 20-30 minute wait.  that in itself wouldn't have bothered me however 1/2 of the restaurant was empty.  they had these little folded papers on there that said reserved.  as we were on our way to walk out the door one of the servers or hosts said that one of the tables that was reserve3d was for 9:30 and they said we could have it if we could finish the meal up in under 3 1/2 hours.  i smiled and said we would do our best to accommodate them but I'm pretty sure i could manage a 3 1/2 hour time limit.  and aside from a couple other glitches with the service well i still tipped very well. the food however was fantastic.  i really think that this place has the best Korean food in the city.  i have been struggling to find a really good Korean food but i really think that it's the only ethnic food group that this city is lacking.  this place did not disappoint.  at all.  I'm used to the jong ga house where they bring you 13 side dishes which is something i have not found anywhere else aside from there.  playground brings 5-6 side dishes and they were all out of this world.  something that i had not had before was their corn side dish with a white sauce and melted cheese.  wow.  good.  yummy.  i usually look up the menu on yelp so that i can remember what i had.  i have a hard time remembering things and i can remember taste wonderful food by taste much better than i can remember it by it's Korean name or English name for that matter. but i couldn't have been happier by the quality of the food.  delicious.  yes i found this place from that wild and wacky TV show spotlighting different joints around the bay.  you know the one you probably have watched it yourself and if you're anything like me you don't tell many people that you actually watch it.  at times that little show is painfully uncomfortable to watch when they have a certain combination of personalities that ream each other's restaurants.  anyway i liked this place a lot it was really good and i was pleasantly surprised.  i will definitely go back and they can get another star out of me if the service improves.

f2PvxaRfZ3c0vJm4Q0rJTA.review_text: Very dishonest. Don't trust the price they give you. Way too expensive once you get the bill.  We ordered some red bull and vodka's... they asked what type of Vodka, and we said the house vodka thinking that it would be the cheapest... and then it was $9 bucks for each drink.. I was like WOW... for a well drink at 5 in the evening... that really expensive... and then they said it would have costed the same no matter what vodka we ordered..   WHAT THE HELLLL... if thats the case we would have definitely asked for the good vodka....   tried the food here too... I'll give the food a 3/5 stars....

acMaZZALIanLVZD2_LdArw.review_text: My review is for the private Karaoke rooms upstairs.  This place is amazing.  You get to sit in a little room with all of your friends (as long as you only have like 15 - 20), and figure out how to use the remote controls for the Karaoke machine, and figure out how to read the directions on how to order.  Once the OB starts flowing, and the disco light turns on, it's mayhem.  I don't know why everyone says the prices are so expensive.  15 of us went on a Saturday night.  We had the big room for 3 hours, all had PLENTY of drinks including OB and Soju, and it was $32 each.  Now I don't think that's too expensive for a great time with your friends.

MjqYpDfEjZcTDHBHiI5MCw.review_text: SUPER YUMYUM!  Came here on a recommendation from my roomie, and it was AMAZE-BALLS HANDS DOWN DELICIOUS!  I came with two people, and the service was very nice. We had the Za Jiang Mian Noodle with seafood - YUM! I usually hate the taste of za jiang mian but it tasted super good here! HUGE portions! We also had the Fire Chicken with cheese, which was heaven-sent! and Nyan nyuam chicken - literally yum yum chicken! althought a bit over heavily friend. My diet got owned tho..  The waiters were friendly and gave us free rice =)   OM NOM NOM EXPERIENCE  TO REMEMBER! I shall return.....mwahahaha

JQ1iRiBigVstJVH3QLT-OA.review_text: Between DoReMi, Festa, and Encore, Playground is my favorite karaoke place in the city.  First and foremost, the food was good.  I had soon tofu (delicious), croquettes (also delicious), mozzarella sticks (standard but yummy), pineapple and strawberry soju (weak but tasty), and CHEESE CORN (weird but good).  Karaoke bar food is usually either not an option or not appealing, but not at Playground.  The song selection was decent, and the private rooms were clean.  Our party was able to select enough tunes to fill the time, and I noticed the absence of only one or two ubiquitous '80s ballads.  The tambourines also weren't sticky with residual alcohol and sweat (you'd be surprised).  Most memorable was the fire department raid of the building.  The SFFD pulled everyone out of the upstairs karaoke rooms to ensure that the building wasn't filled beyond capacity.  The employees of Playground were so apologetic about this despite it being beyond their control; even though we were departing, they refunded our last hour.  Best karaoke place.

hSE3_ZdkaILWxxVrw_mt9g.review_text: Came here with VIPs.  Decent Korean food.  Full bar.    Private karaoke rooms.   I have a new found respect for "Gangsta Paradise". His rap skills are left to be unsaid but at least he was easy on the eyes. LOL!   3 stars....SO LONG as you are inebriated. :)  Great place for big groups who's down to quench carafes of soju and sing-sing-sing-along!

VwO7B4fCpjTvq0qo_qwW_A.review_text: Had a reservation for 10:30, we did not get the room until 11:00. The room was cramped and absolutely filthy. Service was horrible, drinks were overpriced completely watered down. The song selection was decent, but both of the microphones in the room were not working properly. Got completely rushed out at the end, despite waiting half an hour for the room previously. Did not have the food, so I can't comment on that. Overall, horrible experience and will not be coming back.

oCK1HfD_HXsMMN1mHaB5-g.review_text: My friends and I had 2.5 hours to kill before our showing of The Hunger Games. So, we decided to have some drank in honor of Ms. Everdeen and the District 13 revolutionaries!  When you enter Playground, there's blacklights everywhere, asian pop music thumping, and drift car videos looping. This was definitely an ABG (Asian Baby Girl) & ABB (Asian Baby Boy) hangout (I loved it!)  We ordered 3 yogurt and 2 strawberry sojus. Either the yogurt did a great job of masking the alcohol or they didn't put enough alcohol. It was very smooth, but seemed diluted. The strawberry flavor on the other hand had a nice kick to it!  Both were great tasting.  A friend wanted cheesy corn, but didn't see it on the menu. She asked the waiter who confirmed that they did have it, but it's not listed. Before we can even order a helping of that cheesy goodness, he brings my friend a complimentary order of the corn!  And before we can thank him profusely he brings the table a complimentary basket of French fries! Not limp, cold, and season less fries. Delicious, crispy, crunchy, and salty fries!  Mind Blown!  Needless to say, my party and I had a great experience and will definitely be returning (with or without Katniss).

lgDtwW4i74I2GQS6YHeR1Q.review_text: Came here with my friends and her coworkers. The karaoke machine was a little hard to work with work with, but everyone had a great time singing to their favorite songs. Karaoke is always good when you also add alcohol and food in the mix.   We ordered the yogurt soju that seemed to be a lil stronger than most of the soju I've had before which was good. For food we had the korean pancake, fried chicken, and fried calamari. Hands down the fried chicken paired with the mustard sauce was my favorite. By the end of the night my plate was full of chicken bones. Overall a good place to have some fun and enjoy some good eats. The room walls seemed thin though we can hear people singing in the other rooms.

WTvw00a2fjlUlsdpG6FsTg.review_text: Soon after I posted my initial review, I got an email from J.C. from Playground. Here is what happened: March 25: Got first email from JC apologizing, explaining how they work, rates, asking for name of the person who took our reservation, etc. One thing I would like to note is that he pointed me to their website and saying how the rates is on there. I call BS on that. I googled Playground and their website didn't even show up. It's not even on the yelp page. That's some poor SEO (search engine optimization). JC offered to send me a $40 gift certificate, for me to give them another chance and to 'update' my yelp review. For the record, in my initial review, I never said I will not be coming back. I just said the karaoke part sucks.  March 31: JC sent me another email, as a follow up (I didn't respond to the first one). Hey, it takes time for me to contact my friend who did the reservation with Playground; she was pretty pissed off about it, debating if I should even contact her about it at all. In this email, JC seems to sound desperate. "And please remember to mention your YELP complaint!  We want to fix this! :)"  April 2: JC sent me another email, this time with Playground's email address and again reminding me to send them my address "so that we can send out the gift card to you asap!" Sounds a bit too desperate in my book, what exactly are they 'planning'  to send me in the mail. And they didn't mention about getting the other information (date, time, who took our reservation, etc.). They just want to send me a $40 giftcard?! If they have money to give away, might as well put it towards to hiring a better web admin  to manage their site, and make sure all the information are correct on it. Makes me reluctant to give them my address. I should also note now, that when I got this 3rd email, I was at a wedding and was a pissed off of how they, Playground, keep on nagging. Ok it's my fault for reading emails while at a wedding, but seriously, 3 emails in 1 week?! At this point, I wrote back saying I'm at a wedding and please stop the emails.  Sometime in mid April (Yelp doesn't have exact date stamp in their messaging area, nor did they send me a copy of my message to Playground): I wrote back with my address. I replied within the same email thread in Yelp.  Early May: I wrote another email "I sent you my address 3 weeks ago and I have yet to receive the gift certificate that you said you will send to me. I am going to update my review of Playground soon. Did you ever intend to send me that gift certificate?"  So there's that, why the sudden disappearance from yelp? I never really wanted that $40 or else I would have reply back with my address to the first email they sent me. I'm not some starving frugal girl out there trying to score as many things for free as possible. It's because how they dealt with this situation, emailing me trying to rectify the problem and then disappearing, that made me decide not to ever come back to this place again.  Playground/JC you have lost some valuable customers, from me and my friends, and possibly my friends' friends. Well, you have lost some of us as customers the first time around (karaoke). We are all in our 20's, have jobs, some in grad school, live all over the Bay, and we are one of your target customer groups.

X6FILzWJ83X39hiydbVV5Q.review_text: zazangmyun..... i wasn't too fond of noodle but this got me hooked. Tasty banchan and a good place to eat with a large group of friends late at night in japantown

CcioG0EHGphZLnNYj-6PyA.review_text: this place was fun for a group of people to go and hang out. i didn't go upstairs to the karaoke part, but i saw a lot of people go up. the service was quick with the food, but the food was pretty average in flavor. this place is great for big groups and family style eating and drinking/

KYYFXHOeQUeo3qwBpUoZdw.review_text: The BEST yogurt soju ever can be found here. The peach flavor is mighty tasty too. I am not much of a drinker, but let me tell you, flavored soju is too good to turn down! And yes, I was singing like a superstar that night! LOL  We got a karaoke room, all which are located upstairs. The ceiling on half the room was very low, but hey, I am only 5' tall anyway. The music selection was ok, but you can only find your songs by title, and not by artist! (but after some soju, you'll sing anything anyway.)  they also have tamborines you can borrow (which again, with enough soju, will make you a superstar.)  The only critique I have is the stairs you must climb to get back down. If you are too huge of a superstar that night, those stairs may be a bit difficult to manage, especially when you are carrying your friend down those stairs. LOL

Zh0V8_dFjgKRzRTZ-ySfpA.review_text: Solid 4 stars.  For late night eats, this place is great.  The wait can be long so be ware.  However, the dynamics of the place is good.  The food was tasty!  I had some of the best dduk bok gi (spicy rice cake)!  Because it was a Friday night, there were a few big parties which made our food order take a very long time.  The servers knew that and comped us with some dumplings.  We appreciated that!  We ate a lot and was satisfied with how everything tasted.  The price was decent and wasn't too much.  Enjoyed my experience here and will want to check it out again if I'm in the city again.

im_uwMBgaEy3CN8hw9u7sA.review_text: Great place to hang out! Karaoke, drinks and food. Its hard to find a good Korean Bar to chill at!

Q_TFz4TsVj_Qgb1akllpVQ.review_text: Karayoke and Korean Food, what a great combo! I'm a huge mic hog (even though i have a terrible tone deaf voice), so i can never refuse the mic.  Give me a good brittany or bon jovi song any day!  This place has a ton of private rooms you can rent and sing the night away with your friends.  There is a main area where you can chose to just hang out and eat.  And eating here is a good thing.  The food is quite tasty.  Noodles are delic as is the fried chicken.    If you're looking for a fun place to sing and eat some yummy food in Japantown, you should go to playground.  Prices are reasonable too.

MzfZeBqL3TPYbOOT_VmU2g.review_text: literally just went here for the first time...last night.  read some people didn't like the neon blue lights, but i thought it was cute.  went here with random friends with a mission.  kings cup with soju and beer.  i've never had soju in my life, soooo glad that i know what it is now, cause that's all i wanna drink! the 5 of us had two small sojus (strawberry & lychee) and two ridiculous bottles of beer. for some reason...i was drunk by the 4th shot of lychee soju...WEIRD. those things definitely creep up on you and by the end of the night i slept like a baby.   the atomsphere was pretty chill.  the service was quick too, and the bill wasn't so bad either.    overrall, i'd go back here again and try the yogurt soju.

H6fwd45ccSOeDL2y4jf-dw.review_text: TL;DR: Overpriced and inflexible. Even if someone drops by for a second, they'll charge you an extra $25, even if they don't drink or sing. Old rooms and sticky/gross song book. Old songs. Will not ever go back. A friend had reservations there, and I promptly told her how bad Playground is to cancel reservations.  And in line with their greedy track record, they charged her.   Venue:  -Not much to see besides a janky disco ball light.  -Bathroom door doesn't work. -Sticky song book pages . -Only one of the books had the English songs, making it hard for others in the room to pick songs.  Karaoke Equipment: -Not one of our (American) songs selected had a music video. The two hours we were there, we only saw one music video (Gangnam Style). -All the songs were old  Food: -If you're drunk and hungry, the food is _maybe_ soso. -Drinks were the typical soju concoctions.   Service: -The server was more than happy to keep the food and drinks coming. -Kept dropping by at the worst times to ask if we wanted more food/drinks, but really only there to do headcount. He checked frequently (every 10-15 minutes). -Want to step outside for air? Sure, but expect questioning upon re-entry: Who are you? What room? You just saw me leave a minute ago. No, I am not a different person for you to charge and add to the minimum.  Value: -HORRIBLE. Ended up with 9 people, but they charged us for 14 people, because friends dropped by (didn't eat/drink or sing). When we complained, Playground offered us a free shot, but that doesn't make sense at all. We were angry because we forced to consume 14x$25 worth of food/drinks when we only had 9.

DRPMOcCHjtEjlfLyulvMNw.review_text: came here with friends on a thursday night. indeed it was packed so we had to wait approximately 30 to 35 minutes?   after the wait, we got seated in the most ridiculous spot.. we was all crammed! ugh! the food was not even all that tasty and it was quite expensive. then their service was horrible. there was basically no service whatsoever. we had to get up and get their attention even that didn't help, i really don't see wheres the customer service yet the place is not even that big!   overall playground was shitty i won't be back!

QaELAmRcDc5TfJEylaaP8g.review_text: Ended up here because there weren't many options (especially since we didn't know where a Korean joint existed in the city). It was different than the LA experience. You don't EAT at a bar like this, but I guess they do in SF. Food was alright, but not stellar by any means. Very crowded (Sat night)... which isn't what we're necessarily looking for after a long day in the sun at the track. And you have to pay for parking! Ridiculous! One reason why taking a car into SF sucks. Can't give this place a high rating cuz it felt small and somewhat grungy for some reason. Oh well... next time, San Francisco.

zh5joJAcc29qUajX9vczWA.review_text: this place is great, soju yogurt is where its at.  Janet the bartender is awesome  they give you a plate of cheese/corn for free, and the food is quite good.

z4eQURQIp5pxqwjhzq0rvQ.review_text: I walk by here all the time but have not gone in until this past weekend. Being on a soju kick, my friend and I decided to give this place a try since I've read on Yelp that it is also a good place for Karaoke. Dimly lit, neon blue lighting, and Korean music videos playing, this place definitely makes you wonder...do you eat here, do you karaoke here, do you pick up a five dolla-holla here, or all of the above?  What we ordered:  - 1 bottle soju: Nothing extrodinary, just regular soju  - 1 large bottle of yogurt soju: Huge carafe, definitely stronger that the ones I had the night before at VIP Oriental  - Jjol Myun: Very good, noodles were cooked perfectly! Good portion size too.   - Tofu Soup: Friend ordered, looked pretty standard.   I'll have to say that with regards to food, Playground delivers. The banchan was decent including the cheese corn (which was $10 at VIP oriental...yeah, ridic for $0.75 canned corn with cheese on top).   I'll post an updated review of the Karaoke experience as soon as we have our group outing there. So far, so good.

WZNf3WKBC18_E8qrvayj4w.review_text: Nothing more than your usual loud, crowded, overpriced Asian bar. The only reason I gave an extra star is because the food was fantastic! What a surprise. Much better than OB Chicken in Berkeley. The service was pretty good too, considering the venue. I'd go back with friends.

uUKittRKz78qEV2SXcX_Mg.review_text: The food at Playground is surprisingly good, except for the scallion pancake with seafood - that was a little fishy-tasting.  I loved the corn and cheese concoction, and it was free!  If you go, you should definitely go for the full experience - order one of the giant Obi beers in a huge plastic jug and some soju on the side.  Then head upstairs to sing karaoke to bad pop songs with images of parrots riding tiny bicycles in the background.  Four stars for the full-on campy experience.

LXsV7JmW2t9Z6bUPb65kaQ.review_text: Took my gf here for her birthday and had an awesome time. I reserved one of the private rooms and it was a little expensive ($30 an hour + $25 minimum food/drink per person) but definitely worth it.   It's a karaoke/bar/restaurant so don't expect a classy, gourmet meal...think more along the lines of awesome korean bar food and lively bar atmosphere. That being said, the spicy fried chicken, korean spare-ribs, fried dumplings, and kim-chi paired really well with the soju. (I remember thinking I was too full on a couple of occasions then taking a swig of soju and then nibbling a little more and vice versa...needless to say I had more than enough to both eat and drink.)   The only thing I can think of that would make this place better is a more reliable a/c system. It might've just been our room but it did get a little toasty at some points in the evening. Also, as it is a business, the proprietors are not shy about cramming as many people into those rooms as possible. I originally reserved the room for 12 people and was relieved, after I saw the room, that only 7 were able to show up.   All in all, an awesome place for silly, drunken karaoke fun. Just make sure that if you're a little claustrophobic that you limit your party to 10 and under.
