L6WaDqHY23Qkawqxk3uJWQ.review_text: First things first, When did it become 21+ Only? is it by choice? I'm well over 21 but I have friends who aren't, they still let us eat which was good.  I used to Love the Jajang Myunn here, but decided to go with the Jap Chae this time, my girlfriend and my other friend both got the jajang, unfortunately it was really watery, the noodles seemed different and the flavor was lacking, smelled kind of weird too. The Jap Chae was great though, ill still go for that now that the Jajang has become sub-par. Hopefully it was a one time thing though.

gpJK7fpn20ThJEwDvBbcCQ.review_text: Hey Ma look - I'm on check please! April 2008 blogs.kqed.org/food/2008… I still stand by my original review below... If you think karaoke is not your scene, guess again. Yes, its freaky that its next to a Denny's in Japantown and private karaoke rooms are above the 'restaurant part' of Playground, but keep an open mind for those not familar with the f-up Korean style. Its easy! all you need to do is 1. Call and a nice woman will reserve you a private karaoke room based on the number of people in your group (CALL AHEAD!). 2. show up and pick up the 'bat phone' immediately in the karaoke room and voila, in a flash your order of drinks (I recommend yogurt soju, yum yum)  and any food you may want (hold off until you are nice and sauced, then order zhazhang myun or something) 3. pick some songs (there are korean and mandarin songs too) and plenty to start belting out in english too! I am NOT a karaoke expert, so you'll likely see me in the restaurant chowing down on some dolsot bimbim bap, chicken (skip the kalbi).

fIlg-nPTAUS-q9RjUOe0Zw.review_text: We had a great time here! We got a private room for a birthday party. The food and drinks were nothing special but the karaoke machine was tons of fun and the service was excellent. Not many vegetarian options.

V0mQiGqm5exR3V4EXhqGzg.review_text: I always seem to end up coming here during the later hours of the night.  We come here for their flavored soju, yummy korean food and for karaoking.  Some of my favorites here:  -The complimentary corn and cheese -chicken gizzards -sampler (mozzerella cheese sticks. YUM) -seafood korean pancake -Spicy rice cake with ramen -chicken wings  There's actually nothing that I have tried that i did not like here.  Their variety of flavored sojus are great too. All my friends always have a good time here.  What more can you ask for? Soju, korean food, karaoke and a good time.  One thing I do not like is their small karaoke rooms.  It's not usually big enough for my party of friends.  The ceilings are low and its pretty stuffy because its upstairs.  Overall a great place to hang out drink and eat.

aKAGlmoKsgnQ8Avh86-SOg.review_text: My Friday night here was a night well spent.  +1 for bringing food into your karaoke room. Ideally, you order through the phone, but our phone was broken, so we had to go downstairs and put in the order. But this method is infinitely preferable to just sitting and waiting around for food, because you're biding your time singing karaoke. You don't even notice how long it takes! (and at this place, not long at all!)  +1 for having neng myeon. I seem to never end up at a place with neng myeon when I go out for Korean food, so I was pretty stoked to have it here, especially considering how hot it was the day we came.  +1, -1 for food overall. The dduk was really tender and fell apart while I was trying to pick it up, not rubbery and chewy like I've had at some places. It was super fresh. The yang nyeom chicken was okay, but I've had better. The haemul-pajeon didn't have much haemul in it, if you ask me. But the boy loved all the spring onions. The mandu was tasty, and enough for all of us to have two each. I think next time, we'll pick food that is easier to pick up with chopsticks though, because even the nengmyun was a little difficult to eat while karaoking.   +2 for service. The guy who served us was super attentive, and made sure that we had bowls and spoons for the neng-myun and that we had enough water, soju, and beer. After we had started to get into the swing of eating and singing, I told the boy to ask for the tambourine downstairs. He came back, with nary a tambourine, and said they didn't have one. The server came back a few minutes later, and asked if we needed anything else, and I asked him for a tambourine, while the boy said, he'd already asked for one downstairs. He said, if the lady downstairs didn't have it, then we probably don't have one available. I thought that was the end of it, and resigned myself to a tambourine-less night, when two minutes later, the lady comes in with my tambourine! I was stoked.  Reservations for karaoke rooms are good for Friday or Saturday, but make sure you keep it or else they charge your credit card anyway. Rooms are $30 an hour, with a minimum of $10/person/hour on food and beverages ordered in the room. It can get pretty pricey, and last night was $40/person for 2 hours, but it's a good time. One stop for Korean food and karaoke! I'll be back.

mL8c25qywW6_oRX9z4m1YQ.review_text: Food is a bit overpriced for it's quality. The menu has a good selection of food and of course, there's soju! :) The atmosphere is noisy and the staff is ok, nothing speical. Good place if you are around the area but not worth driving there if you are not. Not sure about the karaoke rooms, never been up there...

QrR7HmI39mkGBxy7Y0g2CA.review_text: This would turn out to be a tale of two cities the night we went here.   We came here for one of my best bro's 30th b-day and I was prepared to spent a LOT of money because of it. Appetizers, drinks, desert - you name it and I was more than happy to plop down my mastercard.   We arrived and notified the host we had a reservation. The male host tells us "that table *points* will be free in 15 minutes, than its yours" A few minutes later, the group gets up...and a female hostess sits someone ELSE at our table! Luckily another table opened up seconds later.   We sit down and we're not oblivious to not see that we are 3 of the 6 non-asian people here. No biggie - I'm from Fremont, its not new. Then the following happened. A COMPLETE STRANGER- never met her before, an Indian girl I believe, walks up to us and says:  "Heads-up guys, I think they're racist here if you're not Asian. We waited like an hour and the waiter wouldn't take our order, we had to go GET him."  Thats not how you want to start a big evening. None the less, our waiter arrived and took our drink order. In the mean time, we would order our food and sip some soju while we waited for two others to show up.   Fifteen minutes later the other two guests arrive and order. Being a busy night, our food arrived 30 to 45 mins later. Being a polite bunch of joes, we wait for the other two to get their food. So we wait....and wait...and wait...and wait.   This is now too much to bear, its been 25 mins since my food arrived. I'm starving and there is no sign of the waiter so we decide to eat before it gets cold. The other two are STILL waiting. We turn our plates into a mass of chicken bones and sticky stuff. Its now been OVER 45 minutes. The other two guests still have not received their food. We're irritated now. They ordered 15 mins after we did, how is the delay over 45? Shortly after, the waiter showed up with their entrees and said one of them was on the house. The also had an automatic gratuity for a party of 5?  The kitchen service was a disaster but the food was amazing and the waiter was nice enough to comp one of our dishes.  So...is what the Indian girl said true? I don't know.

C1AebaLdwqjOpZRaHKWKAw.review_text: I reserved this place for my dirty-30 with the high hopes that my entire party of 20 would be pleased and have a great time before we headed out to the lounge.  Setting the reservation was easy and the party manager was a pleasure to work with.  She gets 5 stars all by herself.  As the night went on, the stars decreased...  When my party and I arrived we were immediately seated in our 20-person karaoke room where the room was really small to fit our 20-person party but we managed.  The hostess immediately instructed us on how to order through the phone (like room service style) and how to operate the karaoke machine as well as show us where the titles were listed in english in the karaoke book.  That was great.  Now, onto ordering.  I quickly ordered food and drinks for some of the people in the party as others were still looking through the menu.  I of course had to order for myself.  The food took a bit long but out of the food I ordered I only received one order as well as no drinks for myself.  I guess it was water for me at that point.  Anyway, I was always in and out of the room as even more guests arrived.  Our so-called 20-person room only fit about 10-12 filipinos while the rest of my guests ate at the bar downstairs or at their own table.  So while most people received their food, I was still waiting for my last dish and yogurt soju but to my disappointment nothing showed.  It was not 10:30 and time for us to leave.  We received the check and to my disappointment, the drinks I ordered were on the check but we never received it.  They immediately fixed that error.  When we received the check again we were surprised to see that the check was in korean and not in english.  How were we supposed to know if the check was correct.  It was time to go and we just paid it all.   I left hungry and buzzed.  The bartender was cool but there was only one and so she was bombarded with a ton of requests.  I really wanted to love this place as I heard some great reviews but my experience was only subpar.  The party manager was the best part of the place and then the karaoke was next in line.  The soju that I drank from a friend was cool but the food would have tasted good had I received my food in the first place.  Sorry Playground, I'm not coming back with a big group.  However, if I did come back, it would definitely not be with a group of 20.

LlDS1Mdu-4pEyQTvBIgJyg.review_text: The food is okay based on a few visits but I really wasn't paying a LOT of attention to it the last time I came cuz I was more focused on the drinks b/c we came after dinner~  *Most recently we ordered: - dakkangjung - crispy chicken w/ sweet/spicy sauce - dol sot bibimbap  - cooked veggies, beef, rice  - yachaejeon - veggie pancake - seafood soondubu jjigae - soft tofu soup - soju...yogurt soju cocktail, OB....  My guy friends came a lot over the semester and became good friends with one of the bartenders, but I haven't decided if they're really friends or if it's cause they buy copious amounts of drinks from her..... either way she and all the workers are nice... but since it gets really busy they can get slow. Also there's somethin about the dark walls +neon lights + TVs + loud groups (incl ours) that gives off this buzzed atmosphere....so it's def not the most ideal environment for a date or something like that~  My roommate also had a bday party here and got a room upstairs for noraebang....they let us fit in like 20 people but it was def crowdedd~~ A few wks ago my friends came back and managed to crank out a $300 bill that apparently sobered them up....

xvs-5NT7SPs1fl5df9kXVg.review_text: Friends and I decided last minute to find a karaoke bar after getting some ramen.  Luckily Playground had 1 private room left for us for 1.5 hrs.  Rates that night were $30/hr plus $15/person minimum.  We were a little surprised by the minimum, but if everyone is ready to drink a lot it's easy to hit.  However, we had been drinking all day (beer crawl) and were super full from Ramen that we didn't quite get our monies worth.  The room was decent and after we figure out how to work the remote, it was quite fun.  It would have been nice if we didn't have the cost minimum with the time limit, but I guess you gotta take what you can get on a saturday night with no reservations.

Ae1atVuqSF8r5QkchacXVg.review_text: Tiny rooms, hard to follow Karaoke binders make this place hard for me to rate it above 3 stars. The food was pretty good for a karaoke place, but their lack of vegetarian food bothers me and my girlfriend. They have ample types of soju and hite for the alcoholic in you. It ended up being a little pricey for our group, but hey it's all part of the fun!

Eypq5gLLjCapBVVnMw_MyA.review_text: KTV is always pretty fun and it's better with pitches of hite. The food is ok, had some duk bo gi that was pretty spicy as was my friends soup. So far my choice for ktv in SF

v-T5NqUTzaJNMez8alt2Yg.review_text: Having guys with amazing hipster haircuts who smile and seem like native English speakers wait on you is a pretty different type of experience for this ahjuhma (older, married Korean woman).  We don't do karaoke and I don't drink (yes, booooring)...  So, this is about food, ambiance and service.  Afraid of the Yelp- and Check, Please-induced crowds, we got there shortly after 5pm on Saturday.  'Twas deserted so we were seated right away.  It has a black interior with black vinyl diner feel.  It took a little while for us to get our order taken, which was weird since things were far from hopping.  Ordered water dumplings (mool mandoo), the spicy fried chicken, jajang, dolsot bimbimbap, seafood dolsot bimbimbap and jampbong.   The water dumplings, jampbong and jajang were excellent - 5 stars.  I can say that I've found the jajang of my dreams - nice thick savory sauce, loads of toothsome noodles and not too onion-y.  Selection of banchan was 3 stars as it was limited although the kimchee was excellent.  The dolsot bimbimbap had some Taco Bell-like ground beef crap.  Where's the bulgogi?  The fried chicken had hard fried batter and way too much of it - I'd pass unless you are really drunk.  They checked on us once and then disappeared.  We asked for the check 3 times and it finally came.  Service 2 stars.  The music was blasting and yes, I get that this is supposed to be a nightclub-like atmosphere so the televisions playing Korean variety shows were mildly entertaining, but, it got annoying fast and we wanted out.  If I want noodles and dumplings (which is often), I'll come back and get it to go.

7qFhwSIxr0GWaE_jt-i-HA.review_text: It was my first time here, and we had a large party.  I felt that the table they gave us wasn't big enough since we had close to 20 people and everyone ended up squishing in at a corner.    The waiters took awhile to get everything out, but the orders were taken efficiently and we had a lot of drinks coming, so that was good.  The drinks were strong and the food tasted good, no complaints here!

ES4QA9zxqPsX5MKCJPzHHA.review_text: This is a fun place! Especially with a crowd, just order a bunch of food and guzzle some soju. Haven't tried the karaoke, but one of my favorite dish is the corn with cheese. What kind of cheese is on it?! So simple, yet so good.

IVH9y0y_VCZRlrUfQ5E-zA.review_text: Service is ok, but I just go here for the yogurt soju and that cheese corn concoction.

x3_4olglCJuNSDBF9DPvAA.review_text: This sistah LOVES PLAYGROUND!  Went with 3 friends to celebrate birthdays to some soju and karayoke.  I will DEFINITELY be back there.  Pretty good selection of songs and able to comfortably fit at least 6-8 people in the room we were in.  Food was tasty especially since it was eat, drink and sing type of environment.  Even the shy need not worry.  Go there, and sing your b--- off.

0WcUP0kdhdx4A-L9d7mHgw.review_text: Good jja-jang-myun for those of you wanting late-night eats of the kind.  Fun and lively atmosphere and the karaoke rooms have the most up-to-date songs that I've been to in a while.  The yogurut soju is delicious and a creeper.  So don't be fooled by the sweet yumminess of it.

YVoKYbdoO-MKETpidOHZWw.review_text: The food was actually pretty good.  The portions were huge.  The Bulgogi was solid.  The Galbi was tasty but a little fatty.  We also had a stir fry dish that was good.  Can't remember the name but it was spicy.  We were meeting a group of people for dinner and karaoke and got there a bit early so we sat at the bar for a drink.  We were suprised to receive a complimentary corn and cheese concoction.  Although it didn't look particularly appetizing, it was really good.  In fact, I might try making this at home.  Overall, good meal, friendly people and private karaoke rooms to boot.  I'm not sure I would come here for the food alone but if you are interested in karaoke might as well have dinner there and make a full night of it.

ErJcnrBcG9-HXiB_gTp_zA.review_text: Delicious! The ambiance is very dark, but that's an excuse to get close to your friends or date as you share the light from the tiny overhead bulb to read the menu, lol. The music is LOUD. The complimentary appetizers are ample and very tasty! Corn and cheese!   Bimbimbap: all the ingredients worked so well together noodle dish that started with a J: beautiful. soft, tender beef, crunchy veggies, just the right amount of sauce.  yogurt soju: a must-order.   We also got free yogurt sprinkled with fruity pebbles at the end, so sweet all this, plus really friendly service means I will definitely be back!

3uPAF2-YwiTUN5NvVH6pIQ.review_text: Late night drinks and food and private karaoke rooms. What's not to love? Might get expensive though.  All in the heart of Japantown! It was a little noisy but I still like the atmosphere. I also love the yogurt soju drink as well!   The karaoke rooms were a little odd shaped and once you're up there, you don't really get any service. At least it was not as easy to get service. I say I'm a fan of this place until I find something better. :)

rdYds7DdlCczgctT7WzNlw.review_text: Not only do they have wonderfully attentive service but they offer complimentary corn with cheese! I don't know why my friends and I are such suckers for this "dish", but  yum! They're the only place that offers this as a side (I think Toyose has it as an appetizer?) along with a loud helping full of Korean pop. you learn to tune this out after 15 mins. The singers/ groups look all the same, formulated like 90's boy band.  come before 9 and you'll find seating.  I really want to try their fried chicken but they don't do it without the bones. so i settled for soju.

x5bg_m9FXy2xut2pPqjWQQ.review_text: Great place to get food and drinks. I came here to karaoke and get some Korean food while getting a little buzzed. The karaoke is in small rooms and the service is pretty good. Most people don't care about the service while intoxicated so I really can't  be the judge of it.

EOo322SMnZ1end4nROsWIA.review_text: i woke up this morning at 10, i wake up and i have an ache in my throat and my side, the place where my liver is supposed to be. yep. it happened again. i passed out and someone pawned my organs. its not really that bad, i just cant pee normally ever again. instead i have tubes that come out of where my liver was and i carry a really large bag wherever i go.   hahah yeah right. thats how i feel each time i wake up, knowing that i really shouldn't have drank that much and sang that many backstreet boy's songs.   Long night, much money spent. too much mixed soju drank. wallet is crying. liver is dying. voice gone. that pretty much sums up last night  great things at this place are mixed sojus and song selections  if you want to be a rapper, you can.(big thangs poppin) if you want to be the next savage garden, you can. (truly madly deeply)  if you want to go rhasta on everyones ass, you can. (no woman no cry). if you are feeling adventurous and really bisexual, you can. (..anything from tatu.)   YES . WE.. CAN!!  sing karaoke.  but remember to get the yogurt soju, the lychee soju, and the strawberry soju. they are so good. careful of the bill though. overall, floors can be sticky, place smells like sweat, and there really isn't enough air-conditioning. cheers

GawyLibaMGt3PCsv-hI5sA.review_text: This was our Playground.  This place reminds me of the places we used to go drink in college.....dark, with neon blue lights, endless bottles of cheap soju and great bar food.  Playground rocks!  Their food is excellent!  Great food and  a variety of soju.  The staff is so cute, they're all Korean and they wear these black baseball jersey's with white numbers.  That too is VERY Korean.  I love it.   Recipe for a good down home Korean time: 2 Bottles of Bec Soju (Ginger Soju) 2 Bottles of Regular Soju (Cha Me Sul) 2 Packs of Marlboro Lights  1 Bi Bin Mandoo  1 Ramen Duk Bok Kee  They play the latest Korean music video's on the flat screens and you get to eat, drink, and catch up with friends.  You'll be karaoking by the end.  It's the Korean way.    Very good for groups, bdays.    Ahn Young!  *^^*

Qs3SSo2RNv4C2BiVTtFSEQ.review_text: Went there Saturday night. The fried Kanpoong chicken is very good. I had it the previous week but it was to go. Wanted to try it at the restaurant, I never been there before or even heard about it. Didn't know it was a Korean Fusion karaoke bar. It's good if you like to eat with loud hip hop music playing and drunk people yelling over the music to hear each other talk while they eat and do shots. It's a good place, but i need to be almost drunk to go back there. But the kanpoong chicken is very good for pick up.  Oh, yeah I'm also Half Korean and I cook Korean food at home.

EzCLDNVlT7ztlcD8lGF-nA.review_text: Cheap karaoke at $30/hour for big rooms! We fit 11 people in comfortably and a large variety of songs. The remotes are all in Korean, but they have these awesome diagrams on the wall that tell you what to do. So much easier to figure out than other places. Just overall a cool place to sing. Sadly, I think the people downstairs could hear us easily (there is a restaurant/bar on the lower floor.)  They allow you to eat food in the rooms too, so that was nice. We munched on dinner while singing. Decent Korean food and watered-down soju, but good enough for karaoke.

LPkXc94_xyRN09d8sXSR7Q.review_text: Late night korean food munchies? Went to a bar/club that just didn't offer you as much fun as you'd like? Playground is the answer!  I came here on a Friday night after a birthday party for a friend at a classy wine bar -- obviously the night took a 180 turn for the best! This place is loud, energetic, plays Kpop/music videos on a large jumbo screen and is just full of people who are having a great time. The highlights would be the delicious korean dishes -- fire chicken, egg pancakes, fried chicken, kimchi fried rice, noodles, daikon side dishes, corn and cheese, etc etc. SOJU - yogurt soju there tastes just like calpico with a kick that will leave you regretting everything the next morning.  This place condones cheering with adjacent tables and soju bombs/soju waterfalls. They let you have your fun :)   My friend compared this to seoul korea without all the lights of the city.  Getting a cab out of japan town at the corner where playground is pretty easy too!  I can't wait to come back!

sMPNFm9hBVT-dhOdUcod5Q.review_text: Excellent service, excellent food, excellent beer.  Came here after a fundraiser event for the Taiwan Cultural Festival one night after it was suggested by another friend.  I was just expecting another Korean establishment similar to Brother, but boy was I surprised.  First, this place was packed at 1 am when we arrived, and a good portion of the patrons were Korean, so I figured it had to be pretty good.  The place was well lighted and pretty clean, and had a good vibe going on inside.    We ordered the fried chicken and army soup, and maybe a few other things, but don't really remember as it was way past my bedtime.    The army soup (or budae-jigae for those of you who prefer the Korean name) definitely had a kick to it, and boy was I paying for it the next day.  But it was so good, I didn't care, and kept attacking it.  But the real gem here was the fried chicken.  I really like 99 Chicken in the South Bay too, but it seems like 99 Chicken's specialty is that sauce they put on it, which I am not a big fan of.  So comparing the non-sauced 99 Chicken and the fried chicken at Playground, the fried chicken at Playground wins hands-down.  I don't know if it's the batter that they use to fry the chicken or something else, but it was so good that we were considering to order another large plate for the table, but since we were all watching our girlish figures, and since it was already 2:30 am, we decided not to do that.  The waiters were quick and attentive to us, and with so many people in the place, and the fact that it was so late into the night, everything came out pretty quickly.  I will definitely have to go here again someday to try out the other dishes, and more importantly, when I am a bit more sober...

U8IxHYD_R73IPQL5hduJgw.review_text: $10 for garlic fries? $20 for galbi? $18 for bulgogi? No thanks. Wanted to get a karaoke room, but we were turned away. Not sure why they would be too full to accommodate us with these prices.

U0td8N54h7ILgmGDb1yGjQ.review_text: One of my fave things to do back home in the south bay is to go to one of the fun Korean restaurant/bars, eat, drink, and be merry.  I was craving an experience like that tonight and Playground came to mind.  Being kind late on a tuesday night...it was pretty empty so we had almost had the place to ourselves.    We ordered deep fried beef with some kind of sweet garlic sauce, Tofu Soup, and a LARGE yogurt soju.  Yep, we celebrated Fat Tuesday right...at a korean bar!!  The food ended up being really good and we were having a great time drinking the soju.  But, my bill WAS pretty fatty.  Next time, I'll try and wait to go back to San Jose :)

SjX_4tpusPeZd_5a7txkXQ.review_text: Korean Food, Soju , Karoake all at one time? They have private rooms upstairs with a minimum of $200?! purchase of korean food or soju,.. def a good deal esp if you are with 10+ people.   Song selections are bleh,. and the system is old,.. but they do have good Korean Food,.  Will be back; if I want to drink $200 worth of soju and sing!

dm6eONxXK531hc8lCd2tNQ.review_text: I had reserved the 'big" karaoke room for a Thursday night birthday party of 30... come the big night, 20 people flaked! Janet (owner?  manager?) was incredibly accommodating and flexible.  We were escorted upstairs to our karaoke room and walked into a cozy little space that no way in hell would have reasonably fit 30 people.  They say it's made for 20 people, but us 10 were able to spread out and occupy most of the room comfortably (read:  thanks to the 20 flakes!).  Once in the room with the karaoke machine cranked on- we enjoyed yummy spicy chicken, spam fried rice and a burger-beef thing to the out of tune versions of everybody's favorite Celine Dion, Usher and System of a Down hits.  Good times.  The service was prompt and very friendly, the drinks were cold and the food hot.

o-NPgmrcihUoE0afXAmoPg.review_text: Cheese corn! Flavored soju! What's not to love about this place? Sure, it's not the cream of the crop of Korean food, but I've always had a good time at Playground.  We usually get the bulgolgi, dol sot bimimbap, and of course bonchon chicken wings!  The last time we came we had at least four carafes of different flavored soju. I think my favorite one was the lychee flavor.  Playground also has Karaoke, but I prefer Yamasho over Playground.  My friend tried to book a room here for Karaoke for a birthday party. The room is $30/hr, however they require a $25 drink/food minimum PER PERSON. Not really sure how I feel about that. I guess if you are eating dinner here, it would be fine, but that's steep for just karaoke.

vRjVhl3ONG2GfWY4NXJZbQ.review_text: Who wouldn't enjoy being in a room of drunk people screaming out lyrics to She Bangs?  Well, that's what the birthday celebratant wanted, so what's a guy to do?  I have to admit the karaoke rooms were awesome: roomy, had a comfy sofa, good song selection, and had the disco ball.  The drinks were pricey but you could probably sneak in your own.  And the food is maybe par but you don't come here for food, do ya?  Overall, a really good place for Karaoke.

HmPPjA7BJGnQvTwexUC0Sw.review_text: This place is a lot of fun. The atmosphere is boisterous and upbeat. The food is really high quality and you get a lot of it for the money. I've not done the karaoke there but even if you're just there for the food you will enjoy yourself and have a good time. I recommend the fried chicken and highly recommend the bulgogi.

KbaLzIBhLJZQ1HJbQXtKSw.review_text: wow, i really like this place. its better than your typical korean soju ground, but with better food, easy street parking, and overall inviting vibe.

fT5FCPk8MWxsm-Ir-_4doA.review_text: Anyone who knows me knows how much I l LOVE karaoke.  I as so thrilled when I found out that my peeps were taking me here for round 1 of my bachelorette party.    I arrive to a room with a big table in the middle, decent seating and a TV in the corner.  We had several different kinds of soju (yogurt, strawberry and mango) and plenty of tasty food.  My friends and I were able to sing to our heart's content and we all had a blast.  it was definitely the right way to spend the evening.    So much fun!

lsSiIjAKVl-QRxKjRErBeg.review_text: All I wanted was to feel like I was back in Seoul again. I miss pocha-hopping, while gorging on delicious anju (booze food). Playground has everything from traditional Bibimbap to the tasty snacks I miss so much from the food tents in Korea. Happy hour runs from 5pm-7pm. 50% off drinks and selected pupus/anju. -The happy hour food menu prices are quite reasonable, ranging from $4 to $10. After my terrible experience at Udon Mugizo (see my previous review), I decided to drop by Playground for a little fun. It was my last night in town, I wasn't going to let that Toaster Strudel chick and crappy udon bring me down. Unsatisfied from my sad bowl of udon, I decided to order a bottle of CHAMISUL SOJU ($12, $6 during happy hour) and some munchies. - We polished off 3 bottles of soju. ***If you buy 4 bottles of soju (or mixed soju drinks), the 5th one is free! But you have to order it all at the same time. OJINGEO TWIGIM/FRIED SQUID TEMPURA (sm order $11.95, lg $14.95; $7.50 HH): bit.ly/1t8M42A Meaty pieces of calamari in a light crunchy batter. This was the perfect snack to go along with my refreshing crisp soju. COMPLIMENTARY BANCHAN: bit.ly/1vtMyGp You can always tell if Korean restaurant's food is going to be good or bad, just based on how much effort is put into their banchan/side dishes. This bar did not disappoint. You could tell that the banchan was made with love. - We had a variety of veggies: bean sprouts, jangajji (pickled jalapenos and daikon) kimchi, danmuji and broccoli. The kimchi was my favorite. Just had the right amt of spice and ripeness. - My vegetarian friend loved their broccoli, they gave us more upon request. The bartender eonni was super cool and friendly. COMPLIMENTARY CHEESE CORN: bit.ly/1uYMbCe Their infamous crack corn. Not sure what is in it exactly, but it's tasty. Canned corn, mayo and processed cheese never tasted so good! We couldn't stop eating it! Thanks Playground, you saved my would've-been crappy last night in SF. I'll be back again, trust.

CcBSl9mql-ZnuJZ-sNtokg.review_text: I have no idea what it's like to go to Playground. I don't know how delicious their food is or intoxicating their drinks.  Despite my three (3!) phone calls attempting to make a reservation, the staff at Playground could not manage to return my phone call.  Shameful.

oM7HuPqYgjTgVcNWr5jaRA.review_text: We were totally disappointed by this place. They were reviewed in Check Please Bay Area and we wanted to try them out. This place is run down. The food they serve is just mediocre. They have the typical Korean pub food like fried chicken, pot stickers and seafood pan cake. They do serve the popular Korean beer Hite and OB.  We did not try their Karaoke rooms but the hourly rental was reasonable.

2rm4auhnZmsbsPcokvpxJA.review_text: Peach flavored Soju! Cheese corn and potato salad! The waiter called our table, the potato salad crew. This place seats large parties. We brought a dice and played our own game with Soju and beer. If you feel like chilling out with friends in the city and don't feel like getting dolled up and all the other hassles to go clubbing, go here. It's worth your while and the service is great! They never yelled at us for being loud either. Great for Big Rowdy Groups!

khFA0eLpu7H08JOWtiVF8w.review_text: Ok. Soooo....in case you haven't noticed, I'm white. Yes, it's true. Shocker, I know. I'm like the whitest white person around, except for maybe, umm, dunno. I'm it. Luckily I was raised in northern California and not some really white place. By that I mean we had Mexicans too. So then I went to Cal, and there were lots of different kinds of people there. By different kinds of people I mean Asians. And some Indians.   So after 3 years, I had pretty much had enough of all that Berkeley diversity, so staying true to my Whitey McWhiterson roots, I moved to Germany, otherwise known as "The Whitest Place on Earth". Yeah, I know. I'm so brave...moved there all by myself to be with the white people. (Side note: I'm not actually German - I'm Irish/English/French/Italian/Polish Jew - i.e. a mutt)  But..slowly but surely, all that white started to get to me. I started to remember that there are actually other cultures, colors, cuisines...etc. I went to Japan, and started to miss Japanese food again...and finally I decided to return to our fair city. Thank god, right? I mean, WHAT would you do without me?   So...the other night I find myself at Playground, and let's just say we had been pre-drinking. And pre-eating. So I didn't really get a chance to enjoy the food here, but the few bites I had seemed good, and the service was great. Let me just say that I would be a raging bitch if I had to deal with that many drunk people on the regular.   Euge rolled up and immediately started ordering the bottles of Grey Goose, but I really wanted yogurt soju. Somehow I ended up alternating shots of soju and vodka...let me just say, this is a VERY VERY bad idea. Do not try this. Fast forward, and I realize (this is where all the white talk comes into play) I'm in the distinct minority. And that made me very happy. It's such a flip-flop from about 1.5 years ago, and it's why I moved back here. Don't get me wrong, I like white people too...but it's not really representative of the whole world. And here's where my kudos go out to Yelp - for bringing everyone together. For all of y'all's bitchiness, alcoholism and gossip-mongering ways, Yelp has a pretty cool community of relatively open-minded, friendly people, and I really appreciate it. No, I'm not drunk right now, and yes, my hormones are fluctuating wildly. What??! You want a piece of this?   So there was more drinking and many rooms of karaoke (norebang) madness. They gave us free food, we drank a ton, Ed and Omar were freestylin' it, Joy was ROCKING OUT (seriously, Joy, you are the clear star of the evening in my mind) and at one point I was screaming some song into the mic and I knocked over a whole pitcher of water onto my legs and apparently all over Jeff. Good times.   Why the three stars then? Well, the soju wasn't mixed very well, and kind of sucked in that regard. The decor is scary but I guess par for the course. I don't know. It wasn't perfect. The remotes in the rooms are all in Korean, which I obviously don't speak. Short of keeping Euge on a leash all night, I had no way of working those things.   Special thanks to Steph for being such a great organizer, and boo to the jerks who came through and tried to get out of paying. It was for a good cause!

LTx_jCFYwoiXpbYXUwjqbw.review_text: I always have a positive, enjoyable and tasty time at Playground. The service is friendly, fresh and fast! I seriously could come here every week and just kick back with a liter of Hite, soju and the spicy squid dish! Love it!!! Thanks to Janet and Lisa for running a tight ship! =) see you soon... thank you for the tasty *service* man-du!

ZcI_GYq5-CCGSP7C91NVlQ.review_text: I came here with a group of 6 near closing time and they were very friendly. Our food and drinks came out super fast and they made sure we had everything we needed before closing off the kitchen. The restaurant has the bar/club feel to it with dimmed lights and music blasting. When the lights came on, we booed and our waiter happened to be at our table and booed along with us. I thought that was super friendly of him considering that it was almost 2 in the morning aka closing time and most people would be irritable and annoyed of drunk people by that time.   I would recommend the short ribs, cheese corn and jajangmyun (black noodles) for those drunken nights. Each has their own unique flavors and you get your protein, carbs, vegetable, and dairy in all in one meal.   Overall, food was delicious, service was amazing, and I give this place a YASS!

xPIrcB3VxIUQIhEANQRPuA.review_text: its cool ambience! brings me back to Korea! I am not too big about the k-pop scene but this place embodies it pretty well. It is a pretty fun place to drink at!

ea-PmhBilKh25esPS1juhA.review_text: I really enjoy the food and drink here.  Big portion at reasonalbe price and very caring service.  I wish the soju bang in Oakland is more like the Playground.

6zOT4nVhA-BeHTbgPslvxw.review_text: The food was pretty good and so were the portions. I went with 3 other friends and we all ordered one plate each and shared it family style, which was enough to fill all of us up. We ordered the Peach soju and Yogurt soju.  The Yogurt soju is the best!!! It is a must, if you order soju.  The service was mediocre. They were very nice and all, but never checked up on us to see if we wanted anything. We always had to raise our hand to get their attention just to get something.  All in all, I would definitely recommend this restaurant/lounge. The prices aren't too bad either. An average plate will cost about $10. A small soju will cost about $15 and a large is about $25. So, it's very inexpensive and delicious food!

kie7nzDJYisVYHGWBS373Q.review_text: I'm biased.  Now, I've had great yang nyeom chicken at OB Chicken house and their chicken is absolutely awesome. So it's unfair for me to judge this place solely on their spicy wet fried chicken, which obviously doesn't come close.  Where this place does shine is the underage drinking options and the great korean soju mixes.  Add the karaoke rooms and you now have a great place to embarrass yourself!

vX25YeTtrmjT1-dXj1VmWg.review_text: I reserved their largest room for my birthday party and expected the worst..and was pleasantly surprised!    -Fast, unobtrusive service (you call and place order over the phone and they deliver to the rooms). -Alcohol:  Beer, Soju, Tequila, Vodka, etc! -Good selection of "American" music (not the most current), approx 200-300 songs in English (they have Korean music, etc.). -2 microphones - sound was good (could use 3 mic's). -Large room can accommodate approx. 20 people - one big sectional couch so you are cozy (in a good way). -Korean Food:  My friends said the food was good too!  It looked appetizing..I uh hum, was on a liquid diet that night.   -2 bathrooms (upstairs and downstairs). -Tambourine and Blow Up Guitar included.  30.00 HR +  18% gratuity.  Each Person must order at least $10 or $20 worth of food/drinks (Check first).  This is a lot of fun!!  A must do with your friends!

_jg7sgGBRKiW3PZoep0-oQ.review_text: I've gone here 3 times and will be going back hopefully soon... because I haven't tried their Karaoke YET !!  First time was in May of 09' after a wedding at Kabuki Hotel.. just across the street. Had a few drinks and it was a good time.     Second time was in August of 09' right after a really tough Saturday. It made me happier going there.. It was crowded and the drinks are always the same and consitently good.   Third time was for a Birthday in March of this yearrr. Had pineapple soju, strawberry soju, peach soju.. my fave was the peach one for sure : )

aPWoEg6XKU4EdaQ2JGQxgg.review_text: This is one of my favorite place for Korean food.  It's also a great place to hang out and have some drinks with friends.  My favorites: Yogurt Soju Seafood Pancake Budae Jigae Omrice

vOlY1wfmMghhYGBPdtfpgQ.review_text: 1st Star Each time i come, it gets packed fast, and usually a packed house means everyone gets a little impatient and crazy but, the waiters and waitress have good friendly customer service. Much Props.  2nd star The Food WOW's me, meaning its flavorful, in great portions. I love spicy hot food, sold For The Win!  3rd star I was introduced here through a friends birthday, I Loved it I introduced my friends for their birthdays here, They Loved it So far all the experience my friends had here, sold FTW  4th Star "The flavor soju is GOOD!!! Not too Heavy, Not too Light. My Favorite is Yogurt" - Friends sold FTW  Where's the 5th? -goes to decoration, its a bit dreary. -the music plays back to back a bit too much  but i do look forward to going back and testing out the karaoke.

QmvvC6z-_xHrhdE8q37BAA.review_text: In order to get a table here on the weekends, either make a reservation or make sure you know someone that works here.   Food&Drinks: Price is at a steady increase, but it is understandable considering the current economic status. Even though, people normally come here for the mixed Soju drinks (my favorite being the Yogurt one), which is yummy and will creep up on you if you have had one, too many pitchers. People often overlook the Korean food they actually serve here. The food is really good, the Korean flavors are on point. I, especially, like the cheese corn appetizer they serve here (I always ask for seconds!). I can't remember the name of the entree I've had here, but it's some sort of rice noodle thing in a spicy red sauce. It's yummmmmmmmmm!   Atmosphere: The handful of times I have been to Playground, there has either been someone who was so drunk they puked all over themselves or someone who was so drunk, they had no idea who they were yelling at. This place is constantly packed and I don't recall a night when they were not.   Service: If you had to deal with drunkies on a regular basis, I would imagine being upset, but that is not the case with the wait staff here at Playground. The service here is excellent!

_E8fCCrB9T4wZnX8CsS75A.review_text: This is probably the most poppin' place to be at late at night for food and drinks. You will usually see someone you know there. Best part! there is always street parking! Bad part is that if you get there too late like 10-11ish you will not get a table for a good hour.  Outside you will always see people smoking so if you are a smoker it is a nice place to be.  I've tried the spicy noodle soup (almost died eating it), fish sticks and french fries (not so good probably from costco or something), and cheese corn (so good!)

TGdnpYdQgPnKAd7JoC37pQ.review_text: the other review was old... this update was from thursday after getting drunk @ the academy of science with the crew...  playground... i don't remember what i ate i don't remember what i drank ok, I remember what i drank damn soju  thank you for yet another unforgettable forgettable night ;D

MWoE80sT-6QU3hO2PBHGzg.review_text: Playground is the type of place where you can go with no purpose and end up having a great night out. It may be in Japantown, but it is all Korean. By trade, it's a Korean restaurant, bar, and karaoke lounge. By reputation, it's whatever you want it to be. The fact that it's three places in one makes it a destination for people with different agendas. Some come just to eat Korean food, some come to rent out a room and karaoke all night, others just come to booze. I go there to booze.   I have not eaten a single morsel of food from this place, and thankfully (for your sake) I have never picked up a mic and rocked out in one of the many karaoke rooms you can rent out. I come here for one thing, and that's for the many varieties of flavored soju, of which there are many and all are good. Cool place with a very friendly staff, check it out one random night. There's a full review on my blog, see profile.

bXhEqA1ff37pIA6Qadkntg.review_text: First, the wait service was excellent! WE left a 20% tip just for that. Second, I like the vibe of the place, it's fun and lively. Third, we got window seating b/c we went fairly early at 7pm on a Saturday night. The view of Japantown below was nice. Third, the food we ordered: seafood pancake, squid stirfry and bbq beef ribs were good. We had Korean soju, Korean beer (HITE) and they provided free peanuts and yogurt for dessert! We also tried the lychee soju concoction which was a good price for a cocktail.  Go there and try it out - it's a different take on the traditional bbq style Korean restaurants.

0s_c3pTsuoc-T-tiHG9d7A.review_text: Five stars for an awesome time here karaoking Friday night (:O! :O! :O!) during my birthday weekend! They rocked the service, being super nice with the increase in # of people, AND gave us a huge free fruit platter.  On top of that, they asked me twice what I wanted to drink - on the house, and ended the night giving six of us free shots of lemon drops on our way out (with fresh squeezed lemon! - I got a small seed :D).  Really good La Boki. Probably the best in the city. And they have Chinese-Korean cuisine - dishes like Jajang-myun, with their own delicious homemade noodles.   (Obviously this review is for big group karaoke + dinner in the room.) Still, you did me right Playground. Kam-sa-hamnida!

m2fyxKaEZCtQNWcQL2dCow.review_text: Been here so many times late at night and the people who work here are always willing to get you the food and drinks you need.  As a full-blooded Korean I can say the food is great.  The selection is pretty nice too.  It is dark inside, but hey, just go late at night and your eyes will get adjusted to it.  I usually get the pork dishes and that's what I'd definitely recommend.  Overall, a good place to spend the late hours of the night and just chill with your friends.

3rBR1WbqpYm4c4FrnDlOKA.review_text: There's not too many great Korean Bar/Restaurants that has REALLY good food but I can just go here to eat w/o any alcohol which says a lot.  This is a place all wrapped in one for a good night ready to begin. There's a full bar plus all the flavored and regular soju.   Great Food, Variety of drinks and Karaoke. What else can you ask for??? BTW - The service is EXCELLENT. The Ahjima is super sweet who makes me feel so special every time I go.   I pretty much tried everything on the menu and I haven't ate anything yet that I didn't love.

oVgFYN37V-hr1BEas-Rd8Q.review_text: Um, this place rocks. A friend and I threw a joint birthday party here, and it was scrumptiously successful. I happen to be Korean, so the food hit home, but all our other friends who were there are non-Korean and loved it too! The food is mostly typical Korean food, except for a few rando's like the cheese-corn, which will please your Americanese cuisine-loving friends.   But the best part is the private room karaoke. After laughing at how confusing it is to turn on the TV (instructions are in Korean), you can belt your heart out to almost any American pop song you'd want to sing. Of course there are some songs they don't have, but there's enough to keep everyone happy. And when you want more beer, you just pick up the phone and they bring it up to you! (You still have to pay for it, unfortunately.) The room was $30/hour, and splitting it among 15 friends made it super-reasonable. They lose a star because they charged us for the extra 10 minutes we spent trying to get everyone out of the room--it just made them seem a little cheap.

CGRRvK_BiRLjgxv4fpwtDw.review_text: Came here for dinner with big group of 12.  Korean food was ok... exactly "meh. I've experienced better"  Ambiance is pretty ghetto, not really trendy or casual....didn't know what to make of it.  There was a projector playing korean music videos on the back wall the whole time-- which is good for those "I don't want to listen to you" moments.  We came excited for the budaejigae...but 1.5 hrs later- they told us it was still cooking.  Then 30 minutes later... they told us... oh it's still cooking.. then 2.5 hrs into dinner we finally got the check and left... leaving the Budaejigae "still cooking"...  Flavored soju was ridiculously sweet- nothing special and very very weak- we tried the strawberry and yogurt.  Strawberry was better. $25 for a large flask, $12 for small  Panchan only consisted of kimchi, radish, sprouts and cheesecorn.  Soondubu was watery with barely any seafood.  Galbi was A-ok  A+ dishes: Mandoo guk, Fried chicken,   Good for large groups and drunken nights, but make reservations!!

LU7ikPXZ5R8tv4oNQZQkKw.review_text: Yeah, Toyose was the shit until I got plastered here last weekend.  I was here for about 5 hours drinking up a storm.  By the end of the night every liquid on our table had soju in it including the water bottles.  Freakin awesome.  Lets just say it was sloppy.  Too bad the manatee was in China taking dumps into holes she had to dig in the yert she was staying in.  The soju cocktails here are pretty strong.  They dump about 3/4 of a bottle of soju in the cocktail.  We would order one more bottle and dump another bottle into the cocktail.  At toyose you cant do that because they fill the juice to the brim.  But at Playground you can fit almost 2 bottles of soju in one cocktail.  Freakin awesome.  The atmosphere here is more a party to get fucked up.  This is my new watering hole.  WOOT!  **Update** since this review I have gone 4 weekends straight.  Last weekend was my first time not going.  The owner is awesome.  Atleast somebody remembers the fatty.

i4juaE_k9msKROzElyaayQ.review_text: Went there for a random occasion on saturday nite. Some drama from a couple friends but the staff were chill about it. Especially, Janet, the bartender/owner/whoever the chill ass gal she was; even tho some of the ppl were being pretty damn obnoxious, she still treated everyone with a great attitude. She's just such a sweet and down to earth person, enjoyed talking to her.(it's hard to find such an attentive bartender nowadays outta the bars/lounges i been to in sf) I would definitely bring ppl here again for the service and the price.  p.s 15 diff. soju drinks, my friend tried 10 of them. yeah that's how much he liked it.

tduMSflg1bhAFDgWOr4MPg.review_text: I was very disappointed with my experience at Playground.  We rented out a private room for my friend's birthday.  The room and equipment were sticky, small, and pretty janky for the price we were paying.  I've done the whole ghetto Korean-karaoke-bar-thing, and if it's that kind of quality, it better be damn cheap. You can get rooms that are just as big and much cleaner at 99 Ranch for less than half the cost we paid at Playground.  The only reason we came to Playground is so we could eat and drink at the same time, but even the food and drinks were mediocre and way, way, way overpriced.  There is a minimum bill per person, on top of the rental fees for the room...the entire night ended up costing unreasonably more than we were expecting to pay.  I tried the fried chicken, which was probably the best food item although overpriced, some bbq dish, and the lychee & yogurt soju.  It was all just OK.  Overall, I will never be coming back to Playground - in my opinion, there are just better karaoke bars out there.

a5nkLzaI7vKmHbVRxiwH4Q.review_text: waiters and waitresses from this place are so nice...they keep checking how my table was doing and they never complained about asking more cheese corns...:) for free... this place is a fusion of korean and chinese...I strongly recommend FRIED SHRIMP on sweet and spicy sauce...I will definitely go back...:)

ve2eS5EudlXxoHRaq6oeiA.review_text: Came back again, always a good time, always poppin'.  But now that I think with a sober mind the soju is still rather expensive here.  But where else can you crash 15+ people at a table for alcohol and food at 1 am before the bar closes.

dE2TsjxjjaCD0L2G42YqIw.review_text: This place is almost ALWAYS packed on those weekend nights.  So waiting for a table is pretty much unavoidable, but they usually clear up fast.  Customer service is pretty good for a loud & and literally blue light-lit place. Food and drinks come to your table fairly quickly and next thing you know, you're intoxicated and full; as I am whenever I go here.   I forget names but I tried this corn & cheese dish one time because of my buddy's suggestion, even though it doesnt sound that appetizing, but its really good!  So try that...if you can figure out what it is. Actually, everything I've tried here has been delicious.  Go crazy!   Soju is fairly good and of course, Hite, is in abundance.  I love that beer, btw.  Especially since its sponsored by Big Bang. :)

98v_f4MQhbAK-SKeSATEEg.review_text: Come for the watered-down drinks and mediocre food, but stay for the K-pop videos projected on the tvs and walls.  They do have a wide selection of sojuices. They weren't bad, but tasted watered down. Tried the pineapple, peach, and lychee. Contemplated the yogurt one, but we watched them mix n make it and it didn't look very appetizing. the food was ok.  The service was hit or miss. Very hard to get more drinks sometimes or to get empty glassed, bottles, plates cleared out. While I was waiting to flag down someone, I spied a sizzling plate sit idle on a table for 15 min before they delivered it. That sucks.  What I like to do is watch the KPop videos. Its too loud in there (or music is too soft) to really be able to hear the vocals, but the videos are fun to watch. Mostly because of the backgrounds + costumes or scenery or it seems like the all the videos have all the same girls. until it loops to Black eyed peas ... Also, they have the play list on repeat because we saw the same videos in about the same order over multiple visits.

S62YEa0KUoxw86fYa3brnw.review_text: I swing my beats at the Playground, ya know...  Located above the New Danny's, Playground is a great nightlife spot that has a restaurant/bar area downstairs, and a few private karaoke booths upstairs.  We rented a room for about 3 hours and had all of the yoju/pineapple soju/various spirits we could suck down, along with some really, really excellent food.  I ordered the udon with seafood for myself, and also sampled the pre-ordered (I rolled in about 45 minutes late) potstickers, fried shrimp (amazing) and chicken.    We got some annoying feedback when singing while watching the random ass pictures of hula dancers and trams, but this place has a really decent English song selection.  And it's great, we just called downstairs when we wanted more food and booze and service was kind and quick.    Highly recommended.

wtp2fvDLFQxVgcW9POYseQ.review_text: Came here craving for Korean food.  The place looks like a club / setting because of the dimmed lights and projector of music videos with music playing in the background.  They also have private Karaoke rooms on the next floor up and I believe its $30 an hr and 18% gratitude is added.  I ordered the Crispy Fried chicken, and it came with a side of Korean type of coleslaw.  It was super hot from the fryer and it smelled really good.  I took a small bite and it was super way to hot so I had to wait for a bit.    The chicken was very crispy and a decent amount was given.  I had a bowl of rice and to go with the chicken and the Korean condiments that they usually give.  Kimchi, pickled cucumbers, etc...  Overall this place is good, a bit on the pricey side for Korean food.  -Parking -  Parking was overall a bit difficult, but just might take some time.  It is mostly street parking, but they do have an underground parking structure in Japan Town.

lCRntv4-tXaM052bYxmCyA.review_text: I was pretty hyped up to go to Playground by all the previous reviews here...and I have to say, the place did live up to all the hype. I was very happy--last night I had a three-way birthday celebration here with two of my friends and a large group of our friends (max 18 people)....granted, our group actually did start on our dinner late, but service was quick with getting our dishes out to us.   Let me say, the food was AMAZING. Very good, authentic Korean food--big portions, too, so our group shared the dishes family-style. Great quality jajjang myun, coroquette, bulgogi, bibimbpap, etc. Lots of little pre-dinner dishes. I was very happy with the dishes, and my friends were, too.  Karaoke was also lots of fun and did not disappoint--I was a little worried before I went to karaoke because I was not sure about their selection in Japanese songs...but they had a good mix of Japanese songs, similar to the karaoke place "Cafe U & I" back in Annandale, Virginia. The "new releases" are several months behind, but that's a given since that's how the specific karaoke song provider has worked in the past. Nonetheless, I was satisfied with the selection, and my friends thoroughly enjoyed singing songs from the English selection.  Last but not least, the soju recommended by other Yelpers--also did not disappoint! We tried the yogurt soju, peach soju, and strawberry--all three were very VERY delicious, although I feel I have more of a preference for the yogurt one since I liked its creaminess.  Definitely highly recommended place--for parties, or a small dinner--great service, great food, great fun. =)

lKUy2aJhDSN_BHr3bAaMvQ.review_text: We just arrived in SF on a Friday night and hadn't eaten dinner yet. By the time we got picked up and brought over to our friend's apt, it was already 9:30PM. We started to walk down to a local ramen shop but, when we got there, they had closed at 9:00PM. We walked a bit further to find Playground. We figured, why not, let's try it. So we walked up the suspect stairs to find a hole in the wall karaoke bar/restaurant. Kind of reminded me of the places we go to in K-Town in Los Angeles.   We ordered a pitcher of Hite which came in a big plastic bottle... almost the size of a 2 liter. Pretty cool. We also ordered the Rice cake with ramen and fish cake in spicy sauce as well as the chicken wings. They were both really good. It wasn't THE best rice cake I've ever had but it was satisfying for that late night crave. The wings were the best. It was fried lightly and had a sweet and spicy sauce about it. Just a wee too much batter but was still quite tasty.  Great for those late nite food cravings!!

rf6razuvxQYqJTY-ziZWZg.review_text: From what I remember, this place is awesome. We came here last Friday for my birthday and we had a great time. Pretty much made our night  Things that I remember: Sweet Caronline Carafes of soju and orange Tambarene A room with a roof that was a little too short

aGKhooafW3zlKcK2Wp25uA.review_text: I use to love the fried chicken here but the food quality has gone down over the past few times I've been here.  It's still a great place for late night eats and a drink.

LV1frcg7QQhiDlyCqh2CdQ.review_text: Okay this place went from 3.5 stars to 4, because I had two crackin' nights in a row this past weekend AND they added bulgogi fries. And I totally forgot really how good their cheese corn was, might I add that this place serves cheese corn as a banchan dish. Cheese corn is usually an appetizer or side on the menu at other places...so ay yooo.   Both Friday and Saturday night was pretty packed, which hyped it up for me. I ran into A LOT of old friends and made new ones!!

VwVs8mojv6YEzjxpJfaqxw.review_text: Let me see if I remember correctly.  Got there at 6pm -  Ordered #17, 24, 44,    oh, heck.   Just order, already!    Food is great!

i1XA0Gd2rYtsi665QJZtvQ.review_text: Wow, what happen to this place?! It went from pretty crappy to ghetto pos. how is this place still even in business??? Oh that's right, they serve drinks to underage kids.

u9TQEdB8TeZyrpnOgxpqgQ.review_text: Checked out Playground with my sis for a weeknight dinner.  It's a hip young place, but as a Korean I found the place decent, but not really "great".    The service was a bit on the slow side, though friendly enough.  The side dishes: kind of lifeless in texture and flavor.  Kimchi should be crisp and perky!    As for entrees, we had our favorite comfort food:  omurice (omelet filled with fried rice) and jajangmyung (noodles with black bean sauce).  Both were tasty enough, but again could have been more savory and had better texture.    And, the soju cocktail.  We had the yogurt version ($12 for a carafe to share).  Again, it was okay, not great.  In Vancouver we had amazing lemon soju cocktail made with fresh lemonade soda; looking at the version on the other tables, they all looked artificially flavored.    Finally, we had to leave in a hurry because something spicy was burning in the kitchen, making us cough along with half the other patrons.  .    Oh well.  SF and Oakland do good BBQ, but as for the other stuff, I guess I have to keep going back to LA and Vancouver.  Given the dearth of non-BBQ places around here, I will give Playground another try.  It's not a bad place to hang out in Japan Town.

gjfcfzrYZ0O1xINHtnQKiA.review_text: This Korean eatery is hidden upstairs of Denny's in Japan Town.  The food is solid especially when it comes to jajang myun and tang soo yook (sweet and sour pork).  The owner is a sweet, friendly lady, who runs an establishment that serves plenty of side dishes including kimchee, fish cake, and corn with melted cheese.  If you're out and about late at night, check out this place.

r636kd302eGgDGuS-dR4bQ.review_text: Ill go ahead and say it, this is the best korean food ive eaten in San Francisco.  Coming from Berkeley where there are korean places a plenty, it was hard pressed to find one comparable in SF.  Unbeknownst to me at the time, it was in Japantown of all places.    Hands down food was great.  My friend orderred so I'm not sure what the exact dishes were but we got some noodles with black bean sauce, dumpling soup, and a spicy chicken dish.  If I was drunk, I would have been a asian kid in a korean candy shop.  But I wasn't, and do you know why?!  THEY HAD NO JAPANESE BEER.....IN JAPANTOWN! okok i know i know, its a korean bar/restaurant, but still...you dont have the top 2 most famous asian beers at the place was sort of disappointing.  On a side note, I did enjoy my bottle of Hite beer.  Also, we didn't get all of the little dishes that everyone got and that was disappointing.  Combined with the lack of Sapporo I am forced to dock one star from this place.  Yes I would come back here again, and yes, the food was great.  I wish I was more drunk at the time but alas, I'll have to settle for savory korean food.

xVlX2zA7kWYBDjhYyNQXHw.review_text: First review, so Janet you should feel so lucky. I am a long time regular here ever since they've been serving lunch.  This place has become my "Cheers" where all the staff including the dishwasher knows me.  This is a great place to either hang your hat and enjoy a quick nightcap, enjoy a fun night out with large groups of friends drinking copious amounts of soju cocktails and delicious homestyle korean food, or show off the pipes in their multiple karaoke rooms.   What to order: Yogurt or Lychee soju carafes (big kine...go big or go home), duk bok-ki (a thick-rice noodle swimming in a spicy sauce), jokbal (a very savory porks foot, thinly sliced and cooked till super tender...great with soju!).  Staff: Always super friendly and always having a great time with their guests.

VafnKfpYOlZ5s1gBWSRuEw.review_text: In my opinion the best Korean food i've ever had. I may be wrong being that i am not Korean, but i have tried other restaurants such as Toyose, Han Il Kwan, My Tofu House, Muguboka, etc. and i found Playground being the best i ever had. The only down side is that their prices are a bit more higher then other Korean places, but in the end i still prefer Playground as the place to go for my Korean cravings.  Service is great, staff is very friendly. My server, I remember was Jason. Jason's approached our group with a bright attitude and was very happy to serve us. Not being Korean i asked for his suggestions. Although i don't remember what exactly were the names of the things ordered, i remember they were delicious and was very pleased. Also, he always came and checked on us to see if we need anything else. Usually at Asian restaurants, especially Chinese, the food is great, but the service is just okay. But coming to Playground, besides the food being awesome, the service was also awesome. I feel comfortable coming here and I always have a very fulfilling dining experience.  Also, the portions of food are huge. The only place i've been to with cheese corn being a side-dish.   The atmosphere is another thing that really attracts me: k-pop music playing in the background, club-like feel with dark lighting and neon lights, and a bar. It is just an overall great place to chill, have a pitcher of OB or Hite and chat with friends. They do have a Karaoke room upstairs but i have never been up there. Looking forward to maybe having another birthday dinner here this year.

_r35DixNRywNCIrP4FmptQ.review_text: New favorite joint.  Hip atmosphere, very friendly staff, and outstanding food and drink.  Can't wait to go back here again.

2I7QMcjS0z--VMGFC2xYUw.review_text: FOOD: I looove the many little appetizers you always get with korean food! hahah.  The creamed corn with cheese dish is always a hit for me.  LOVE IT!  I had the duk bokki here, the rice rolls/cakes with fish cake.  It was good.  I've had better in LA, but this place is still good.  The jajang noodles were ok.   Soju is seriously THE thing here!  They're sooooo good!  LOVE LOVE LOOOOOVE playground's flavored sojus.  YUM!   AMBIENCE: This place is set for sit down meals, has a full bar, and also karoke rooms upstairs.  It's awesome!  Definitely a place for night time more so than the afternoons, though.  They play a lot of korean pop music here.  It reminds me of my college days when my roommates would blast that kind of music on a daily basis. Hahahaha. Located right across the Peace Plaza in Japantown.   When all else fails for finding parking, there's a parking lot across the street.  $4 bucks for 2 hours or so i think?  Fair enough with me. =)    SERVICE: The servers here are great!  The lady, especially, is super nice and helpful.  The male servers here all wear GIANTS/Playground jerseys which I think is super awesome!

J8X3xtFXhx_VOER6LFcn4Q.review_text: Organized an 20-person dinner and karaoke birthday party here and it was awesome. Tons of food at dinner, some great, some okay, and some things gross (black sausage), came out to $27/ea. including drinks.   The karaoke side of things was the best- we had a private room, stuffed in 20 people (they'd warned us that it would be 'compact' with more than 15) but size was fine, good song selection, huge screen TV, booths, nice sound system, and lots and lots of 55oz OB Korean beers.   Best songs of the night- britney's "Toxic" and group sing-a-long to "Aquarius"!

yBymxFYGrOm5rFy3UArH0g.review_text: Don't do it.  Food: Mediocre, nothing special. Definitely not worth the prices. Songs: Very old. Usually Karaoke places update their songs to include at  the very least 1 or 2 Top 40 hits. Songs differ in the two binders we had so it was very confusing to be flipping two books at a time to look for one song. Service: Attentive but unrealistic. Warnings should be given out with at least 30 minutes to go. Not 3 minutes after you serve 12 platters of food.

h8pthOnqCxV94D8-JkZXCQ.review_text: They hooked it up here!  We had a friend that knew one of the servers, and he just kept bringing food out to us!!!  I don't know if this is on the menu, but this dish was so simple, yet so delicious!  It's sweet yellow corn with melted mozzarella..... I know.. it sounds a bit weird and funky, but IT WAS SO GOOD!!!  And of course, going to any Korean late night institution, there is always yogurt soju and karaoke.  We did not engage in drunken San Francisco Idol, but we sure drank our soju... It's relatively low in alcohol content (about 20%), but because it is so low and the yogurt pretty much masks the taste.. you generally want to keep drinking it... until it hits you out of no where!  So just be careful :)  Overall, yeah I guess I liked this place.  We had a ton of food, service was great.. only thing that really annoyed me: the music videos on the projector.. I just couldn't stand it...... teeny boppers trying to act all adult and sexy.. the guys looked like girls... and uhg it just wasn't my cup of tea...

wNsSz6R73I3tcskuTv6yQw.review_text: I've come to Playground twice for dinner and karaoke and have always had a good time. They have a bar/restaurant downstairs and karaoke rooms upstairs where you can eat and drink. If you get a karaoke room, it's $30/hour with a minimum spending purchase of $20/person.   We got an 8-10 person room on my most recent visit and that was a little cramped for 10 people. The table was even more cramped, barely big enough to hold all the food and drinks we ordered. Somehow we made it work though. We ordered a hella ton of dol sot bim bim bop, some bulgolgi, cheesy corn, and a lot of beer and soju. Met our minimum spending requirements and had a great time singing out hearts out to the extensive song choices. Afterwards, we went downstairs to the bar and continued drinking. They've got a good collection of beer and soju. If you really want to mix it up and have a good time, ask about their soju bombs.   The only thing that really bugs me is that they are pretty strict about your room count. If you call and reserve a room for 10 people, they expect 10 people and will charge for that. I wish they were a bit more flexible and understanding if only say 9 people showed up.   Overall though, Playground is a very fun place to eat, drink, and sing.

DOLmXzZLGc3GnPQVnZm2Tw.review_text: nice workers, funny people, yummy drinks, fried foods, and karaoke. yay.  but i remember coming here once when they had softcore porn as the videos that went w/karaoke songs?!?!?! LOL, that was a night to remember.

ysCBsXWPB-LAiewVS3jZfQ.review_text: Two things of which I think San Francisco lacks sorely: Karaoke and Korean Food. Thankfully at Playground, one can have both. It isn't going to be the best Korean or the best karaoke experience for many who know this scene well, but it will serve as the one of the better venues to serve the lethal Asian combo of soju and singing. Noraebang, i.e. Asian (or Korean) style karaoke is a private room voice belting affair that is addicting and fun for all American Idol finalists and window cracking vocalists. There is no pressure of the public crowd or the random stranger filming you from afar (#1). Instead, it's all about friends, food, and fun. The song selection at Playground is decent. For the two rooms I got to check out, the sound system and the music videos that come with it are dated and a tad ghetto. (#2) There is a limited variety of English songs and a hell of a selection on Korean songs (but of course!). Please, someone invest in some quality wireless mics. Those wires are so 1990. Most Korean food in SF I've had has been very mediocre and Playground's offerings aren't doing much to deter me from that conclusion. All the jungol stews, banchan sides, pajun pancakes, myun variety of any kind has been lackluster at best. But instead of talking about the stuff I didn't like, here are a few things I think would work otherwise: * Cheese Corn. Don't have them zap that ish in a microwave in a plastic bowl. Have them serve it on a skillet. Trust me, it's *way* better this way. * Yogurt Soju. Sure it's cute and yogurt-y, but if they douse enough cham-cha-reum in there, it's game over for you lightweights. * Bulgolgi Fries. Southern California's Carne Asada fries have nothing on this beast. Extra cheesy with layers of kimchi make this heart attack of a platter, one worth having. * Mul Mandu. Boiled dumplings. They seem handmade, which is surprising for a club/nightlife type spot. Smooth skin, tasty filling, it is an excellent choice for folks wanting something semi-traditional without going the pubby food route. Lastly, the service is good. They're an amiable bunch, which I can't say is the case for many other similar places in the Bay. Hence, if I absolutely must do Korean anything in SF, it's more than likely I'll end up coming here. Big ups. ___________ (#1) Unless of course, you decided to sing with a bunch of strangers. Roofies isn't just a drug, it's a way of life for some folks. (#2) Relax. It's nothing like Do-Re-Mi (yelp.com/biz/do-re-mi-mu…).

LGySIUk-kWzMvnoQJb5suQ.review_text: This spot is great to go for large group of friends 10+ to get faded and sing your heart out ! I suggest soju it's good stuff and the seafood pancake and fried chicken is not a bad fade food :)

apd-cUxcnC5lA0DRIowDqw.review_text: Great happy hour deals! We got the friend chicken and pork dumplings. And also a bibimbap bowl. We are Korean food neophytes, so we don't have a lot to compare to. Chicken was crispy and the sauce was tasty. The pork dumplings were swimming on the plate, but the flavor was good. We liked the condiments, and the bibimbap was tasty. We also had a good server, who was available despite being busy. After reading about the yogurt soju drinks, he was happy to give us a sample (we'll get it next time!). Also nice, but distracting, to watch the music videos.

fKrXlmBItmzNXFn6JD4d1w.review_text: Five stars for the yoju (it's a yogurt/soju drink that goes down smoother than the downy cheeks of a Korean boy band pop star). Five stars for delicious Korean grub, including vegetarian bi bim bop and cheese corn (a.k.a. two of my most favorite things together as one). Five stars for the awesome karaoke room, and the completely random pictures on the video screen while you sing. (Think happy couples riding bicycles in Sausalito and sailboats on the water at sunset while you're wailing some AC/DC or the like.)  Minus a star for the first server we had, who seemed to have the same ideas of quality service that you might see in a teenager at a rural McDonald's.

I0ViOyrQqguZo-QSH9iDjQ.review_text: Anyone remember KoKo House on Telegraph Ave.? It was the place for underage Korean alcoholics to get their soju fix back before the turn of the century. It also served up some pretty tasty yang-nyum tong-dak (fried chicken marinated with Korean red pepper sauce) and dduk bokki (rice cakes in Korean red pepper sauce).   Soju is pretty disgusting, so now that I'm no longer underage and have access to that magical elixir known as tequila, I stay away from it. In fact, I think the last time I had soju, I was still underage and probably at Pojangmacha (also on Telegraph Ave., not sure if it's closed down as well).  Ended up at Playground last night and had flashbacks of college, except this time no one ended up barfing up their tong dak and dduk bokki or starting a fight outside. See, we do mature as we get older.  Soju is still as nasty as ever, but Korean bar food is still as yummy as ever.

cL-AqfiZcGRwkyfxRomGvw.review_text: Oh, come into my Playgound - but don't forget to bring a carafe of lemon soju!  Food was excellent and the vibrancy of the place gave us a much needed girls night on the town.  Food was slightly above average and there seemed to me a pretty good selection.  I've never been to a Korean place that has noodles with black bean sauce and BBQ.  The place can get pretty loud - so not the place to get romantic.  More of place to get squashed and have a GOOD time with friends!

txvgzVJIv7kyHNnyZWUFDA.review_text: When I came to Playground back in February, I had a horrible experience involving poultry that we'll just say was 'less than fresh.' As I stressed in my previous review and I'll repeat again, I had never had a bad time at Playground in any of the dozens of trips I had made here before that night; probably the only thing that had kept me from giving the place a single star.  In all fairness to the restaurant, I probably should've said something the moment I noticed a problem with the food. Janet, the hostess/owner, has been nothing but courteous and accommodating whenever I'm there with friends and I'm sure she would've taken care of any problems immediately.  Well here we are nearly half a year later and after a number of return visits back to Playground, I'm happy to report that night in February seems to have been an isolated fluke. The service still (understandably) lags when things get busy at night, but the food has been top notch. A number of their dishes are much better than many, if not most of the Korean restaurants in the area. Quite an exceptional feat for a place that's known more for being a drinking spot than an dining destination. Throw in private nrb rooms and yummy cheese corn! and you've got a formula that can't go wrong.

clQ5_3BFDqnJaebdp6LcHA.review_text: We saw this place on Check Please and since we were in J-Town at dinner time we decided to see for ourselves.  I cannot figure out what people are raving about. The food was mediocre. Poor service. Really sticky tables and floors. Way too cold inside (and I don't usually get cold).   Maybe you need to be drunk to appreciate this place?  From our table we saw two different groups of people come into the place, look around and then walk right out. Never a good sign.  What did they see that we didn't?    Some of the kimchee appetizer was pretty good, but two thumbs down on the shredded cheese on top of canned corn that was microwaved until melted and then served lukewarm.  (shown in main photo)  Handmade noodles with black bean sauce and seafood. Meh. Interesting molé sauce, I think, but it needed something... perhaps salt, but there was none on the table. One little shrimp, two muscles and and some sparse squid shrapnel doesn't justify attaching the word "seafood" to "noodles" and then charging five bucks more.  Oh, and it was hotter than hell with probably half a cup of sliced jalapenos. At least our burning mouths made us more or less forget how cold we were. Two thumbs down.  I thought I might just be too old to "get" this place but my 25 year old husband didn't get it either. Or, maybe we got it, but "it" was just crap.   Perhaps this is the best karaoke joint in San Francisco. I don't know. But I do know I wouldn't come here for the food.

euQzITWqjbNyAqJePXyrgw.review_text: You know you're only there for the delicious cocktail soju and karaoke! Don't lie to yourself =P  I usually recommend this place if I go out with a group of friends just as a casual hang out or a place to drink up in J-town.    Food-wise...they are typically good, just not WOW there's a party in my mouth good. I'm a beef eater so Bulgogi me up!! I guess if you want more authentic Korean variety dishes/flavor (like tofu soup) then its best you go to a restaurant.  This place is best for birthdays and drunk nights (just be careful existing out the door while drunk, it is on the 2nd floor and stairs only =P)   Karaoke...it's a Korean bar/K-room there are English and Chinese songs but not really up to date (no official MV for most of the songs, you do get landscapes panning around and beautiful women from the 80s walking & looking emo =P).  Why would you care about the MV when you should be half drunk, ignoring the people around you and start singing Michael Jackson's "Beat It" while grabbing your crotch?
