I can sit there all day and just pick on it one corn at a time.   The owner of the restaurant (I think she's a korean or japanese lady), is reallly nice. One time, one of the dishes we orders came in a VERY hot pot and I accidentally burned my arm while reaching for some food. When she found out, she felt realllly bad for me and immediately went to get me an ice pack, some kind of cream, and band-aids. She kept asking me if I'm ok.  The place can be reallly rowdy, loud, and stuffy sometimes though. The food can also be very spicy, so be careful of what you order if you can't eat spicy food. If you want to have a better time, there's karaoke rooms upstairs where you pay by hour. But I think they have mostly Korean songs and some English songs.

JvRC2InlYud__2xV6zl6gg.review_text: My first time at Playground was straight to a the top floor in a booked room, so I can't comment too much on the restaurant area.  However based on visual observation, seems to be a good place to hang out with friends or bring a date in a semi-quiet corner.  Some people eat here before moving onward to the room, since space can be cramped to have dinner.  My crowd were able to pull it off, but that's cause I organized the dishes (and the waitress kept coming by and taking away the dishes).  As for the rooms, well it's karaoke.  We were able to order food--very prompt service.  The food itself is decent and fairly priced.  it's Korean and you can probably get better Korean at a regular restaurant.  But still, given the combination of restaurant and noriben, they pull it off very well.    Sorry, no real comment on the food arrived late so I just simply ate what my friends ordered.  The food was semi-cold by then but still delicious, if that tells  you anything (or I was simply hungry??? haha)  I gave them a three stars, however, because the Karaoke list does not have the music organized by author, so you better know the song title to find it!!!  Also, the rooms are a tad noisy and not well padded.  Finally, that claustrophobic bathroom on the second floor is tiny!  Don't they know there are Asians taller than 5 4 who need to clear the door?

SH6JiBBLGYMqyWRS61pPqw.review_text: pro - i like this place so much i've been here at least 5 or 6 times, usually while intoxicated. con - i'm told that i've actually been here 20+ times on various occasions and i just don't remember being there because of my spectacularly advanced state of inebriation.  pro - they have soju with flavors like apple and cherry and lychee.  it's basically like drinking candy.  sweet alcoholic candy.  they taste pretty weak, but when it tastes like nothing you press on the gas a little harder and it seems like you're still going pretty slow so you press on the gas still a little harder and then BOOM before you know it all of a sudden everyone's drunk.   con - they have weird unflattering electric blue neon lighting that makes the soju necessary.  soju: facilitating AzN hookups since 1327.  pro - they have kareoke rooms upstairs con - i suck at singing.  but i insist on singing when i'm drunk.  i think it's programmed into my people's dna.  respect your elders, be good at math, and love kareoke.  i will punch you in the crotch, forcibly remove the remote control from your possession and dial up young mc's bust a move.  i will then hold on to the mic with a ninja death grip until i can tell you smarties about what to do at a party where girls are scantily clad and showing body.  btw, i do not get better at singing when drunk.  and i should never, ever, under any circumstances and in spite of my vigorous and sometimes violent protestations, be allowed to rap.  everyone suffers, no one wins, and somewhere angels are crying.  pro - walking distance from my apartment con - not if you're drunk.  it's like 6 long blocks up the hill (i'm on washington) and 1 over, which doesn't sound that bad, but if you're coming off of a soju / OB / hite / kareoke bender, this can TAKE FOREVER, YOU WILL GET LOST AT LEAST TWICE IN THESE 7 BLOCKS, and is NOT RECOMMENDED.    pro - the food is actually pretty decent.  the jajangmyeon (black bean noodles, which by the way wiki says is derived from a chinese dish, whatup, which has to be true because the interwebz is all knowing and never wrong) and the fried chicken are good.  also, they have this banchan (the little dishes that come out before the meal) that consists of corn with cheese melted on top.  wtf??  corn with cheese melted on top?  who does that?  either retarded or genius.  after one taste while buzzed, the verdict is: FUCKING GENIUS.  OMG THIS TASTES SO GOOD EXCUSE ME WAITRESS CAN YOU BRING OUT LIKE 10 OF THESE DISHES YEAH 10 NO JUST ME NO JUST PUT THEM IN FRONT OF ME DON'T TELL THE OTHERS THANKS.   con - the next morning you wake up and realize that you ate 10 dishes of corn with fucking cheese melted on top.

zpip_kWCOda43ZCWk0BFmQ.review_text: Don't expect to have "the best Korean food ever" at this place - expect to have large portions, a menu filled with Korean favorites and great service.   Pluses: - Great Pajun, raboki (ramen + ricecakes), and a variety of items on the menu - Really great service - Fast seating - usually don't have to wait long.  Minuses: - The side dishes are meh, nothing I would want to take home in a to-go box.  We will definitely go back when we want Korean food before a movie at Kabuki.

LnZUtFx6qTWs8NV6lAARxQ.review_text: *Disclaimer: Review is based solely on the private karaoke room*  The room was pretty spacious for our party of +15.  The list of songs to choose from really made it difficult to decide, but my friends and I found a solution: Sing 'em all!  Ha!  The wait staff here is real attentive.  They came in immediately if you called and somehow gaged exactly when to come back in to take away empty bottles & dirty plates.  The $30/hour charge for the room is pretty reasonable.  I have to admit rocking it out with the birthday boy ("J. To") and fellow yelper, Thomas L. was FAN-FREAKING-TASTIC!!!

gS_PQJ3gqhnCbz312m129g.review_text: Good food and amazing service = really fun night singing ridiculous songs with friends!

vcOtDqQ2Cc731kFjklFeBg.review_text: I had the time of my life here! Minus the fact that I got punched in the ear and four days later it still hurts =(  I really wasn't expecting much when I heard we were going to a karaoke place in Japantown but it ended up being amazing.  The bottom is a bar/restaurant and you go up the stairs to the karaoke rooms. The rooms are $30/hour with a 2 hour minimum. The rooms have kind of low ceilings so if you're any taller than 6 feet that might be a problem. They have a million songs to choose from and its really easy to work the remote song chooser thing. Later in the night we randomly realized we could turn the lights off  and it becomes some dark room with crazy lights like you're at a fucking rave or something.   The food is really expensive for what it is but I think they gave us a free plate of food at the end of the night since it showed up out of no where but we were so drunk we didn't really eat a lot of it. If it was free then I feel really bad. Sorry!!!! I would stick with the Asian food since I think the American food is all frozen and way over priced. Its something like $13 for some fries and mozzarella sticks.   The tab ended up being something ridiculous with each bottle of Grey Goose being $130. Every brand of vodka costs the same amount though but I swear it started tasting worse and worse as the night went on. Shouldn't it taste better and better?! I also tried sojou for the first time and it tasted okay. I read in another review it wasn't authentic tasting enough but everyone seemed to like it.   The service is amazing. The bartender was the nicest person I've ever met! Holy shit she was so sweet and gorgeous and she had the biggest engagement ring I've ever seen. I kept complimenting her on it haha.   Street parking was easy to find and there was a good amount of people there for a Wednesday night. Oh and you can also just call and order from the phone in the room and they'll bring it all up to you! Super easy.  I'm not the biggest fan of Japantown but Playground definitely makes up for it. Probs because its Korean.

4YU06g2ZB1QxTqP8AMlL7w.review_text: Tables are sticky. K-Pop video are blaring. How can one cook a bad tofu soup? This place. The beef are beyond chewy...

0cZaLvThOfuQa9spTMyv8g.review_text: Came here on a Friday night after a long night of drinking. We were ready for some food... and maybe more drinks.  I've there's one thing I've learned over the years, it's that soju with korean people often leads to blackouts. Many many blackouts.  We sat down and ordered a bottle of soju, and KFC (Korean Fried Chicken). The soju came out first and we started drinking. Shortly after, the banchan came out. There were quite a few dishes. This place had a lot of them, probably equivalent to the korean bbq places in LA's K-Town. In southbay, cheese corn costs money. Here, it's included.  The fried chicken came out next. When the fried chicken came out, they cleared the ban chan since they were mostly empty, and brought out more without us even asking for it.  So about this KFC... if I didn't know any better, I would say the sauce was more of a Chinese sauce. The chicken itself was decent. Overall, I much prefer southbay's 99 Chicken, or Irvine's BBQ Chicken. I didn't particularly enjoy the sauce here too much.   Well, that's all we really came for, so after we finished the chicken and soju, we called it a night.  This place is good for late night munchies and I enjoyed myself here. This place kind of has a dirtiness to it that I don't think I could appreciate if I were sober. Thus, late night, and only late night. Maybe I'll be back for the noraebang.

hRMpQlJQDObCpNSJ1qd_fA.review_text: This is a fun late night place (although they close promptly at 2am).  I love coming here with a group, grabbing a karaoke room and singing to our heart's content while being able to order off their full menu of tasty Korean food and strong soju drinks.  Granted the food could be better but when you mix it with singing and drinks, you can hardly tell!  This place is not cheap, a couple hours of singing can set you back $2-300 bones, and there's a $20 minimum order per person per room, so hit the ATM beforehand.

WnDtivun99cLyqDn4EGypA.review_text: Owner is very rude and mean to customers! First, the place is way overpriced for both food/drinks and room. Half the price at Ranch 99 in east bay. We got charged over $300 for the night, then the owner charged us $30 for bringing an outside beverage (costing way more than the beverage), when no other karaoke place does that. Lost my friend's jacket, then called the cops when he refused to be charged $30 more when they lost his jacket. Who does that? Call the cops on a customer who couldn't find a jacket??!? After all this, she yells at us and tells us we are not welcome ever again. Why? We didn't yell/make a scene/throw up on her. We weren't even drunk. We just didn't like being charged while they lost our belongings. Just because we're not korean and don't speak korean, doesn't mean you have to act discriminatory towards us! Do yourself a favor and frequent a friendlier, cheaper, and cleaner place than Playground. You'll end the night on a happier note.

a-iCmJ9RmoGoXnHOOKbqWQ.review_text: Every time I come here, I always order a large glass of yogurt soju with calamari. I love the appetizers they serve you. The wait can be a bit long during busy nights. I have yet to try the kareoke rooms.  And by the end of the night, the soju finally hits and there goes the start of a long, drunken night.   Overall, a good place to hang out with a group of friends. It's small but it gets to be like a restaurant/lounge thing without the dance floor.

84oPkNdCcisrtOmYK_ACwA.review_text: A small bar, private karaoke room upstairs, big screen t.v. playing music videos...This is the place to pregame before going clubbing. (LOL) Used to come every Saturday for drinks and small bites. My friends and I usually get couple Hite beers, couple Soju bottles and coke to make Someco. It's a Korean style mix drink that'll creep up on you! And we usually get their fried chicken!!! OMG! Bomb chicken! We also come here because we like their complimentary corn cheese. Playground always has a good crowd of people with good music. It's hard to get good service here due to the fact that they're always so busy. The owner is so young, nice and pretty. She gave us water dumplings on the house and sometimes the waiters give us soft yogurt on the house.  Price wise, I feel like they are slightly overpriced, but it's worth it  because they are very generous when I go with friends. =)

8rR5Bb5KOAfOqYiO9m5zyQ.review_text: A long time staple in Japantown for karaoke, dinner, and casual hangouts, I've been to Playground regularly over the past few years.   My friends and I however, had a sub-par karaoke experience last Saturday evening (on 3/1/14) that I just have to make a comment that I don't think I'll ever come back here in my own right.  We got a reservation for 1 hour of karaoke (from 9pm- 10pm) for our group of 7 people. We got there early so were hanging out in the bar area since around 8:30pm. Come 9pm, I started looking around for the host so we can prepare to walk over to the karaoke room, since that's when our reservation technically started. However, there were no hosts in sight. 5 minutes later, still no one approached our party to alert us that our room would be ready. at 9:10pm, we see a group similar to our size come down the steps. I figured that would probably be our room, and finally locating a host, I approached him to ask, to which he replied "give me a couple of minutes to clean up, I'll grab you guys."   Okay.  At 9:15pm, we were finally rounded and escorted to our karaoke room. So I figured they're just used to running slightly behind schedule with the reservations, and that we'd have until 10:15pm.   Nope, not the case.   At 9:45pm, our host said we had about 15 more minutes left, to which I replied "but we started 15 minutes late." He rudely said "no, you guys were seated in here at 9:05pm" which I KNEW was incorrect. Since the rest of my friends were drunk and singing away, I told the host "I was watching the clock when we sat down. I'm sober" to which he snapped "I am too. I'm working"  That's not how you retain customers. And for that reason, I'm taking our karaoke fun elsewhere.

Jt_GERujHtgp65YYN2c9gg.review_text: So this party shut down but we weren't ready to. Maybe there was some leftover partying from the Cherry Blossom Festival? Somewhere? We wound our way across the city and ended up here.  The hospitality alone gets five stars. We sat at the bar and were lucky enough to be served by Janet, the owner, who responded to our "anything but intestines" food order with two incredible entrees -- sauteed beef with onions, and the best sweet and sour shrimp I've ever had -- plus corn+cheese and some Korean appetizers. I eyed the Jurassic fruit plate next to me; we should have skipped dinner and gotten here earlier.  After a few minutes we noticed the private karaoke booths overhead. All booked for the evening but good to know there's another dimension to this place beyond good food, service and atmosphere.  Thanks for a great cap to the evening...I shall return.

bknc5ArQVmzcUJWoN3gCrw.review_text: Yogurt soju is the best cocktail here.  It's $13 for a small one (great for 2 people) and $25 for a large.  They have many flavors here, but be careful, they're not all that great.  Play it safe.  I like coming here for the cheese/mayo corn.  It just melts in my mouth.  I know I can make it at home, but its just so delicious with my cocktail.  When you look at the menu, don't let it freak you out.  You're probably going to think that its expensive, but trust me- the portions are huge.  I like the Black Bean Noodle.  It is a little spicy, but you can wash it down with your yogurt soju!!  Staff here is great.  I love coming here when I'm in the city.  Thanks Playground for making my boring clubbing nights into a great one.

I1dKh4olStlU7i-hEi4_TQ.review_text: Friendly staff. Stopped by for happy hour around 4pm on a Sat. Had the strawberry soju and some fries, corn, and lychee (on ice). The food is alright and prices are decently cheap.

FcjioveW2WDKx8QwTXg9KA.review_text: Came here for karaoke last night, what a blast!  It was a friend's birthday, so we made sure to reserve a room.  The flashing colored lights, the disco ball, the tambourines, the weird, random slide show photos that play while you sing all make for one fun night.  And the giant remotes look like they can take conference calls!  Prices seemed reasonable.  To rent a room is $30 an hour and there is a minimum order of $10.  We had two hours and split between us it was only a $25 for the night (we covered the birthday girl).  I think they can do better with song selections however.  There were some songs missing that are karaoke standards.  Hello, no Baby Got Back???!!!  But we still had a good time, as my scratchy voice proves :)

JcDXaiU3uOVAgi_c6JM2Zw.review_text: what can I say - its a room, you drink you sing, you go pee (which is conveniently located a few steps outside the private room), repeat.  The food and drinks are never going to be stellar and the sound systems never going to be as good as a stage system but its still great fun for a private party.  And of course you get to sing a hell of a lot more than an open mic place.  the english song selection is decent, but get's upgraded to great if you go with a group that can sing Japanese and Korean.  Festa has some korean songs but not many.  I can't stand the remote control.  I know I'm asian and supposed to be good with this stuff but I still don't know how to work that thing and I've been there 3 times.  I think the problem is its drunk proof - meaning you have to be sober to operate it.  that and one of the controllers is written in Korean? japanese? I can't tell.  As far as private rooms go this is probably the best bet in town - I know there are rooms with no alcohol, but nobody's getting me in a room for a few hours with no booze and singing.  if you're planning on going during prime time - get as many people as you can to go with you or they will pimp out the room to a higher bidder.  The highlight of my visits there was bumping into one of the Mythbuster guys in the room next to ours - awesome.

s93mGptf5LLAk06ptwGCSg.review_text: this is probably my favorite korean restaurant EVER! well for one the workers dont hate their jobs. the service is ok. but the reason i like this place the most is the menu. i recently started getting into korean food. i am not going to lie i am addicted to it, i go at least every week.   the menu has pictures on the left side of the item so if your not really sure WHAT it is you can get a general idea thats if your not familair with the items.   i like the food there alot the food is awesome. they give you side dishes which my favorite forever will be kimchi lol.   basically its a really nice atmosphere on a friday night if you want to go eat and drink. most of the time everybody is doing the same thing.   so screw going to chilis or TGIF i say go to the playground  i first came to this place cause my friend steve showed me so far i ve been going there since.   honestly i just think its the atmosphere that makes me coming back.   my favorite is the black noodles, which in korean is jjajang myun. its a cheap dish if your hungry but it fills you up. its noodles and you get this side dish of black sauce which has veggies and pork in it. you mix it in. i ve also had other dishes but i forgot what their called well if you like to party and you love spicy food. but dont mind price but then again i never care about price if the FOOD IS GOOD! definitely check it out.

Ux8EIsuJ31pArGQxaI5c6w.review_text: this is a cool place to hang out with friends especially at night. it has a cool laid back vibe to it and dim lighting. the food and drinks are definately overpriced. its about 12-15 for an item and like $15 for a carafe of fruit punch? $15 for a plate of dried out fried chicken and  also $15 for some cheesesticks and french fries LOL wth? wow.   but whatever it was good though, the drink that is. everything else tasted like the frozen stuff from costco. havent tried the soups and ramen yet, but i dont think i would pay that much. the other bad thing was that the frozen yogurt machine was broken so that was a dissapointment cause we came here mainly for dessert.  i only recommend coming here for drinks. and they mostly alcoholic drinks, so little kids are not that welcome.   oh yea and the waitress was cute so thats a plus! the service was really friendly and they also gave us a pack up korean or kap melon chewing gum so that was pretty neat.

Ud6j2HN40qEhycq2PuwcBA.review_text: Our friend raved about the spicy dumplings and that we must come to try this place out. So we had a group of 7 and decided it would be ideal. So we settled for family style fare, ordering 5 dishes, Kalbi, spicy dumplings, pot of noodles with spam, sausage and rice cake, spicy stirfry octopus and tofu with stirfry kimchee. Everything kinda looked the same with the same colored red sauce. Most dishes were decent and affordable and the corn with cheese side dish and the other many side dishes were $15 per person, lots of leftovers, it was a fun playground. Spicy dumplings were ok, unfortunately not to my liking but my fav was the spicy stirfry octopus and kalbi. Yum!

o-S7WwQafbQ2lbBU6QTNsg.review_text: We were originally planning to go to Yamasho because of the food, but ended up getting a call that, despite our reservation, the room is not available. So we were fortunate that Playground also offers food and drink, and the room is half the cost (of Yamasho.) They ask that we meet a food/beverage minimum of $20/person - 4 dishes, 3 pitchers, and a large yogurt soju did the trick for the nine of us.   The big problem, though, was that our group was late for our 7pm reservation and so we asked the host if we could extend our reservation through 9:30pm. He said yes since the next group wasn't til 10. At 9pm, a he was no longer working and a different staff wasn't aware of the extension promised to us. Then they explained that they wrote down the next party's reservation wrong so the next group was actually coming at 9pm. We kindly left the room, ate our food on a ledge, and paid the bill.   Their mistake - no discount. San Francisco needs more karaoke options.

EtzlIrcgAjFSycHGWhid4Q.review_text: I came here for happy hour, I got there at sharply 5pm because I wanted a table and whenever I go here at night its like a 40 minute wait!   So I got in and my party was the only party there. This place does not look so great during the day time, kinda a faded grey kind of look. We sat down and the odd old style korean music was in the background.   First thing that happened, our server said he couldn't find happy hour menus when I said we were there for happy hour...than he couldn't remember what was on the menu...than he found exactly enough for my table but after we looked at it he took it away because another group came it....  The soju was WEAK I frequent alot of korean bars and this one was by far the weakest mix and we told him to mix it strong too! The food was pretty good, we got the bulgogi, popcorn chicken, fried oysters, calimari, and kim chee fried rice.  The reason why this place only got 3 stars is because the SERVICE IS HORRENDOUS. We had to wave our arms like crazies to get his attention and the waiters took forever to respond and get us togo boxes or the check. It seems we sat in a natural waiter blind spot or something....

D96pOQ39yzgoJWObBZ9Wzg.review_text: Pros:  1) Piping hot Korean comfort foods, a great complement to..  2) the delicious Soju and beers that are served.  3) Always lots of booths/tables open, even when the place is crowded  4) No one rushes you  5) Lots of TVs either playing sports over the bar, or Korean pop videos (if you like watching)  6) Great for large parties, and I've even seen couples on dates here.  Only con:  Small, one person bathroom, there's always a line =( When you need to barf, you need to barf.

dAPmvtgc8WHLv6AXkrtCRw.review_text: my wife and our friends saw Playground at "Check Please" and had good reviews.  So, to celebrate our friend's birthday, we decided to try this place.  well, we were all disappointed with the food, which is what we came for.  We ordered: yogurt saki - in the show, they said it was good, but it was horrible BBQ chicken - it was overcooked, a bit hard Jap chai - it was actually good, but the portion was significantly smaller compared to other restaurants for that price Beef ribs - Most of us liked it, but my wife was not impressed Onion pancake - I liked it but everyone said it was too eggy.   So, once we ordered, the singing went down.  It was fun and I like the fact that we had a private room.  But after half an hour, I started coughing and I realized that the furniture was soaked in tobacco smoke.  Once I mentioned this, everyone agreed and the room and furniture was reecking with cigarettes smoke. YUK!  As much as I would love to come back, I know I won't because of the tobacco/cigarette issue.  Once we left the place, i was coughing hysterically for about an hour, until I was able to control my ashma.

WzgTJg1cWYsFMCZKLHd8-w.review_text: Corn and cheese... a new discovery for me and what I thought were my truly Asian friends...   Imagine, a bar - with the televisions tuned to MTV and a Korean Pop music channel... with karoke rooms upstairs. BRAIN OVERLOAD... how strange is that!  After seating 5 at a table meant for 4, we ordered too much food as usual - but all great. The chicken, amazing! The pancake dish... not as good as the Korean Restaurant looks like a normal garage from the outside... the other 3 dishes which I fail to remember... were good and the soju... keep it flowing.   No need for reservations as it did not get THAT busy on a Friday night. Keep in mind to look for a Denny's when searching for this place - in the heart of Japantown... Korean in Japantown... random.

yhE28edy2fSBn7UfRnciVQ.review_text: Get a room, order a few bottles of soju, a few pitchers of beer, a fruit platter, kungpao shrip, and a few other side dishes.  Party on!

ZDgqRbMzvh5xLvLPf5pd1A.review_text: Wandering the streets on a Thursday night, I needed a spot to booze up with a friend.  After making our way over to Japantown, we spotted this rather nondescript second floor K-bar... and it was just right for the night.  Yogurt Soju!?  I had forgotten how awesome it is.  We got a small bottle here for $13 and it hit the spot.  Tastes just like those yogurt drinks that we all had as little kiddos.  Decided to also try one of their many other fruity flavored soju cocktails too, which ended up being a pretty decent Lychee.  Seems like this place has rocking Karaoke, which I'll definitely have to think of trying next time in a big group.  Just for the bar, this place is okay if you want to have a soju cocktail and much on free cheese & corn with a friend.

TnYwnltiaIQGvMAb6T6fIA.review_text: A nice restaurant with a small separate bar that caters to younger korean folks.  K-pop music and videos play all night making this a fun loud place.  The large serving deep fried giant Shrimp was awesome.

Q2asC1ymKIXSTA1FzHbKXQ.review_text: I came here late, after my friends had drunk a lot and had already ordered food. So, I'll just rate the food and not the service.  The food was average, nothing overly special.  I really didn't get to choose the food, so that may have played a part since they wanted greasy food.

tACE7FYREFUEWMHbTkvO1A.review_text: first off the restaurant was really tiny and loud!  once you order food the waiters dont come back and ask how you are, you must flag them down to get more water or napkins.   they had way too many people in there.  there was a big group and only one table available so they let like ten guys just stand inbetween the tables.  they kept bumping into peoples chairs and blocked any path way  to the bathroom and exit.  the food was pretty good until we finished eating and saw a cockroach crawling on the wall behind us.  it was disgusting.  we told the server who apologized and brought our table of nine people two little ice creams to share, thinking that fixed things.  our bill was not adjusted at all and they even added the 18% gratuity! i would not recommend this restraunt at all!   unless you like COCKROACHES in your food.  oh and the music is pretty awful

a2CpduQja0Mn2J52WsE0_w.review_text: The food here is more than excellent.   Everything on the menu is worth trying.  The short ribs here are amazing.  Always a big fan of the food.  The most interesting thing about this place is that they have a variety of different types of food.  The atmosphere is great here.  You always feel welcome.  If your going on a weekend though make sure that you make a reservation.    Make sure that you try the spicy tofu soup!!! AWESOMENESS!!!

rEyRtUy1jsueIqbAfQH4lA.review_text: My lady had a birthday dinner here on Halloween weekend for 10-12 people. My party arrived early and we ordered OB Large alcohol. We got a bit tipsy after a couple bottles, such a great feeling in a club-like environment. The place was nice and loud due to a full-house night. We ordered our food, I can't recall the ordering, but it was tons of meat and Kim Chi which turned out to be delicious. We also had a karaoke room reserved after dinner with bottle service. The impressing staffs at playground made our dinner a memorable event. They even gave us a tray of fruits during the karaoke, which is very nice of them. Our check came out to be $950; expensive but totally worth it. Will be returning again!

t6UWJ1RXsFea1ooX3WljZQ.review_text: Just to say that I agree with the super good reviews here. This place is super fun!  It was the first karaoke of my life. We went there for the birthday of a friend and it was really epic! We all had a great time.  I would say that 10 persons is the maximum number because the rooms are pretty small.

m_gKiyRc_Keks5wJpeKSjQ.review_text: I went here with a bunch of people. We got a large table and ordered everything family-style. I think that's the key to ordering at this place. Go with a lot of people Nd get several times from the menu. We ordered some dumpligs that are supposedly off-menu. I think they should definitely be on the menu. They were so good! When you order spicy dishes, be prepared to sweat! They are delicious but they don't joke around. The only thing I didn't like was the atmosphere. It wasn't quite a bar orb restaueant. Not casual but not fancy either. Overall, I liked it a lot and would definitely go back.

hM3eIi3WXzQLCrl8ykcyjg.review_text: I came here for my birthday, and it was definitely a great place to celebrate. We rented an hour of the karaoke room. I called a week in advance and there were already limited spots. We got a 7-8pm spot and was required to put a credit card on reserve. we got kicked out right away at 8pm :( Be aware of their minimums:  6 person min must spend at least $20 on food and drinks/person (even if only 5 show up, you pay for 6) $30/hr for the karaoke room  good food. yummy flavored soju. service was great (you use a phone to order). definitely would come back again because it's the only karaoke place that let's you eat and drink in the room! although i'm not sure it's such a good idea now, since i almost choked while singing :D

CAQv3QQHUasQNtN-HEldAw.review_text: I came here last week with maybe 10 people which came out to 200 bucks for three hours.  We all got thoroughly boozed up with plenty of eats to go around.  $20 bucks a head is not a bad deal at all.  The song list was decent and it would be nice if we didn't have to make reservations beforehand, but it's nice to have your choice between singing in private rooms or making an ass out of ourself in front of the bar.  I do wish Playground was a little bit cleaner.  While I have been to better karaoke joints, this is about as good as it's going to get in San Francisco.

_eJ9pXiPKoObEWpI2MmlqA.review_text: It was packed. It was happening. It was too loud for us to talk unless we yelled.  The panchan were not very good. Decent kim chee; OK bean sprouts, broccoli with spicy sauce spicy fish cakes and canned corn with milky mayo glop on it.  Dolsot bimbimbap was fine; mandoo gook was fine and no one like the kim chee jigge.  Youngsters all around us, drinking flavored sojus and vodkas were happy. Not our scene. Rather have great food.

OaRk-RwFEzfOtc45ff0fGA.review_text: Went here a while back for a friend's "moving to Amsterdam" celebration...and now they're back.  Oops.  The room we were in had a large screen TV and a lot of seating on either side, however it was difficult to see the lyrics if you weren't sitting right by the TV or in the back of the room on chairs or standing.  While drinking and eating feel taboo at other karaoke places, it is encouraged and enjoyable here.  The group was large enough such that we probably ordered every flavor of soju available and sampled most items on the menu.  Playground is a bit pricey, but not bad as it honors reservations and accommodates large groups relatively well.  A decent backup or alternative to Do Re Mi if you are hankering to do some karaoke in the Japantown area with a few bucks to spare...or enough friends who don't sing but like to tag along (*points and smiles* THAT person knows what I'm talking about!)  3.5 stars

P4EGewaMxk1MDYZ6Vomg0w.review_text: I read the review that starts with;  "Very dishonest. Don't trust the price they give you. Way too expensive once you get the bill"  umm....give me a break, please?  First of all...you assumed...which makes....well, u must know the rest.  Second of all...did you ask what the house was gonna cost vs. something else such as Goose or Belvedere?  I'm guessing someone was a little lazy and didn't ask the right questions.......  But I have been to this place TONS of times...and everything from service to food to the karaoke rooms upstairs is fantastic.  If you want a $5 well drink...I'm sure you can find a TGI Friday's somwhere...I think there is a Denny's type place downstairs too...  The Gampoong Saewoo is off the chain....as well as the cheesy corn.  Drinks are well priced.  I'm not a big fan of flavored soju so I can't really comment on that (Beer and whiskey for me)...but everyone that works here is very cool and I've never had a bad experience...EVER.    Hands down...I give this place 5 stars.

FG_cmTqI_8CiM_nqGz4lsw.review_text: Holy yummy!!! You know you're in a good ethnic restaurant when you're the only table of caucasians in the whole place. They sure know how to deliver the spice...something I have missed in some other Korean restaurants. We started off with the seafood pancake and it was tasty! I then had the spicy Playground Seafood Noodles and they were savory, but the squid was overcooked.   We brought our own wine, so I didn't taste the soju cocktails, but the bartender was certainly busy the entire time we were there making them. I wish more ethnic restaurants had better wine lists, but what can ya do.   What cracked me up was the videos they had playing...it was like Korean MTV and I guess trying to inspire people to go upstairs and sing karaoke. I'm sure after plenty of soju cocktails that would be no problem by many!  Don't expect service to be attentive, so relax and just enjoy the food.

zrCscHX33ejyKfmGvGWYpA.review_text: Given that SF isn't exactly a mecca for Korean food or nightlife, Playground gets the job done. Although I've only been there a few times (but haven't gone to the Karaoke section yet), I was happy with the food and the service.   I'd recommend Playground to anyone who enjoys a cold OB or Hite with some good, simple Korean food. Prices are more than reasonable. Quieter on weeknights, but still a decent crowd.

CGRkejdGiNtvX-lhcOFUZQ.review_text: So many reviews already, so I'll keep this cliffnoted: - tofu seafood soup was actually really good! - manager is super sweet and friendly - love the banchans - yogurt soju is on the strong side! could totally taste the alchy, meh. - very hip environment... love the kpop music videos playing. - a bit pricy.. - come here with a group of friends, relax, and have fun!

I-FmdvI28N7OIIt4JZOgIg.review_text: Time to karaoke, eat and drink!  What a relief to go play at Playground on a Friday night after a week's work!  Looking through the menu, our eyes were bigger than our stomachs.  That is usually the case, but this time, we seriously over ordered for 3 people!  It was leftovers galore.  Their side dishes were good, but nothing quite memorable.  They provided corn with melted cheese, which was atypical as a side dish.  We ordered up Soju and Jun, who was one of the waiters, hooked us up with an additional round of Soju.  The Yogurt Soju was the best!  Thank you!  I loved the black bean noodles!  It was saucy and mixed with chunks of chopped beef.  Must order!  Their Garlic Fries were spot on.  I like the crushed up, textured garlic mixed in with the batch of fries.  Their Bulgoki Beef needs improvement.  It was not marinated well enough and the onions were not grilled to a great brown color that I tend to admire for grilled onions.  Avoid.   As for the Seafood Pancake, it was a bit too doughy, but I like the well-sized chewy octopus inside the pancake!  Last, but not least, the Sweet and Sour Chicken dish was fried well with a crisp and had a good sticky sauce to it.  It was feasible.    There is Korean music and video in the background and the atmosphere provides a laid back, dining vibe.  Come here to play!  After all, it is a Playground!

5KtOX6QV5Wxcd2onINvzxw.review_text: There's something comforting about watching high-quality Korean music videos while eating bulgogi and creamed corn.  We came early on a Friday night, months after seeing it on Check Please. It wasn't crowded and the karaoke hadn't started yet, but not to worry there's plenty of Korean music videos on the big screen TVs! We ordered a bulgogi and japchae which was plenty for two people. They bring you the regular Korean small plates - I have to say I missed the potato salad and the various types of kim chi - but you do get this yummy creamed corn with cheese that I could have nibbled on the whole night.  I'll have to go back during the karaoke rush hour. It's not quite the same quality of Korean BBQ places in San Jose, but it'll do when I need my Korean fix or my husband needs his karaoke.

UySLQuZU6SOuuMO4J74x7w.review_text: Korean Karaoke Bar.  They got decent korean food (and big portions), alcohol, and stays open late.  Not gonna lie... don't know how much anything costs because i eat and drink with my eyes.  And it still doesn't come out being too expensive and usually no one remembers getting home...

ZzwNAB2jU0xGmVLbJCBEMg.review_text: I've been coming to Playground for many years now; though since I've moved to L.A., this place has been my top pick whenever I come back home for the weekend.  I love the atmosphere here: the K-Pop, and the overall energy of this place makes it a great environment to kick back with some flavored Soju (the yogurt one is still by far my favorite one) and O.B. with some friends. They also offer karaoke upstairs, but I've never actually tried it.  The food is absolutely delicious. I particularly enjoy the fried squid plate with the special sauce. Excellent flavor, big portions and it tastes great with the drinks. Another bonus is the complimentary dishes they give out like the cheese-corn.  The only drawback is the bill you get at the end of the night, but I don't mind paying a premium for great food, great drinks and a great atmosphere during the party hours of the night (10pm -2am). All in all, four wonderful stars for this gem.

CVlGVvlR436OH8Q1pHfz-Q.review_text: I came here with a friend tonight! We also ran into a few people that he knew here! Janet, the owner of the place was pretty cool! This place was freaking packed! We had to chill at the bar for half an hour to get a table, but it was cool!   I have no clue what we ordered! We just asked the waiter what he would order if he was drunk! LOL! He brought it out along side the typical Korean sides like kim chi and other goodies. It was some type of sweet and sour chicken dish!  I think out of most Korean bars that this was pretty crackin!

lYqxQuUONPux4oENsdek5A.review_text: The reviewer who said that Playground is a typical cheap Korean bar was correct! The food is mediocre and the place is drab. I couldn't wait to get out of there.

UMzVMDf9CVCwbubOnO6Q5A.review_text: People don't come hear to eat because the food is way overpriced for Korean food. You won't find any dishes under $10. The banchan (the small dishes they serve before your mean) really sucks. Seriously, cheese corn?! Maybe I'm expecting more because I grew up in Southern California where cheap, good, Korean food was everywhere.  So why have I been here so many times? It's the perfect place for large groups of Asian people to congregate and drink themselves silly. I've only been here for large parties. They have a couple tables which can easily fit 15 or more people. I've never been karaoke here. We usually drink and walk over to Do Re Mi down the street.

2Njj_f43_EqnPid-n3h0Tg.review_text: we came here because we had an underage friend with us. and apparently playground used to not care about that so we decided to check this place out after having left a boring karaoke get together at some other korean restaurant...we had high hopes for this place.   first of all, it gets HELLA BUSY. they need MORE STAFF. and a better seating system. we called in to make a reservation which was pointless because we still had to wait about 45 minutes even though they told us it'd only be a 15 minute wait. anyways, whatever, the manager was really nice so i didn't care...until we finally were seated and they carded my friend...he said he wasnt going to drink so thats fine whatever. but what was annoying was that they wouldnt let any of us drink even though we were all 21+ ....hmmmm i don't think thats how it is at other restaurants so i thought that was really lame that we couldn't drink because we had a friend that was under 21.   they were being beezys about it too. and the food isnt good here. staff needs to chill out a bit. prob would've helped if we were korean. or something.  playground  you fail.

wwGQBhWBvtQKPUZgkAH9ZA.review_text: Ahhhh yes~~~ The Cafe Noir of San Francisco... Reminiscent of the DC areas Cafe Noir. I could definitely see myself as a regular on weekends here... if only I lived in SF!!! Karaoke rooms are available upstairs, but they were taken.  We had to get on a a waiting list.  Great chill Korean hangout. I noticed a lot of youngsters... or maybe I'm just getting old!  -_-,  *tear*

JxfGpZn9WHEI3BLOFbgksg.review_text: Came here with Euge, need I say more...Yes, yes, we found our car and drove home safely!!!  Food, overall is pretty decent when sober but excellent when mixed with Soju and Hite. Love the egg soup, particularly.   Jin, thank you for being a good host!!!  Cheers!!!  =)

Vkf4e4SLFm3gApONFnWk7Q.review_text: Seoul.trains.& yogurt soju.  donezo.   I barely remember the night and I was only missing $30 from my bank account the next morning so you know it was a good night :) FOUR STARS!

88CN7iJKqGNO63TXVURK1w.review_text: Yay I'm in San Fran for the first time!!  Party of seven arrived late and hungry.... This place was across the street from the awesome Kabuki Hotel.  Since it was late and kitchen was closing the waiters rush our orders. I completely understood.   First comes the drinks. Seems two different bartenders made the order. Some were extremely strong and some, no trace of alcohol. Sucks for a ten dollar red bull vodka !  Anywho, here comes the food .... mmm I love food! The prices for the quality of the food was horrible. Only two of us were happy with our meals and the rest of us picked from those plates lol   We were just about ready to get up and head out when the African American door guy came up and ask us to leave because workers wanted to close up.  We all felt some type of way because our group ... five out of seven are Africa Americans. Keep in mind there were two other tables occupied. So they walked over to him and told him to walk over to us haha the waiter could have asked us his self when he collected the bills.  Ok ok I know what your thinking. They were probably being loud and ghetto. Actually we are all well educated and conservative...  Not to mention we were all mellow and tired from the long drive up.   for bringing in my friend bday it was disappointing

kzki8VW1-hqStar3f9TabA.review_text: I might be a little biased here since I just moved back to the Bay Area from LA recently and frankly this place, in light of the places in K-Town in LA, is average at best.    The food was decent and actually I'd say the Boo-Dae Jigae was one of the better one's I've had.  (For the uninitiated, Boo-Dae Jigae is a spicy Kimchi stew/casserole with spam, sausage, ramen noodles, slices of rice cakes... basically one of the greatest bar food creations in the entire bar-dom.  It goes down well with either a cold shot of Soju or a refreshing glass of OB/Hite or both.  It can feed 3-4 ppl.)   So why the average rating? The place is sorta dumpy.  Now if you've frequented many Korean bars, you know that some Korean bars actually go for that look (i.e. Back Alley in KTown). But this place I think is just old and outdated.  It could really use a little sprucing up, in my opinion.  Food Rating: 4 stars (really for the Boo Dae Jigae) Ambiance Rating: 2 stars  I'll probably go back because the food and service was decent and frankly there isn't too many other options.

JnGjZVSlfCkKHErvO5ts4g.review_text: yogurt. strawberry. peach. green apple. yogurt. lychee. ob & hite.  annnnd my night was over!   i was prohibit from drinking anymore. didn't get to try the other flavored sojus =[  karaoke was okay. didn't sing much because i was too busy drinking and getting drunk. and even though we got a big room,  it felt cramped & the tv was small.   karaoke: $30/hour soju: small $12, large $25 beer: pitcher $12

EM8Q9QkTEDQbq9g4bPeBlA.review_text: Did I just find my new favorite drinking spot in San Francisco?  I was just on a dead Thursday night calmly enjoying a Yogurt soju with my two friends.  At midnight, we were tired and ready to go home, but man, that is when the second wave of customers come and keep the party rolling.  The best part about this place is you drink downstairs and then you have a karaoke upstairs!  The karaoke even has rap! 2pac! Man and recent songs too!    The only bad part is the price.  $25 for a large soju?  Mannnnnnnnnn

JpMnXsoGrMbqD3TDugnZEw.review_text: Good Happy Hour hangout spot with good deal! 50% on beers and soju !!! Plus 50% off on appetizers.   Food:  Their sweet potato fires are like chip, thin strips and dust with powder sugar on top.  (  very unique, reminded me of taro fires )   Stir-fry chicken gizzard was pretty but it was bit too spicy for me, There were lots semi-thick slice of jalapeno .   Stream dumplings were good =) soft dumpling skin and about a dozen dumpling for each order for $5   Drinks:  Try to avoid all flavors soju except yogurt soju. Ordered a small strawberry soju just to try it out!! Bad decision, tasted like cough syrup!!   Overall experience, good price, good deal and must important had fun =)

-rZhA_afEjUM28eB1qcJ-w.review_text: The Fried Chicken was the bomb!!!

g3cEKgn07a4KtpSdySdUWg.review_text: Karaoke is every Asian person's favorite activity. Kara meaning open and oke meaning orchestra. There's nothing like channeling your inner divo or diva and belting out your favorite songs in front of a group of friends or strangers.  The thing about karaoke is that everyone has their one "go-to" song; mine being Boyz II Men's "End of the Road." There's nothing better than when the chorus hits and you just are so moved by the words that you get on one knee to sing your heart out. "It's unnatural, you belong to me, I belong to youuuuu."  The requirements of a good karaoke place is privacy, good snack foods, variety of drink options and a thick and current song book.   Playground satisfies all those requirements. You can make reservations for a private room with all your friends in attendance. Soju flows by the bottle and definitely provides you with enough liquid courage if you are feeling a little shy. There are enough Korean food options to satisfy your drunk munchies. Plus they have a pretty current song book; they have a great mix of new songs and oldies. Is it embarrassing that I like to sing Adele's" Rolling In The Deep" song? haha *embarrassed face*.    American Idol here I effing coming.

qHmLQQZF1GKrU6HFZqZqGA.review_text: flavored soju and yummy korean food! i liked the fried dumplings and all the banchan. get the yogurt soju to wash it all down! the service is really nice and attentive.  yeah, its a bit pricey but just go with a bunch of ppl!

zDWhnidBcEok7Vqnu-AnMg.review_text: would only have one star -- but the waitress was really nice and offered us free dessert because she recognized my friend.   this place isnt bad in terms of what they have -- i personally didnt eat, but the food looked pretty good. i did however, have the yogurt soju. it was good, but it definitely tasted watered down.  oh, and prices were outrageous. they had fruit punch for 15.95, a plate of fries for 12 bucks, and bottles were way too expensive -- grey goose for 170 and johnny walker blue 360. these mark-ups are too high for a place like this.  also, this has to be the asian place ive ever been -- it makes me feel out of touch with my roots.

4BXqlLKW8oP0RBCW1FvaIg.review_text: Operator error....can't get the karaoke machine to work.  Can't move to walk over to the phone to get directions in english because my feet are stuck to the floor laden with soju.  My hands are stuck to the sticky tambourines.  Even in all this sticky mess, I'm so glad that most of our party cancelled, because that means more tone deaf singing for me!  Playground is great....not a huge song list, but great picks like Pink Floyd's "The Wall" and various Radiohead numbers.  If you're a karaoke junkie like me, then I suggest you go to Playground, get your sing on and spill some soju for the homies.

1K7eMLRCaefGcCmPSsHg0Q.review_text: Checked out Playground for the second time this past weekend. Overall, the place gets pretty busy and serves up above average Korean Bar Foods.  Their Soju and beer are well priced but their call drinks are definitely on the pricey side (I think Goose on the Rocks set me back $10 or $11).  They have a good amount of seating but I reco coming with a larger group and sticking around a bit to enjoy some Soju, Beer and Korean music (+ the music videos).  Upstairs are several Karaoke rooms you can reserve (min order is required).  Good place for to pre-party before hitting the clubs or you can just stick around and chill (stays open till 2AM Thu-Sat).

3ksgNZbeIMXD--mfhylE3Q.review_text: I just don't know why my straight friends drag me here. Who the hell cares, cause by the 6th shot of soju, I'm having fun. Even that weird crusty cream-corn thing tastes good. On my first night here I had some kind of noodle with seafood stir-fry. It was yumm-o. But if you're drunk on soju...that won't matter.   minus one point for it being a swing-less, slide-less, jungle gym-less playground. And if ur not into the whole Asian crowd-thing...then steer clear. Very packed with drunkies on Saturday night.

pPKR-UnkP08CKvLaKzF-AQ.review_text: Delicious food!  They do a great job on the Korean shortribs (and I LOVE Korean shortribs).  And they have lots of side dishes!  Don't visit this restaurant without trying their cheesy corn (I have no idea what it's called)!  It's making my mouth water just thinking about it!  I strongly suggest making a reservation ahead of time if you want to come here to sing karaoke.  The rooms are super spacious compared to a lot of the other karaoke joints in the area.  And if you're here for the Soju -- $25.00 for a carafe of flavored Soju.  I think it's pretty steep, but I also haven't tried shopping around for it.  I always order the yogurt Soju!

P1DZVbHW29k3lYuj7tmzvQ.review_text: Go to YamaSho instead. Adjust the per person minimums as they see fit. Treat you like military and make you feel extremely unwanted no matter how much money you spend. Staff will openly complain to your face when you politely ask them for service. Staff will turn their backs to you and walk away because they 'don't have to do anything'. The vast majority of the karaoke music here is korean, and if you aren't korean you don't feel very welcome either.

7z-Crwkwo3wyngtjFhdJ9A.review_text: ...wait, what? How do I not have a review for Playground, yet? I guess its fate that my 500th review goes to a restaurant where I've had some of the most memorable (not all favorable) experiences.   If the party doesn't start at Playground, it most always ends here. You can always expect large crowds of people looking to get smizzled on the weekends. The large flat-screen TVs and projector play a mix of Korean pop and various chart-topping music videos to keep the mood fun and entertaining.  The waiters always do a great job of tending to all the drunk, belligerent tables while maintaining their cool. They're quick to clean up and good with accommodating all party sizes.  A typical night for my friends and I goes something like this:  - Get seated. Immediately order 3-10 bottles of soju, depending on how large our party is, along with 1-3 pitchers of beer. - Order french fries. - Order doobu kimchi. - Order fried chicken wings. - Someone always gets a diet coke. - Depending on how drunk we already are, order Budae jjigae (spicy meat stew) or Odeng tang (fish cake soup). - If my cousin is here, order a pitcher of yogurt soju.  Sure, our bill at one point came out to $1500...(it was an unprecedented amount of people...) but that's what happens when the bottles keep coming and the fun keeps poppin. Until someone throws up...then the party is over...sometimes.

3gCzAB83fhml1zy_ir5EjA.review_text: OMG, do you ever have the itch inside of your throat? and I'm not talking about the time when you are about to catch a cold. It's the time when you know you need some LOOOOOVE from those hot and tasty Korean food. Playground is definitely my to go place when i need some hugs from tofu chigae, or kimchi fried rice, or some bulgogi, and my personal favorite the fish egg soup.   The atmosphere is very laid back, the staffs are great, accommodating and friendly. Playground has became one of my secret place to go with friends. Why is it secretive? 'cause I don't think I can wait in line for those yumo Korean food, I want them STAT!!

JJsNi548kCrsPByo98J2-w.review_text: The soju was the best I had so far in the Bay Area. They have some of my favorite Korean dishes, such as the Short rib, Rice cake in the hot spicy sauce, the tofu stew , and Jap Chae but I was disappointed in the croquette it taste like water down potatoes from a box.  I wish they have Yukgaejang and I'll be in heaven after that.  The dishes are big no wonder the price is on the high side but most Korean place are like that but with Playground the high price comes with a big dishes. It's not bad of a deal at all. My friends told me about the corn in the cheese. Omg!! It's good. I almost ran off with the dish and ate it all to myself and not share lolz! The service was pretty good because after all they have to deal with whole a lot of drank people. I'll be back to finish off with our Soju taste testing. So, far we got 5 favors out of I don't remember. It's a good night with good food and drinks.

zuAnMepYz87eeXgJTdc9VA.review_text: Horrible song selection. Bad food. Terrible customer service. Small rooms.  It sucked!

ZZlylZYQK2YgkugH42ieOQ.review_text: Didn't get the opportunity to karaoke on the weekend because we didn't reserve a room so we settled for a table downstairs. Wait wasn't too long on a Saturday night, the place looks cheap and the blue lighting makes the food and drinks look unappetizing. The service was pretty awesome, they dealt with our large group with drinks, spills, and whatever other damage we could've caused. Tried a few of the soju choices and I'd recommend yogurt, mango, pineapple, lychee, and strawberry in that order. As for the food, it was pretty whack, the banana chips, cheese corn, and sweet potato fries just didn't do it for me.

YUP31CYNNuQe-7KR1bCMiA.review_text: i just started coming here recently with my friends, usualy i just buy some beer and soju and chat and drink , but they give you some really tastey korean appeitizers, i love there fried chicken wings its the bomb!!!, ive also been here a few times for kareoke, they mixed sojus are rally good !!! will come back in the future if i wana hangout spot to drink with my friends

A0Y4dUb2LOM6n0kewefUXg.review_text: Corn Cheeeeeeez! (sic)  My favourite lo budget-hi profile treatment here is the 2 litre plastic bottle of Korean beer served chilled in a champagne ice bucket.  The staff are seemingly polite and chill.  K-Pop videoz in full effect yo.  X-)  Shady shenanigans next door???

LSeE__G2dcOxntHtJYzG9A.review_text: Only complaint: if I'm going to take 9 shots of soju I should be feeling A LOT more tipsy than I was. Yogurt, pineapple, apple and strawberry soju: delicious. Personal favorite was the yogurt soju.   My food was great! I shared the bulgogi and #50 (I don't recall the name, but it was a noodle and beef dish) and they were both really great for the price. Definitely on point when it comes to value. Nothing super special or unique, just good, solid Korean food.  Their karaoke set up is great here, plenty of room to fit a large group (I think we had about 20) comfortably. They also let us bring our food and drinks up with us, which is nice because then we didn't have to wait for everyone to finish eating and could keep drinking the rest of the night!! They even bring you tambourines!  Aside from some minor complaints, I really enjoyed this place and I'll definitely go back.

qcC73zhcxpfT81LtuECYqA.review_text: Been coming here since I could remember & till this day its still that comforting kick it spot. The staff is always personable & atmosphere is very laid back. I hate wen places rush you out so Iono why people complain about the wait its totally worth it. Soju of all flavors & full bar is totally a plus. & I still manage to get the same food over & over cus its so good. Corn cheese...duh love it. If your not into nice friendly sharing portions & night kick back atmosphere with unlimited servings of kimchi & corn cheese...iono wat to say, then go to ur other korean spot & i doubt ull find the full bar & a place where everyone remembers you.

_kENUv9ZoaomCD3nWkIUDg.review_text: Love this place...never tried the karaoke but I like the favored soju.  It's cheap for a big pitcher and you can't really go wrong with it.  I'm not much of a drinker but I really like the yogurt-flavored one that tastes like the white Calpico drink.  I have tried the strawberry and the mango one as well.  I get kinda buzzed with the mango one.  I want to try the green one sometime.  The atmosphere is always up-beat.  Kinda like getting shoved into a k-pop music video without the dancing.  I also like the food.  A lot of times I get the bulgogi and fried chicken.  Also a plus is all the kimchi you can handle!  The only food item I really did not like was some corn thing.  It had cheese and sugar on it.  To me it was ick, but there were some people that just went into town with that.

m4HrmRfWdHLEwtbKLq8r0g.review_text: I love this restaurant~! First of all, I become a very picky person when it comes to the food and I never knew Korean food can be this delicious. The food was super delicious and the people who work there were super nice (A++ Customer Service and Girls, when you go there you will see cute waiters with handsome chef~~!! lol) My crew ordered about 5 different dishes and  Altang, bibimgooksoo and ttukbokegi were my favorites~* If you have chance to visit SF japantown, I highly recommend this place~! Itz a "U Must Go Restaurant" ^_^b

eSkWT19xxiNK2xYJT623PA.review_text: I'm from Socal so it's hard to find a good korean place in the city. I thought the food here was pretty good for bar food. I had the budaejigae (ramen, spam, sausage army stew), rabokki (ramen with rice cakes), fruit mix, and yogurt soju. Everything was good and spicy. This place reminds me of Crazy Hook in LA.

O3a8rj5G2nSXdpKJUCJ_Sw.review_text: This place is basically a loud Korean bar that serves food. The servers are efficient, but can be inattentive sometimes because it does get very busy. The place is very dark and has blue lighting, which reminded me of the poster of Tom Cruise in that 80's movie where he was a bartender. The Soju is stronger than most and we prob spent more on drinks than food. I'm pretty sure I've had better food and drinks else where, but it is a fun place to go to with the right people.

L7a5bSH_82dw_pooHiGUzg.review_text: Watching Korean drama's interest me. I grew an appreciation for it when I was staying in the Philippines. Along with the Korean drama shows came the Korean food. Beef Bulgogi is one my favorite dish, and the soju for drinks.  The first thing I look for in a Korean restaurant is the beef bulgogi, Everything else builds around the beef bolgogi in my eyes. Beef bolgogi at Playground is a must here since it is tender. The goon mandu, mool mandoo, fried chicken and the iced lychee are tasty.  Satisfied with the food the soju completes everything. I will definitely find my way back here.

0GHsxjCk-Ynzx4Ihj8tjPQ.review_text: errr...where am I?   I walked in to the Playground and felt like I just walked into some club in Asia. Cheesy disco lights and Korean music videos with school girls and metro boy bands.  Not exactly my scene but I can see the draw if you are into getting drunk on Lychee Soju Cocktails and rocking out to asian pop tunes and singing karaoke.  The place got really packed around 9pm on Friday. Watch out for those soju cocktails. It tastes like juice...be careful!

McnAn0w_Fff4ikbWJXIVww.review_text: It's the best Karaoke place I've been to in SF .. the wait is usually semi long ... it's nothing like the awesome one's in LA though :(.  Anyways it's fun!

tfg1Nhwx94Y4GdQHLVawbw.review_text: I don't really go to karaoke places all that often but this one in Japantown is actually pretty cool. Very energetic atmosphere, lots of soju and beer flowing through the system as well as high-calorie food. There's some interesting Korean dishes like cheese chicken, cheesy corn and this super spicy chicken that will make you sweat more than you would in a Bikram Yoga workout. Stuff is intense.  Be aware of the Phillip Morris idols' dense cigarette smog right outside when you walk in and out.

bt4pSBah2St9nWoBB-EOAQ.review_text: Playground has good food, but pricey. The only soju flavor that I enjoyed was yogurt, and it's slightly more expensive here than at Toyose.  But 2 words makes me love Playground: Cum Corn.  This freebie appetizer looks like DNA-protein laced cream corn, tastes salty and sweet, and goes great with your 8th bottle of soju yelling at the waitress for more baby batter vegetables.

8tODLV9oBgO5Bzib2HJDVQ.review_text: The owner, Janet, was the rudest, most disrespectful person ever.  My friends and I will never return to such a filthy place.  The karaoke room seats were sticky and had tape all over them.  The food had no taste and there was a dead fly in our soon dobu.  When we complained and said we don't want the dish anymore and asked to waive that order, she would not.  I have never received such bad service from any restaurant in my entire life and this is the only restaurant I ever thought about giving a one star to.

R4b9uTzOI-9d0ussqSqR5g.review_text: Heeeeeeellls yeah this is my kind of place.  the bf and i stopped by the Playground today after stumbling upon it wandering through j-town.  the bf reasoned any placed named the "Playground" can't be bad.  Oh and they had irresistable lunch specials outside, luring us in.   It wasn't too crowded inside when we came in, and the waitress was friendly.  Extensive menu, and I saw that they had..... soju cocktails!!! Yay-yuh, but we'd have to save that for a group's night out.  I ordered the seafood champong (I can't ever resist a spicy seafood noodle dish) and the bf had a omrice (omelette on top of fried rice smothered in ketchup).  Prior to the food, we had complimentary miso soup (with tons of green onion, just the way i like it), small plates of pan-chan, and a plate of.....corn cheese!!! My god was that addicting.  Corn? good. Cheese? gooooood. Put the two together? DAYAM gooooood.  The champon was SUCH a good deal for lunch at $7.95. LOADED with seafood (squid, 5 HUGE pieces of shrimp, mussels, and a whole baby crab), veggies (onions, zucchini, carrots, cabbage) in a oh so yummy spicy red broth and chewy chewy noodles.  I could've split this with the bf and we would've been good cuz he ended up eating like 1/4 of the omrice and boxed it to go.  I didnt taste it cuz it had ham and I'm trying to avoid meats but it looked yummy enough.  They also have a lot of other choices for lunch specials under $10 like bento box style lunches with korean bbq, fish, tonkatsu, jap-chae, bi bim bap, etc.  They also have your typical Korean drinking food (seafood pancakes, fried chicken, cheesy chicken, dduk bok ki, stir fry seafood + veggies, etc)...  Overall the experience was really good and the lunch was awesome and really delicious.  Total bill for the two of us came to $17 and we had a table full of food.   I can't wait to come back at night for some late night munchies and soju drinks.  Great place for a lunch spot, for sure, if you're ever in J-Town.

fcs6rg0DLElOs0xs7WUVpQ.review_text: This place rocks! Its a type of place where anyone can go in and have a great time.

fM8qkbgA_7_j-XS6tR6N6g.review_text: Cheese on corn? Ok... i tried it, i loved it! Every snack dish is good.  That korean blood sausage i dont know if i'll ever get used to that stuff.  Shouldnt things already have good flavor w/o having to dip it into salt?  Soju and beer makes the night fun and embarrassing!  Cool Karaoke/NRB rooms above dining area.

5Cudzo0QUFMh7hnb9k_Pug.review_text: I've heard many things about this place and as a last minute decision my friends and I came here to begin the celebration of our friend's bday that would go well into the evening of the next day.  We found parking 'far', but it was walkable, later we discovered there was actually plenty of parking near it. Ha. I have a healing broken ankle so I'm not good with stairs or uphill battles, but I don't think there was an elevator to get up to this place.   We walked right into the place and waited maybe 10 minutes to get a table for 5. We ordered a soju right away and had some cheese corn, which is just cheese on top of corn. Nothing fancy here.  We're also cheap so we ordered a platter of bulgogi to share.   I'm writing this review far too late from when I actually went, so my memories of it are far into the back of my mind, or have already been erased from the continuous drinking we did that weekend and the next.  Long story short, it's good here.

DV_GmIVJCJsWMFU8F9xIzg.review_text: studied in korea for a year and honestly this is the closet you'll get except for if youre in seoul or something.. the food is crazy good, cheesy corn, the soju is SOJU, and its great.. cant wait to get back here.. always a damn good time.. bathroom gets tricky after a few..

F2GugGDQTghyYf2yVQ8-XA.review_text: I've never had as much fun at a karaoke establishment as I have at Playground.  The staff is super friendly and amazingly helpful.  My work associates and I gravitate towards this establishment for any event (birthdays, christmas gathering, promotions, etc) and it's not surprising why.      The food is amazing.  The soju is delicious.  The staff is once again... GREAT!  I LOVE this place!

E6ypsUz-c0RfD6-1nnRJiw.review_text: LOVE the waiters and waitresses there.  they are really nice and friendly.  the food is okay. I dun't know if it is because I keep ordering the wrong things.  The yogurt soju is alot better than the peach soju.  Stay away from the peach soju.  And the cheese corn is a really good appetizer.  Overall a pleasant experience, a really chill place to hang out.  Also, I love their music. A mix of korean pop songs and radio songs.  I just wished they played Big Bang

qUUMmANmVRuQxagzH8irhA.review_text: I love this place. Janet, the owner, is super nice and even remembered me after only going there one time before! Great food, upbeat atmosphere, and this place made me love soju. Didn't even taste like alcohol, so I learned that it was was actually strong the hard way! loll.  If I had to choose a bar equivalent to MacLaren's in How I Met Your Mother, this would be it.  It's just that awesome.

jEUDgqHEdGli8T6CkBsyOw.review_text: Cool place to come hang out with your friends! I am definitely a fan of this place! Came here with some people that I call, "family and friends". This place is awesome to have a great time and be obnoxiously loud with your friends and everyone around you wouldn't care too much. There are lots of drinking games you can play here and they promote it by providing the games!   Service: Great service! They always come by checking to make sure you're ok and if you need more drinks/foods or whatever!  Food: The food here was just ok. One thing I did remember is that they serve food pretty late and that's just perfect to soak up the drunkenness.  Drinks: Soju - all flavors of it in carafes. Beer - Hite, Korean beer of choice.  Overall:  This is a great place to come hang out and have a bunch of drinks with your friends. There are karaoke rooms upstairs available to go sing your heart out and have some more drinks! For a party of 10 and pounding down approximately 20 bottles of Hite, 8 carafes of soju, lots of food, and a few hours of karaoke was around $550 with gratuity included. Having a blast and a night to remember for a lifetime, priceless!   There are cops driving around here late at night. Just be smart about it, we had designated driver.

NK-zIxHMuTnLRU0RhoZWqw.review_text: Who knew canned corn with melted cheese could taste so good? Especially since it was complimentary. When I'm craving Korean food late night, I usually go to Arang because it's the cheapest. This place isn't as cheap, but their dishes are humongous so it's a fair trade. It's definitely a lot hipper, trendier, diverser (I know that's not a word) than the old days of Sonic, but it's still just as loud. Service was polite - just what I expected from a typical Korean restaurant. I think I'll be coming back here for more.  JONASAPPROVED!

zyLIp7DRFqeIE1Grrh3Zng.review_text: We've been here the most lately of all our karaoke joints.   Good song selection, and excellent service with alcohol and food. The Soju and Hite combo is guaranteed to give you a good time.  The rooms have disco lights, and they give you a tambourine lol.  $30/hr.

9YZV8W7IZe5ZXZp17xnjJQ.review_text: An awesome place to get your grub on before hitting the clubs, bars, and/or lounges in the city!!  This trendy place is located right smack in the heart of J-Town, and it is normally really crowded at night. The decor contributes to the ambiance of the place, as there are small and big tables, a bar area, and continual K-pop music videos playing on several big screens in the background. What better way to hang out than eat, drink, and watch sexy Korean girls dancing on the big screens in the background?  I have been here several times, and the food and service has always been great. The seafood pancakae (panjeon), seafood tofu soup (soon dubu), and corn smothered in cheese are some of the great dishes that can be had here.  Did I mention that the Soju here is awesome too?  Bring a large group of friends here to pre-party (before your rendezvous with your other friends in downtown SF) and I guarantee you'll have a night filled with delish food, great music, and awesome people!

7rfBi8WiNHliL-cAqMGNew.review_text: I can't believe it's taken me so long to write a review about this place!   I don't even know how to describe how much I enjoy coming here.   The staff is awesome and the owner is great! Being almost a regular, I've gotten to know a lot of the staff. IF YOU WANT GOOD FOOD, that's the way to go! Not only do i get good food here but I get free food here too sometimes! The people that work here are super cool and nice!   I love everything they have on the menu here especially the spicy rice cakes with ramen!!! That's my favorite. Of course I also love all of the flavored SOJUs but I prefer just drinking plain soju! (hardcore! JK)   I brought all of my co workers here for a company outting and they all enjoyed the food and atmosphere as well. This place is you are coming here for dinner, snack or party! lols they have everything!

PRiSufjS2Vf_BgR34eguJg.review_text: If you like food and singing, Playground certainly lives up to its name. It also helped that the staff accommodated 30+ loud and hungry Yelpers hopped up on yogurt soju shots with style and grace.  The food is pretty good here and we had an impressive spread, including kalbi, soondae, Korean Fried Chicken, fried shrimp, soldier's stew (with ramen, veggies, hot dogs, and a ham-like meat that tasted like vienna sausages). The banchan was fresh and very tasty, but there wasn't any pickled daikon, which was a bummer.  But the main attraction at Playground is the norebang (a.k.a. karaoke), and Yelpers dominated their three upstairs rooms for most of the night. Song selection is dominated by Korean songs, but there was impressive collection of English songs, as well, especially from modern rock artists like Radiohead, Muse and Weezer. Hip hop selection was seriously lacking, but the fact that I could break out my own rendition of "The Bends" more than made up for that.  Because of Yelp, I've eaten more Korean food in the last three months than I have in my entire life. It's been a delicious and educational experience, and I'm glad Playground could fulfill both my culinary and attention-whoring desires.

p08F3g2_lSSdzyjnVcvt4w.review_text: Too much fat in the meat.  Service is horrible.  No one shows up at the table until 10 minutes after you're seated.  Food is expensive.  Ambiance sucks.  It's dark which is fine if there is good music.  But the music sucks and it is loud.

OXYtOFX9xXukagW5Ku5dfg.review_text: My friend was hosting his birthday dinner/karaoke here so a bunch of us were there to celebrate with him.  Reservations were made pretty early so we were accommodated accordingly. My friend ordered the food and the soju so I didn't look at the menu. I know there were plenty of spicy shrimp platters, one or two orders of spicy beef, and one seafood pancake. We also had lychee soju, kiwi soju, yogurt soju, and mango soju.   Food was good although they were all made in varying degrees of spiciness. I think that was an accident because at one point, my mouth was on fire. I didn't think that the food was insanely special, but I liked it. I don't remember the prices because I don't go here enough, but I remember that most dishes here cost $12 or so. With that in mind, I do believe the food is overpriced. Four dishes would already cost $50 and I know that way more was ordered.  The soju is good. Each flavor was great, but my favorite was probably yogurt. Soju is a must. I believe it's $13 for a whole bottle or something.   Karaoke was fun while I was there. They have a huge song list and in different languages. The rooms are cool in the way that it's closed off.   I don't know the details of karaoke room prices here, but I will review based on my understanding of what happened that night. We were given a room and charged for three hours. While you're in that room, you have to order a certain amount of food. The friend that organized the event was under the impression/was told that the food from the dinner would transfer over to the room...but it didn't. So they had to order more food.   I left before they needed to order more food but I was told later that night that the total cost of everything (dinner, drinks, karaoke, more drinks, more food) came out to be $600 because of a misunderstanding.   I was also told that birthday boy tried to have another friend's card cancelled so he could pay in their place. He was denied this because the person ringing them up told them they'd get in trouble. I don't understand this.   Has potential but ultimately disappointed everyone because of shady service. The birthday boy was so upset, he told me he was never going to go back. I don't blame him! Sad.

kZXWjmCV2O_ylz2xQg2kRw.review_text: At the Playground, you know?!...   We were able to get the large room that easily fit 15 drunk and rowdy people.  We came prepared this time.  Reservations made in advance which is a must if you want a room since this place is packed all the freakin time!  The rooms are placed upstairs which was pretty cool and private.  The food was surprisingly decent and the soju was quite delish.  Kinda dangerous though cause it goes down  a little too smooth. We had a variety of flavored soju and the smoothness of the drink hit a few people pretty hard towards the end of the night.  Seriously, that stuff will creep up on you!

OcUC2eFhJJK9mG6K4abmXA.review_text: I am a frequent vocalist at Do Re Mi down the street, but their steady crackdown on people (like me and my friends) who bring in our own alcohol has started to get annoying. I understand it's not their fault, but how can you do karaoke sober?  Anyway, a friend told me about Playground, where they bring the drinks (and food, if you want it) to you. Holla! The staff were SO NICE. We made last minute reservations and they were totally accommodating. When our room was ready, the hostess led the way upstairs with tambourines! And when I had a remote control-related accident that left me with a bleeding finger, she bandaged me right up.  Minus one star for not having Phil Collins "Against All Odds" on the songbook.  Night owls take note -- they close at 2:00, so be prepared to take the party elsewhere.

89zvxOob_y1bCuFBBnk1xg.review_text: We went there for my friend Golden birthday. It was a great fun. Food was ok. My favorite is the Fried Chicken wings -  sauce was de-licious.  Minus one star - the karaoke room was a bit small for a group of 12.

mMqGnoQgsivB8ZvSsvnIIw.review_text: i've drank here, but finally i was able to eat here.    the food is GOOD.  somewhat pricey, but GOOD.  the seafood pancake is actually crunchy.  spread that news.  i was happy.

8pONVRF4HDD9ynt5lCynTQ.review_text: 4 stars for Yoju. It is Soju and yogurt and it is divine. Playground serves it and may very well have invented it for all I know. Aside from the Yoju, which looks like milk, goes down like milk, but will eff your sh*t up like Everclear, Playground is a karaoke/drinking/dining establishment that harkens back to the neon-loving 80s. The space is cold and cozy all at the same time and the decor manages to be cafeteria meets massage parlor.
