I am the owner and if you don't like the prices here, then you can leave." She then kept going on and on how she has been the owner of this place for over 8 years blah blah blah! She made all 10 of us sitting at the bar feel very uncomfortable and unwanted at her "establishment of 8 years"!   Afterwords, I mentioned to the owner that she should have handled the situation differently because she made it very awkward for everyone sitting down enjoying the night. She had no remorse at all and stuck her nose up in the air like she was better than us.   I WILL NOT RETURN!!!!!! And I do not support any restaurant in this beautiful city who treat their customers in such a manor.   Thanks for nothing other than my over priced Jameson shot!

pez58jYmfV99KfqGKm2_JQ.review_text: Playground is awesome - AWESOME!  Each time I go there, the service is great and the food is DELICIOUS. The staff is always super nice, they greet you when you come in, and make sure you have everything you need during your meal. To make things even better, Janet already knows what my boyfriend and I will order before we even sit down. That is what you call customer service - she remembers us! Not to mention that our drinks are always full, and by the end of our meal, we're stuffed and completely satisfied!  If it's your first time at Playground, you have to try our favs! - the Spicy Tofu Soup and the Kalbi (BBQ Short Ribs). If you're just sitting at the bar, try the Yogurt Soju. They have other flavors, but that's usually the most popular, and tastes great. If you have a big party or want to celebrate a special occasion, they also offer private karaoke rooms if you want to sing the night away.  And before you leave, don't forget the frozen yogurt topped with Fruity Pebbles. It's the perfect dessert!

cHm5HisPvZ1E03xWoHfXig.review_text: So yes, it has food, drinks and karaoke, but bad drinks + bad karaoke selection and ghetto TV does not make a good karaoke bar.  Might be a good idea if you want to have all three at one place, but honestly you're better off going to two or three different places instead. The flavored soju was sickly sweet and had about about a thimballs worth of alcohol for the entire (L) size container. Seriously you'd need to drink the whole think unless you're a featherweight.  Song selection (at least english) is weak. Tried to find a few half dozen of my "regular" songs that I normally do at other places and no luck finding them here. Sad sad sad :(

djEp2FHWmr2WxqR2_349ag.review_text: Probably the worst meal I've ever had. My partner also had one of the worst meals in his life.  And it wasn't cheap. The service was apathetic and nonexistent. The décor was also nonexistent and the general ambience was pretty trashy.  All kinds of bad. One of the five at our table had a good dish/meal and that would be the 1 star.

H-gcQo3NjAdQuyOWiq7gmQ.review_text: good korean drinking place! the food is pretty good too~ i haven't tried the karaoke action but i was pretty impressed with the food. i ate al tang (fish egg soup) and it's the perfect companion to soju... (def getting it again next time). tried other random dishes which were all very tasty... and i love cheese corn :)   good vibe. reminds me of a typical korean drinking spot - tv's, neon lights, hehe. not sure how crowded it gets during the weekends cuz i've only been there on the weekdays. i'll be back here soon ;)

sfnxai2jUNezZDyL59xEww.review_text: A bunch of my co-workers (5) and I went out to this place for the very 1st time 3 months ago after our company dinner. we rented a private room for Karaoke.  After about 1 hour into our session, they told us that they are going to shut down in 15 mins and we must check out.  At check out, the owner told  us that there is a 2 drinks minimum per guest policy that we have no idea when we checked in. We each have a drink, and refused to pay for the minimum requirement.  And on top of that, the charge were for 7 drinks total.  We asked her why? and requested her to readjust the bills.  She refused.  We went up to our room to count the empty glasses.  There was 6 empty glasses seating on the table.  The owner then told us that the bus boy had came up and removed one of the empty glass while we were in there.  We then got really upset, because it wasn't about the money, it was about the integrity and since we felt that she was lying to our faces...we continued to argue with her.  Her husband came out and started to threaten us and used foul language toward us.  One of my coworkers threaten to Yelp them.  As soon as she heard that, she started to change her attitude.  She started to cry and told us that her mom was really sick and she has to take over the family business.... and we should not do that to a small business.  We paid what we had used...and left.  IT WAS AN AWFUL EXPERIENCE.  I would never come back to this place ever again.  I've read a lot of good comments for this place on here.  It is definately not so good to me.  =(

PvBmRN4suldo06Kcz2-vcw.review_text: Food is hella good for the price.  $12 for over 15 bigass pieces of fried chicken wings.  So hot and delicious.  Spicy as hell clear cold noodles burn my mouth for about 2.5 hours.  Soju is very good too.  Great prices overall.  Very few karaoke rooms but the rooms are very roomy.  I will definitely come back.  Nice!

DIHs2-aq6hzSLQzxPggBvg.review_text: Maybe it's because we brought a group here on a weekday night, but the ambiance was dead. There were 2 other tables and the tv was showing nothing but Korean music videos (which was probably the coolest part of the place).   The restroom is brightly lit, clean, properly sized, and has a clear mirror - probably the best part of the place.

uAwy4iYoUkL8Jm_lTTWP7A.review_text: Friend wanted to come here after getting some dinner so we head on over.  Parking was actually relatively easy for a Saturday night (past 12am though).  It's located on the second floor across the mini mall.  Inside, the decor reminds me of a pho place with the tables on the side, with a bar taking a large portion of the left side.  They also have several booths to hold larger groups.  They had two screens and a projector showing a mix of kpop and american pop  music videos, which was entertaining to watch.  We sat down and debated whether to get the strawberry soju, or strawberry yogurt soju.  But decided to just stick to the first.  We ordered a large ($25) and the smalls range $13 - $15.  The order came out relatively quickly and cups of water.  However, my cup of water must have had a hole because the water was leaking around our table.  And one of the shot glasses had a large crack in it, but it wasn't leaking surprisingly.    The soju was pretty good, though comparative to tonight soju bar, it wasn't as strong in fruit flavor.  But it did come in a larger container.  They also gave a small bowl of the asian cracker snack.    Overall, an environment to hang out with friends at night with a loud, entertaining atmosphere and a variety of soju drinks.  Will have to try the food next time, it actually looks pretty good.

B3vYatKOep4pl7X7KpG_6g.review_text: I'm always on the lookout for places that serve jam-bong since I am always told it's Chinese food by the staff (it's not =P)  So when I saw that Playground had jam-bong, I knew I had to try it. It was surprisingly spicy and came with half of a crab which is something I had not seen before. Typically, I eat at Secret Garden in Sunnyvale when I have a craving for jam-bong but this place was pretty good. I would definitely eat here again.  M really liked the complimentary corn and cheese plate but the kalbi was overly sweet. Dialing back on the sugar for that would be good. Other than that, it was a very satisfactory meal!

xyTgJUyW9nPV1wbnr9u-_A.review_text: - Tasty Korean dishes such as fish cake in chili sauce, pork dumplings, and chicken with cheese (trust me and try it!) CHECK - Pitchers of delicious thirst quenching QB and Hite after a hot SF day CHECK - The latest song lists from Billboards Top 40 (Love in this club by usher, feedback by janet) CHECK - Singing in the comfort of a tiny room with 20 of your friends AND not being shy about it.. PRICELESS

hgWgaJWa9Q5wGrOcLpXy8w.review_text: I'm not exactly sure where the 4-star ratings come from. As soon as you walk in there is men's bathroom that reeks of bathroom cleaner. And then the hostess gets up from her seat at the bar to welcome us and seat as a table. I already felt like leaving, but my craving of Korean food led me to stay. One waiter, tall guy, was having an off day, throwing down a pitcher of iced water and two cafeteria plastic cups. I ordered #62, kimchi/cabbage soup and Dave had the bulgogi. What a disaster, the small plates that you get in the beginning were just blah and not even filling. Cheese corn straight from the microwave, seriously!?! At least, put the microwave in the kitchen where no one can see it.  Anyway, the food was very below par that I didn't even take home the enormous amount of leftover soup that I had.  If you really want the taste of good Korean food, head out to SSF to Mama's Tofu House, it's so worth the drive. Oh and by the way, what the heck is up with the club radio music while your eating on a Tuesday night??

MRecA685rcM7Z0IVwBnpMw.review_text: My "go to" place when I was living in SF. There's nothing NOT to like about this place. Service is awesome. Food is great. Drinks are fabu (esp. Yogurt soju). I love the fact that they play kpop videos all the time, so there's something to look at :) Also, parking is easy so you don't have to worry about the usual parking situation in SF -- there's a garage nearby. Keep up the good work guys!

sOhv5LHFsyf8t1JpgnocMQ.review_text: Korean restaurant/bar in Japantown. The waiter didn't know what a pina colada was when I asked. It was fun trying soju for the first time.

O4JCYAe3AuOalyJ8lNL0DA.review_text: I haven't been here in a while but every time I've gone it has been good times. Be prepared for loud music videos playing on multiple TV's while you drink lots of soju and enjoy great Korean food.  Some of my favorites are. . . Ohdengtang (An assortment of fish cakes in a hot broth) Dooboo Kimchi (Boiled tofu, stir-fried kimchi, and pork) Kan Poong Prawns (Deep fried prawns battered in a sweet and spicy garlic sauce)  Other good choices are the pot stickers and fried chicken.

MuBI8loK61lNv_aAp-Iz2g.review_text: Like Toyose? I'm down!  This joint isn't as homey and cozy as Toyose, but the food is definitely better. After reading about all the rave of the fried chicken, and telling all my friends that accompanied me about it, we had to get it. I think I hyped it up for all of us. They all looked at me and said.... "ahh... Sue, they aren't that good." Their criticism about them was that it was too crispy?! Can chicken be too crispy? Hehe so the whole night I held onto the fact that they were GOOD. So I ate most of it... and to prove my point, I even took the leftovers home. And I proved to them that they would still taste good and crispy the next day.  Attentive wait staff and overall a fun place to eat & drink. It was a bit on the loud side though.

ccfVsl7SZeK-2Ixc2-anuQ.review_text: Special shout out to Leo who took great care of us last night.  We stopped in for a quick drink before dining next door.  Pretty sure the boyfriend got 4 drinks for one for no good reason.  Prompt, attentive, no frill service. Thanks Leo for getting our party started!

MyqswXs8OUbbHG92hRYe2A.review_text: The karaoke and food are fine, the BS part is that they charge you 17% gratuity, not only on the food they deliver to your booth, BUT ON THE ENTIRE BILL, without telling you in advance.  So when they quote you $30/hr for the room, it's not actually $30/hr, it's $35.  This isn't really a huge deal, but I don't like companies that make a business out of CHEATING their VERY OWN CUSTOMERS.  Just tell me the room is $35, don't tell me it's $30 when it's not.  It's just not right, so this place gets 1 star.

088SkMN7Hjn2vK2MEUfc3Q.review_text: Too much fun at Playground.  Of course, by "fun," I mean "flavored soju."  I spent yesterday evening at Playground in a private karaoke room.  The room was nice enough, the staff was extremely courteous and prompt, and the prices were great (private room + food + endless soju was about $40 / person).  The karaoke list was extensive, the sound and karaoke systems were both excellent.  All in all, a great way to spend an evening with friends.    My only two knocks against this place:  1)  The food kinda sucked.  Example:  we were served a chicken and cheese dish that looked like a 21-year old bachelor's wet dream, except it was cry-your-eyes-out spicy, the chicken was barely warm and the cheese was chewy.  It's a karaoke bar, so no big foul here.  2)  Playground really maximizes the space it was built in, which is a nice way of saying there are short ceilings and weird angles everywhere.  I had to bend over in the private room to sing, and again while doing my thing in the restroom.  Heads up.

lCkqOtZZ_Sz_WKThOjakMQ.review_text: I live in SD and my boyfriend is up in SF, I make him take me here at least once everytime I visit.   What we order everytime is: La bokki (sp?) and fried dumplings  Those are the staples i have to get. Let me warn you now, that their food is EXTREMELY spicy. Not bearable spicy, but crazy spicy. I have to always ask them to make the weakest spice level they can, and when they do its still spicy, but the perfect amount.  I think mentioning the staff is super important too. They're always friendly and sweet. I can't say that I try "different" foods all the time, and they've never been the one to make me feel awkward about asking questions or for their suggestions. My favorite part is that they're open late, about 2am on weekends they still serve food.   Even better, when you finish your meal there is a karaoke place around the corner thats open till about 4 or 5am. So you can end your night there burning off those calories from playground :)

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: I came here for a friend's birthday party and it was pretty fun. The only thing "bad" about the experience was that it was very crowded. But then again, that only means that this place is crackin'.  Flavored Soju, korean food goodness, karaoke rooms--this place provides a legit group kick-it spot.  Located in good old Japantown SF, you won't be too bored if you come here during regular daylight hours since other spots will be open. I guess not 5 stars since it was too crowded and maybe the karaoke rooms could be a little more user friendly.  FLAVORED SOJU!

s16-BUo-orUsELvMu5ocKg.review_text: My friend had her birthday dinner here. She chose the place because it was close to where we were going for karaoke and it looked nice in the pictures. She spent the entire night apologizing for making us come here.  We got:  - Noodles with seafood soup: Not bad. Arrived piping hot, which was perfect for the chilly night. They didn't skimp on the seafood either. - Seafood pancake: Greasy grossness with barely any seafood. - BBQ Chicken: Good - Beef ribs: Rubbery - Lychee soju: Generous  But it wasn't the food that was so bad. It was the general grimy decor. It was the dirty furniture and floor. It was the loud, crazy K-pop videos being played on full blast, which--entertaining as they were--were just annoying after a while. The service was okay, but that didn't really make up for everything else. Don't come here.

fXPtIqn_sZmowOqDI921jQ.review_text: Me and my friends keep going back to Playground cause they have the best Korean food in Japan Town and they also serve Soju!  We don't get the mixed drinks, instead we just order the Soju from the bottle *one more Soju please!*..  One thing that's for sure we ALWAYS get great service here..  I love the fact that they give you this dish with corn and cheese on it..  Who in their right mind would have thought of such a concoction?  Surprisingly it tastes awesomely good!!  I can't get enough of it..  I've been coming here since they've opened and I've pretty much have tired every single one of their dishes and I can not come up with any bad things to say about them, all i can say is that I LOVE EVERY THING ON THEIR MENU!!!   The owner Janet and bar manager Jin are always pleasantly happy and sweet & easy to chat with..  They're always cracking jokes while they work..   I suggest you go early cause all the seats before you know it, gets filled up! If you're brave, try the Soju by itself in the bottle!

h9AS6_xuu_9U058y-cYgRQ.review_text: My friend introduced us to this place:  restaurant on bottom, karaoke on top.  Whats cool is that you can order your alcohol and food from upstairs karaoke room and they will bring it to you.  Room is a bit small, but fine for a group out with friends, good selection of songs.  The food was ok, have had better Korean, but we only ordered three items, so not fair to judge.  The beer was good.  Service was good too, which worked for the mandatory 18% gratuity if you use the upstairs service.  Nice location too.

UOqoUs7Jjy0e94JF8Fv43Q.review_text: We threw a karaoke party here last month for 20 people.  We went on a Saturday so the place was packed!  We were able to squeeze everyone in.  The food service was quick and friendly.  The drinks were reasonably affordable, and yummy!  We liked the jia-jianmyun the best!    We will definitely go again!

d8z9uG3SHTgkCNj5iVcG8w.review_text: I've been here a couple times for nights out with colleagues, and I always have a great time at this place. The rooms are narrow and intimate, and has a general jankiness to them that encourage you to knock back a few Hites or some yogurt soju and just have a great time. The drinks are strong, the food is greasy, and the songs are mostly Korean or from the 90's (or earlier). Everyone that works here is extremely nice, friendly, and accommodating.   This is not the place to maintain your dignity. Just grab that mic, put some Seal in the lineup, and rock out. :-)

hFvLaKDNHMxHze13Hd-FZQ.review_text: This karaoke joint is a step up from Do Re Mi because they offer alcohol and food--be careful though, b/c the prices add up quickly.  We had our private room which fit 12 of us and we sang, danced, and tambourined the night away!

4XpJ4HKD5OQ3H5Gy330CkA.review_text: Yummy sojus and Korean dishes, karaoke rooms that can hold groups of 15 or so, and a full bar--what's not to love about Playground? And is why it gets 5 stars!   I've been to my share of karaoke places in SF and LA, and have to say, I think Playground is pretty much one of the best in the city.  Here's a breakdown (most) of the food and drink:   * Soju - The yogurt and lychee are some of the best I've ever had. Though the lychee was better, and didn't appear too potent.   * Fried chicken wings (w/ and w/out spicy sauce) - YUM!! Both were perfectly crispy and seasoned well. The sauce ones battle the ones from one of my fave late night Korean eateries...like how it wasn't so tangy, and just spicy.  Orders were generous, too!  * Kimchee pancake - Perfectly fried and not so doughy. One order was huge, that our big group could have gotten away w/ ordering just one since we had so many other dishes.   * Deokbokki - Another dish done JUST right. Spicy, but not overly so where I was burning my tongue, and the bean cakes and fish cakes were the right texture.   * Jap chae - Our group of 15 KILLED 3 orders. We could have easily ordered a 4th one because it was such a favorite. Overall pretty tasty.   * Access to a pretty full bar - Mentioned this last because it's a big deal when karaoke places especially for the ones in J-town where drinks are typically limited to soju and beer (or some you have to sneak it in..haha).   Service was efficient and fairly quick. The phone to call instead of going downstairs or waiting for them to come to your room is a nice touch.    Song selection was pretty extensive with a fair amount of new releases in terms of American language songs. There were also menus and menus of Korean, Chinese and even Filipino songs (I guess they do like to sing karaoke, too!). The menu selection/programing wasn't too hard to figure out, though we had a designated programer who's a regular at Playground.   There you have it--go to Playground because as far as I can tell it might be the best karaoke room/bar in the city, and the prices are fair. You can dine in the dining area, and just have drinks there, too.

wIGSDVyGPDK28JyVJS1jqw.review_text: I had a party with more than 20 people. I booked a private room here for wedding celebration and had a lot of fun.Everybody  really enjoyed the food, the yogurt soju was tasty. Peoples was so friendly :)  I had great time with all!!!

K6Ac8aERfRtIilNoNAVneQ.review_text: what can i say about this place?  this place has the best food! just simply perfect! especially the corn w/ cheese =] the soju is just as perfect ... all of the flavors tastes so good. the employees are all really nice, and the owner was really friendly too! the perfect "playground" for anyone (over 21)! =]

tkcUGC5N4WvUPlSG-KCfhw.review_text: Came here for a late night dinner. they do check your id before you go inside this restaurant/bar place since its only for 21 and over since theres a sign by the door.   they had few tables for those who want to eat in or you can sit at bar area if you just want to drink. They have tv that either shows sport or korean/american music videos  There was five of us and they gave us the smallest table since one long table had reservation and the other one, there was already a large group so our table didnt have much space to put the drinks and foods that we had.  Food was not bad and good amount of flavors. Also had yogurt and strawberry soju. The soju were alright but its cool to go with your food. but it was kinda pricy here.

XEVm7cP9BpRzkZ4ZjZN2-g.review_text: Probably my most favorite korean bar evaaaaaa!!!!! i just got home from here and its like 5:30am! i been here tons of times before and i dont know why im finally writing a review now, probably cuz im super drunk riught now dammmn soju....but this place is so badass, itll cut ya and tell its friends about how bad it cut you.................omg, these sentences arent even makin sense to me........  this place owns me.....i am its beezy......im drunk this place is amazing....

NWLr8je2UcnotzUV7md-wA.review_text: OK, maybe I was in the wrong place but having traveled extensively to Korea, I was in the mood for some good Korean food - and I didn't find it here. I suspected we were in trouble when we walked up the stairs and were greeted with "Korean Fusion" - fusion with what? I was about to find out.   From the sickly kimchee sides to the overly cooked and greased up main courses, it was a ghost of what I was use to from my travels. I would say it was fusion between Korean cuisine and the local McDonald's. Hell even the bean paste had more of the consistency of spicy ketchup than the nutty heat I was use to. Bean paste, come on guys, you can buy quality a few blocks away at the local Korean market.   The ambiance was equally cheesy with bad neon and vinyl seats. I know the place doubles as a Karaoke bar, but I've been in Karaoke bars in Korea (and sung with the best drunken business man) and this place misses by a mile.   The only reason I did not resort to a 1-star was that the wait staff did a good job with food coming out in a reasonable pace and was attentive to our needs. Too bad they had so little to work with.   If you are looking for authentic Korean cuisine/ambiance, it's not here.

2Yg3D3xUNNzmn-SicXZOnA.review_text: The review is for their food & drinks:  Drinks: The soju is $13 for a small jug, but it's pretty strong! But they have lots of different kind of beers and variety of soju flavors.   Food: Not worth the price. Things just don't taste right. The jap chae is flavorful but it only has noodle, a few beef pieces and zuchinni. At least the noodle is chewy. The rice cake, on the other hand, was overcooked. It was mushy so it doesn't stick to the sauce very well. The sauce was watery, so the dish in general just doesn't hold together. At the end of the night, I was super thirsty. The meat was meh...  Service: It was decent. The waiter checked on the table and refilled our water.   Go for karaoke and drinks, but not the food.

gIW9xElVgqEf2p2HaUur8g.review_text: 110% legit.  Leo & co. really know their stuff. Pitchers of "YOJU" and HD K-Pop videos are a recipe for delicious disaster. Five stars.

5DpllyqfSIflTtsMCSZf8w.review_text: GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE!!  I've been here a few times, and it's always fun.  But the other night, I was blown away.   It started w/ just a few of us.. we were seated at one of the booths in the middle.  We had a couple more friends coming, but we figured the squeeze wouldn't be too bad.  When our friends came.. and they walked over to say "Hi" to us, I noticed the waiters were ready with chairs for them.  WE DIDN'T EVEN HAVE TO ASK! We didn't end up needing the chairs because there were only two of them, so we fit pretty comfortably in the booth.  But later, a handful of people came, and right when they walked over to us, the waiters put another table next to ours and gave them all chairs.  again, WE DIDN'T EVEN HAVE TO ASK!! like WOW, talk about anticipating what the customer needs.  We ordered a couple of plates.  the Chicken is a MUST- so bomb.  And also the ketchup fried rice.  We ordered some other stuff too, but those were the too that I remembered. After we finished all the food, we were only drinking but the waiter still brought side dishes out for us.    I LOVE a place with great food but i LA LA LA LOVEEEE a place with GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE, and this place definitely takes the cake.  Cheers Playground.

rS3LKYDr-IvF1bgpuWomww.review_text: OK the bar for Karaoke must be really low if this place gets 4stars...  Wow flashback ... to south of the border. TIJUANA...  youngsters stuffed in a hollow business store front with the BARE basics of decoration. The owners clearly splurged on the capital costs here... they opted not for the flashing Xmas lights and IKEA office second hand slightly damaged throw backs.  FYI If you are thinking of eating here (cant imagine anyone would) while waiting for cocktails I happened to notice a tray of appetizers waiting for eager mouths, sitting on top of old dirty bins next to the dish washer...  Health department gods where are you? Scary... but then again looking at the demographics of the clientele... if its hot and fills the belly they wont care...   Re the actual Karaoke experience. It would have been great if we had a Korean interpreter as the song book was 75% in Korean for classic Korean tunes... but we were able to figure out. Here is the weird part... the video entertainment for our selection of classic tunes was to say the least bizarre. It appeared to be a random collection of home travel movies with the family. The sync with lyrics was ok and the booth we had was cool as it insulated the teen scene below from our hideous renditions.  I have to say the service here was really great! Very nice people and friendly.

BI_PXSF5M61S8O9bqR7VVA.review_text: Located in Japantown (WTF, amirite), this Korean restaurant/bar/karaoke joint is pretty chill and the food's not so bad either.  PROS: - everything we ordered came out super hot and freshly made - kimchi jigae with pork: extremely tasty - never ending side dishes - clean, lounge like setting and dining tables - atmosphere was chill - servers were sweet - patronage was diverse (but still was 90% Korean)  CONS: - tofu soon dooboo (literally said that on the menu) with seafood was alright, I wish it was spicier - Bimbapitybapbap or whatever lacked flavor - food took forever (probably because they were still making it) - prices were higher than expected  I really liked this place overall though. If you have good company, good food and throw in a few drinks, you got yourself one good party :)  Plus I think I saw a working lady with a customer on the street, knowhatimsayin?? HOLLER.

2JeI_lY2OyPM-kfa4yZufw.review_text: Frequented this place before I became a SF resident. And come once in a while when I crave some over-priced soju. As far as the cuisine goes, not bad for bar food. There is a very delicious  there. Deep fried spicy and sweet chicken... *drooling right now*..  As far as the atmosphere, it is the typical K-bar where they got K-music videos playing on the screens. If i had to choose a K-bar in all of SF, this would be probably one of two places I would choose to indulge at. The other being The Spot because it is closer to my apartment. All in all, a good time with good company... And lots and lots of Soju and food you shouldn't be eating at that time of the night....

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: Three words: lemon soju cocktail. Yes, it comes in a large carafe (even if you get the "small").

5XRG6tdp2IEJYwOZU4jw4Q.review_text: Came here twice for some friends' birthdays.  The staff were very accommodating and attentive.  Some sort of non-spicy chicken dish and the seafood pancake were favorites amongst the table.  I personally really like the dok bokki + ramen dish.    The yogurt sojus are definitely a hit, however I suggest avoiding the pineapple flavor.  I wish I had more money to indulge in this place because this place is quite pricey.   Then again, all the other korean restaurants in the city charge around the same prices.

gRo0WTCYS90MSSs3oPT_sQ.review_text: I really like Playground despite the fact that I'm at least 15 years older than the average underage Korean there.  But hey, makes me feel like I'm back in college... er... high school... er...   Anyway, the food.  If you order the right items on the menu, it's actually quite authentic (in an LA Koreatown sort of way) - at least to my Korean-American taste buds.  It's drinking food for sure, but also pretty good without the drunken haze.  For that reason, if I'm craving Korean food in SF, I skip Brother's and head here instead.  Unless of course I'm craving soondoobu (My Tofu House) or jajangmyun (ZaZang Noodle).  If I want real kalgooksoo or soojebi, unfortunately I have to haul my ass 45 miles south to Santa Clara... ugh.  Four stars for: - cheeeesy corn (not authentic... but oddly addictive) - haemul pajun (seafood pancake) - ahl-tang (fish egg stew) - kanpoong shrimp - candy-coated goodness - yogurt soju by the carafe-ful - lots of banchan (side dishes) - food AND drink delivered to your karaoke room unlike Do Re Mi - the hilarious dance-dance-revolution DVDs playing on the wall - better than average service (but at a Korean restaurant, that's not saying much)  Minus one for: - questionable health code adherence / cleanliness?  Guess that's what all the alcohol is for.

TMb1kJaTlB9nkrIFHfdJMg.review_text: We were looking for karaoke but we told all the rooms were booked for the night. It was still pretty early in the night, like 10ish, and so our group sat down at one of their loungey tables. I ordered a round of birthday cake shots to celebrate our friend's birthday, and they took SO LONG to make them. I watched the bartender serve all these other people standing at the bar, and did not see any signs of them assembling our drinks. After a while, we got up from our table and was going to leave after politely canceling our order, since we hadn't really committed to staying, but the girl stopped us and said they were making our drinks now. So we embarrassingly sat back down.  I was almost afraid they screwed up the drinks because I thought the drink might be a little obscure, or maybe they took so long because they were looking up the recipe online. Then there was an issue with splitting the check because two people didn't have cash so they had to use their cards. The issue was that they charged both of them gratuity because we were a party of 6, and I guess our cash hadn't totaled up to be enough to cover? I don't know what it was, but it caused some unnecessary confusion.  The only thing I like are the sofas. They also play a loop of obscure hip & hop karaoke videos on the tvs in the bar area, and sometimes a familiar jam comes on and it's like heyyy but most times, it's like oh I've heard of this artist, but not this song. Don't know if it's a positive or negative thing.

sjXC5pTebfGMZzP-9fpxTw.review_text: If you are reading this, send me a compliment with your favorite song(s) to sing at karaoke!  And this is USEFUL

8vFhSzle6ZhkxmRR3pJeyg.review_text: 4 Stars for the yogurt soju as always. I didn't drink the night I went sadly but I've been before...and it's always frickin awesome. Only downside to this place is the Noraebang rooms are cramped and small. Head down the peninsula and you'll find bigger and more venues beyond the usual doremi etc. Large Korean community in Campbell/Saratoga area...

8JC0TnD1YQMTMyAOuDM56Q.review_text: What a chill place to come and eat delicious Korean food.  There's music videos playing all around which can be entertaining to look up every so often and see whats up. Because it was a weeknight, there weren't that many people but usually it is pretty packed on weekends. The lighting is dim so it had a nice feel to it.  I ordered the Dolsot Bibimbab: rice, mixed vegetables, beef, and egg served in a hot stove with spicy chili paste on the side (except I didn't have them put the chili paste on the side since I can't handle spicy). After getting it, I mixed it so the egg would cook. It tasted so good and I would definitely order this again. At $12.99 it was super affordable compared to everything else on the menu. I was filled!  Service was okay. It could have felt more attentive but our waiter did fulfill any of our requests instantly.

IXRn1P87sCJqysvIpPuUYw.review_text: You can eat and order drinks in the rooms!  Most people come to Playground because its a restaurant but...I didn't get to try much of the food  though besides the jjajang myun (black bean noodles) and fried shrimp...both were good.  I also drank some HITE beer for the first time (Korean beer) and had some yogurt soju (yoju)...tasty but light.  Oyea we ordered from the room with a wall-phone...thats cool too.  When you can sing, drink and eat food without getting hungry or threatened for revealing alcohol, it's good times.

HvTX6puYk3_PXdIBF5tRGQ.review_text: I love karaoke! I went to The Playground with a group of friends and it was truly a great time. I thought the wait for a private room was a bit long, but I realized why once we had our own. They have every song that you can think of! I'm a jukebox-a-holic so this was like the ultimate jukebox experience for me, but no dollars required. The best part was the telephone, which you can use to call in orders for anything on the menu. I had a really great time and I will definitely go back.

1PLvmn-kHIkLeaUvIh6QXQ.review_text: This is perhaps one of the only places where you can get a private karaoke room and bottle service in Japan Town. (unless you go to that hostess bar in the shopping mall...)  $150 for a bottle of Grey Goose. (cheap for bottle service). JjaJjangMyun and chicken wings are good here. Yogurt soju is by far the best of the cocktail soju. Call ahead to reserve a room, otherwise you won't get one. For some reason, by the time it hits 1 AM, this place is dead.  Anyways, I stopped going here as much as I used to. Even though the ahjuma (woman owner) is super nice and always gives me free bottles of cocktail soju and fruit dishes, I always end up spending way too much (hence, the "service" -- yes, Korean people call free shit, "service", no wonder I'm so cheap). Give me a Karaoke room with bottle service and Korean food and there will be no question that the bill will be astronomical by the end of the night. I've had to take out lines of credit to cover those bills! Nevertheless, Playground holds a special place in my heart.

6xDSz1Gwz7Rfhzvb3I26Ew.review_text: Worst service i ever experienced in my life. They wanted to kick us out because we did not tip them fast enough, which of course made me not want to tip at all. You work for your tip, you dont bully it out of a 5'2" girl. Ive never had worse service in my life. Completely outrageous and dishonorable staff and morale. I actually tipped the bouncer because he was kind enough to help my friend. When i have a friend in need, im going to make sure they are alright. That is my priority. They had no concern for that. If i wasn't bullied i'd give a tip. I paid to cover everyone but a guy who did not even serve us just could not wait even a few minutes. Don't think you'll confront me and I'll cower. Ridiculous and offensive. No breeding and no etiquette.

nRMB2o31I4Tvcak4wALfww.review_text: Full confession: I've only been here twice. But both times (in the last two weeks!) have been absolutely memorable, no doubt because of the endless carafes of yogurt soju brought into our private karaoke rooms. Yes, you heard that right.  Dinner: Don't go for the standard kalbi / bulgogi you find in every other Korean restaurant; go for what sounds unfamiliar. The food is great, but it's the kind of spicy that knocks impatiently at your door the next morning, know what I'm saying? And that corn and melted cheese concoction they give you for free? It's probably good for you -- but only in a cosmic sense.  Karaoke: okay -- it's not the kind of selection you get with those expensive MagicSing contraptions, but you don't get served soju at home. Still: private room, disco ball, an actual tambourine you can shake, particularly at that "And I need you now tonight [cha-ching!] / And I need you more than ever [cha-ching!]" bridge of Bonnie Tyler's "Total Eclipse of the Heart," and you've got it made. Tons of English, Japanese (Tommy february6 even!), Korean, Vietnamese, Tagalog, and Indonesian songs.  (Hint: Check out the Tagalog songs, because it somehow includes Fiction Factory's "Feels Like Heaven" for all you New Wavers out there.) Pack a room with friends, and at 30 bucks an hour, it's a relative steal.  Soju: good lord, the flavors. Yogurt, lemon, strawberry, plain, and more -- all sufficient to make a tonedeaf person like me pick up the mic and try to sing Franz Ferdinand's "Take Me Out" and *nail it*. That's what Playground does to you.

awmRirDC7WWig6R07XZ_oA.review_text: If you're on the tart frozen yogurt bandwagon, stop at Playground.  (My stars are for the frozen yogurt only.)

Zh7gNT9VChCOkZ37pzj2cw.review_text: I come here too much  Why? Because theres a good vibe, good food, drinks are good too! Prices add up when you're having fun but thats okay!  They got karaoke upstairs at about $30/hour  Flavored Soju is good because its a creeper!  Soju Bombs will eff u up. If u got some lightweight friends, stick with the soju if not the bartender can make excellent drinks! Just dont yack inside plz!  Good food, i love the fried chickens and beef, the bulgogi is pretty good as well.. The Waiters and waitresses are very nice and sweet. Too many people come here I think the stairs are breaking.

5BW1LlhBw2YzA5NdqvF6Xw.review_text: best korean food ive ever had. the owners are super nice as well. they always hook it up for me and treat me like family. i usually dont do reviews but they run a good restaurant. foods good and service is excellent. you may want to make reservations if your worried about waiting though. =)

I-xzzSC6yu9Pm47-DkvY7w.review_text: I like playground for what it is.  It's a Korean drinking place with good chicken.  Yes there is music videos playing and yes it can get loud... but that's what it's supposed to be.

0nZE-lIbYwPFcIHuBUkFWA.review_text: so I had my 21st birthday here last night and I have to say I had the best birthday ever thanks to this place! :) It's good for big groups of people because you can order as much soju as you want and be loud without having to worry about cops coming. mmm! the yogurt soju is off the hooook and their food is pretty delicious. Not to mention the corn with melted cheese on top is amazing and the service there is spectacular, they gave us free plates of appetizers on the house... the owners mom is so sweet! =) yeah point is I got wasted here and had the best time drinking/eating here with my friends :) definitely coming back!!

r1npFsFHayAdfeQjeXFSvA.review_text: Great place to hang out, relax, and eat some delicious Korean food.  CLEANLINESS: 4/5 SERVICE: 4/5 FOOD: 4/5 - Yogurt Soju - OB Beer - Bul-go-gi  We initially came here just to drink some soju and beer, but we ended up ordering a dish of bulgogi. The bul-go-gi was really good. It was full of flavor and was not dry at all. It was moist and tasty. And of course the meal came with the mini Korean plates that they give you in the beginning of the meal. It was my first time seeing some kind of corn dish, but it was okay.   As for alcohol, we ordered a glass of yogurt soju and a "pitcher" (more like huge bottle) of OB beer. It was my first time having yogurt soju, and I have to say it was pretty good. I'm not a big fan of hard liquor, such as soju by itself, so this was a surprise to me. You can only taste a hint of the alcohol, which is what I prefer. Then we had some Korean beer, which was similar to Corona... but better.   The location of this place is sort of hidden in the Japantown buildings, but it's on the top floor which is nice. It's a pretty small place, so I assume this place can fill up quick. Overall, it was a chill place, and I had a good experience.

nyXNNLKjSWtDQka5PrFoew.review_text: Came here for dinner and throughout our meal only had 2 other patrons in the restaurant with us. I could see why Playground is only busy at night as a bar/lounge, given the full bar and mounted flat screen tvs playing Korean music videos. Establishment is hidden on the top floor of a dingy building, making it difficult to locate unless you knew exactly what you were looking for. The interior, seating, and tables were not in the best of shape and the food was decent but nothing spectacular...although I did enjoy their endless supply of side dishes.  Prices were a bit high but realized the food came in large family-sized portions meant to be shared. Service was quick but most likely because we were the only people dining.   Looks like I'll have to return one of these nights to try their soju after reading some of the high reviews on here about Playground being a great night spot...

tYOUMqP7dsMNYbZ9GGZEBQ.review_text: So I walk into this restaurant, and went into the restroom to wash my hands and after I do my thing and I turn around to walk out, a guy standing in line yaks on the ground right in front of me.  Yes, right in front of me!  Having no clue what to do, I stepped around the yak and walked out.  Beginning my experience would probably get one to wonder how I can even give this place 2 stars but besides the incident, the rest of the night was okay.  We got in around 12 or 1 I believe and the place was still pretty packed.  We just stopped by for food and some drinks.  The food wasn't all the great and my friend ordered this soup, bu dae jigae, which I have to say is the spiciest thing I've ever eaten.  Now I'm not very good with the spicy food in the first place, but my tongue was numb for three days after eating this and I couldn't taste food normally.  The rest of the stuff was okay but what I actually liked was their cheesy corn.  Weird combo but tasty!  Service was okay and it's open late.  If you're in the city arond Japan Town looking for some good cheesy corn at 1 am, it's worth checking out.  Otherwise I'm sure there's better spots.

-JAMkc2sq1C11Ul0hSJmHg.review_text: karoake only, did not try the food. my experience would have been better if it were not for the over zealous staff that kept interrupting our karoake session w. petty reminders on our tab. I would recommend getting the rooms that can accommodate up to 20 people; our group was wedged in the middle room which could barely fit 10-12. Drinks & song selection were decent (no Supertramp though :( bottom line is the service needs to try using a little tact and restraint, everything else was par for the course.

yAU4Zj6q1ov0VTUrjEwhOQ.review_text: We had a great time.  But the server didn't bring me back my credit card and after a night of drinking, I forgot to get it.  I woke up to hundreds of dollars of fradulent charges from the Playground on my credit card.  I called the place many, many times the next couple of days and the manager did not once come to the phone or return my calls.  Not cool Playground Management!

zN0L5F4Ng6d5FHAO_ME5cg.review_text: Chap chea & Short ribs....!  Early dinner spot for myself & the BF... Saturday evening Round 5pm and only one in the spot! Dark/club kinda vibe... Loud music playing & music videos playing on two screens - on of which a large projector. We ordered the short ribs and chap chae... Came with about 5 different side dishes. Ones I am not use to seeing at a Korean Resto - cream,cheese,& corn - Kim chi - some kind of potatoe salad? (not positive) and two plates of something else? Again not sure... Overall good spot. Would go again if in the area.

Y3QU8Jj3lYuVa2LmunvnRg.review_text: yogi ee suh? yogi ee suh suh? yogi ee suh? aigoo cham na~ I am here! This is my new k-home... oh yes it is... Well, at least until I find something better...   As I have mentioned in previous reviews... I'm a beer kinda girl... Or a soju kinda girl... even when I'm feeling damn good... I'm a bok tan joo kinda girl... I don't want your fancy schmancy food and drinks... give me lots and lots and lots of mekju and feed me budaejjigae, dduk bokki and kimchi bokeumbap...   And if you want to see my "O" face, make sure that there is a no rae bang close by so I can get my no rae bang on... Wait... What? Playground has a no rae bang upstairs?!~!   ASSSSSSSSSSSSSSSSA!!!   No, but seriously... Playground is my type of "playground"... I can see myself coming here for many years to come... If not for anything else, for the CHEESY CORN!!!!!!!!   Minus one star for the bathrooms... All that booze and you only got one stall for women?! mi che suh...
